review_body: They were very helpful from check in to check out. We checked out early to go to an early morning event, only to find out that it had been cancelled. The hotel was very accomdating with holding our luggage and providing us a place to shower and change even after we had checked out. The concierge was also very helpful in planning events. The only thing is if you're in Hawaii it'll be expensive! Very great service, everyone was always very friendly and helpful at all times! Breakfast was also very nice with plenty of options! Great choice for your money!

This seems to be an older property that was remodeled and our room looked good with modern styling. We were high up and actually got a corner room with a view that can't be beat. We could watch the surfers at Waikiki and also see all the way around to the canal behind. I would say that the bathroom is tight and it is difficult to get past the toilet to get into the tub but there is a grab bar. Other than that, it is a good hotel with a large breakfast area and friendly front desk people. The pool area is nice but on the 5th floor so not really a view from there. There is putt putt and shuffle board that were used by families. We sat there to relax after a long day of sightseeing so we did not mind the late afternoon shade. The hotel is slightly further from the Waikiki beach but those hotels are higher price and beach was not part of our plans.

The place is in the heart of Waikiki. Before we even planned going to Honolulu, I have searched for a reasonable hotel with good rating and breakfast included. And this was it. I joined us for their club member rate. It’s basically the same as local rates and senior rates. Except these one, we’ll earn points. We got to the hotel, went straight to the parking lot on 2nd floor. Bring the parking ticket and head to Lobby. They will validate the ticket so you can leave anytime just place the barcode into the machine and the next time you come back, they see your car plate number in the camera, they just open. Parking fee was expensive though, $35 plus tax a day. Our room was great. We stayed at the 33rd floor and the wind was howling all the time. If you’re don’t mind it, it’s fine. If not, request for lower floors. The view was great too. Breakfast was awesome. Plenty of tables. Good selection of items. Staffs were so nice. Everyone were very friendly and helpful. We love it. Next time we come back Honolulu. We’re staying here again. Highly recommended!!!

We stayed here recently for 6 nights and booked 2 ocean view twin rooms.The rooms themselves were on the smaller side however we knew this prior to booking. The rooms were clean and presentable with most amenities you would need. The beds and pillows were quite comfortable and allowed for great sleeps following long days being a tourist! The air con however was like a truck parked next to the room.The property itself is looking a bit tired and in need of a face lift. Scuff marks on walls, worn furniture in lobby etc.We used the pool facilities once however the spa was only hot for one day out of the time we were there. Breakfast was nice and plenty of it!

Friendly staff, good service, small rooms but decorated nicely, our bed is comfy. But we are disappointed that the Jacuzzi is cold. We asked 3days in a row for them to heat it to only find out that this has been a on going issue. Which would have been nice to know instead being told we will reset it and our evening routine of changing clothes and heading to the hot tub, only to find it’s still ice cold. Fix the heater! We are on vacation we want to soak before bed!

We stayed at a Holiday Inn for our first time in San Diego and was pleasantly surprised. Our experience here was the same. The staff were all very nice from check in to check out. We chose this hotel because of the cost, the breakfast that is included, the jacuzzi, outdoor games (large chess, large shuffle board, the small mini putt course & the gaming room. When we arrived, It was as the pictures showed. There was no fooseball & no ping pong table. The pool water was ice cold! I only saw a few brave children go in. One disappointment was that they charge a resort fee of $25 a day. Not something I’d expect to pay at an Inn. I was upset because they did not inform me of that when I booked. Rooms: pretty small, but enough space for the 3 of us to be comfortable. Beds & pillows were comfortable. Better than some high end places we’ve stayed at. The ac was a minor inconvenience. It is a little louder than most window units. I did not like the fact that it turned on & off every once in awhile. I understand the reasoning behind that. But when it turns back on, it loud & startled me a few times. The shower head is a bit low. So if you’re taller than 5’8”, this will be an issue. Location: a little ways out from the heart of Waikiki. Not ideal when walking back late at night. But if you’re a family like us, we enjoy walking so it wasn’t much of an issue. Breakfast: not sure why some people are grumbling about a breakfast that’s included in the hotel room cost. It was a good breakfast. Everyday there was sausage patties, biscuits & gravy, yogurts, cinnamon rolls, pancakes, bread, muffins, bagels, cereal, juice & coffee. The main dishes changed daily. Bacon, link sausage, egg whites, scrambled eggs, cheese omelette. Parking: stalls are limited. They have 146 stalls & 596 rooms. Cost is $35 a day. If you can’t get a stall, you park across the street. Not sure what they charge.

I'll start off by saying the staff is very nice!!!!! But not real impressed with the hotel itself. Our room was very strange... we had to go to 1 floor above and then go down 2 flights of stairs that were pretty steep to get to room(there is no other way) Yes while carrying huge luggage-which also means every time you went in and out of room you were going up & down stairs!!!! Even though room was a "suite" it was so small and the bathroom was ridiculously small! You have to turn sideways to get in the bathroom door literally and almost stood in the toilet while exiting the shower. The laundry facility is very sketchy! I made my husband go with me every time I went there because it had straight access to the parking garage which anyone can sneak into. Someone could be laying in wait and attack a person as they are using the key card to enter the room. very dangerous and scary.

One of the smallest rooms I’ve ever stayed in. Bed was comfortable. Room was clean. Price was right. Now for the best part.....the breakfast. Among the best buffets.....tons of selection and quality chow. Location is ok....not too far to the beach. Parking is slim.....so get a spot and only leave when you need to. Aloha.

I stayed here with my sister Feb 6-10. And honestly the best thing about this hotel is Nore from Morocco at the tour desk. He made our trip a memorable one by our go to person if we had any questions and he was super informative. He’s an asset to this hotel and I believe he should be in a managerial position. Not one day went by where he didn’t check up on us or greet us with a smile, and based our observation he was that way with all of his guests. I’ll post a pic, so that future guest can look out for this awesome guy. Anyways let’s get into the real story. So we checked in very late because our flight arrived from Las Vegas about 10:30p. The check in process was smooth and Derek was polite. My sister and I requested two beds but apparently that was an extra fee so we decided to stick with the king bed. Our room was 1507..avoid this room at all costs. I’ve been to many hotels and this is the smaller room I’ve ever come across. It’s literally a cubicle. There’s no room for TWO people to walk and I bumped my feet on furniture SEVERAL times and when I got home I had several bruises on my legs. These rooms are only suitable for sleeping. There is no privacy at Atlanta. Otherwise you’re gonna feel like you’re in a cell. On our final night the fire alarm went off at 4am. When we evacuated our room we were told it was a “false alarm”. No apology. No compensation from the hotel. We couldn’t go back to sleep and my sister and I had anxiety and felt panicky all the way back to Las Vegas. It was terrible.Overall the hotel was clean and tidy.

The rooms are quite small and cramped. While they are indeed clean, this is by far the loudest hotel room I have ever stayed in. I am a professional pilot of 27 years and have stayed in countless hotel rooms. You can very clearly hear people’s conversations in not only adjacent rooms, but rooms across the hall, as well. People talking in the hallways sound as if they are actually in your room. That is, you can hear them when the cheap bargain basement window unit air conditioning isn’t running. These awful a/c units endlessly cycle on and off. They are so loud, you can’t hope to carry on a conversation or watch tv while they are running. They also positioned the units adjacent to the beds, so that when the unit is running, its right next to your head and blowing air directly in your face as you are trying to sleep. I was on the 35th floor and it sounded as if they were actually piping in the street noise from far below. Then there is the breakfast. On the surface, it looks okay, but when one starts eating the food, you find out that looks are deceiving. The eggs are downright awful. The sausages are terrible. The orange juice was so watered down that it was virtually tasteless. Stick with toast or cereal. The staff is courteous and helpful. The location is fair. However, I couldn’t stand more than one night. WAY too much noise!!!!!

Received room 907. Cost was $219.54 with tax for one night. But wait, there is a mandatory $29 resort fee. Driving a car... That's another $36.65 per night please. Walls seem paper thin, you can easily hear the neighbors. Rooms are very tiny. I just flew 9 hours to get here and I feel that the bathroom is about the size of the one on my airplane. Room wasn't very clean, hairs in the bed and in the shower. Room is tiny.Room had an odor like mildew and the room ac is very noisy.I know this is Hawaii but come on. I guess the goal at this hotel is to rip off the tourists from the mainland.

My husband and I had a nice stay. The room and hotel premises were clean. Great location not to far from the beach, shops and restaurants. We upgraded to a partial ocean view room where we could see the sunset. The room was a bit small, but has all necessary accommodations available in your room. The space was will utilized and equipped with the essential needs for a comfortable stay.

The property is very old and far away from the main strip. We booked for a deluxe room and paid AUD $600 for two nights but was given a standard room on the 6th floor. We were trusting the reception to give us what we booked for but did not happen.The room is small ,dark and noisy as it is facing the pool on the 5th floor then we realised that we were given a wrong room. We only stay for two nights so we let it goes but make a complaint at check out. The respond was it is the only room available at time of check in. The window air conditioning is so noisy that we e did not use it, we used the ceiling fan. .You can hear door banging from surrounding rooms, people talking in corridor Very basic breakfast menu and the same everyday..cheese omelette, turkey sausage, pork sausage , boiled and scramble egg for the hot food. There is a microwave but no cutlery so it useless, no kettle, there is coffee machine and paper cup to use. We don’t understand how this property rating is 4.1/5.We would rate it 2/5.We would not come back to the property because it is pricey for the poor conditions and amenities..

I was very impressed with my corner room on the 19th floor, especially the cleanliness. I have a cleaning business on Maui so to give this glowing a review, I had that good of an experience! The bathroom was a bit small but very tastefully staged. There were only two slight irritants. The airconditioning unit came on and off and was loud and disrupted a solid rest. The other disturbance was the noise of other guests in the outside hallway. Soundproofing and wall units would take care of both concerns. All in all, I very much enjoyed my time here, especially the breakfast buffet and friendly and attentive staff. A-, almost perfect!

Checked in for an 8 night stay and was shown a room on a high floor. Must have been 85 degrees in the room and the a/c was on. After 15 min of fumbling with the controls, i called the front desk for a new room. They at first resisted, but then obliged. Checked into our new room and the a/c worked and we started to unload our suitcases. Found that the closet allowed only 6 garments, oops that's not going to work. Then the trick was where to store the suitcases in this postage stamped size room. Main room was 12 x 12 at most, bathroom 3x4 maybe with the shower right next to the toilet. We both said oh well, let's suck it up buttercup. Tossed and turned all night as the a/c was so loud and blowing cold air right on me, I did not sleep that well. My wife in the morning said sleeping and hearing was an issue for her. We decided to check out of this place and look for other accommodations as neither of us thought we could stand it another night. These are the facts. Nothing bad to say about the staff as they were playing the cards they were dealt with, even though I folded.

So people remember you are not staying at a 5 star resort. We felt this resort was excellent value for the price in Hawaii. Rooms are smaller but sufficient, bed and pillows are very comfy. Window air conditioner was loader then some and water pressure in shower could be better, otherwise excellent value for money. Great location with 30-45 min to airport and lots of store and restaurants within an easy walk. Breakfast buffet was good and almost over staffed. Very friendly staff everywhere on location . Pool area very nice . What did we miss... would have loved a balcony and also free shuttle to airport.Airport shuttle is $16 pp. they also offer snacks and beer onsiteGreat stay overallBad experience with the time share for the $175 discount off tours

Rooms are on the smaller size but well Equipped with fridge and microwaveFree breakfast which is a bonus plus they let you take things out of the very large breakfast roomGood size gym, very friendly and helpful staffNo restaurant on site. There are two corners stores across the street. Restaurants are a ten minute walk and about 10-15 minutes to the beach. You can book all tours on site but if you want a good discount you need to go to a time share preview. Count on 3 hoursFor the timeshare I will definitely stay here again... very fair price and I really appreciated the quality of the staff

Holiday Inn Express in Waikiki may be a bit off the beach or main strip, but has many conveniences. The newer status provides LEED certification and great compactness. The breakfast is great and has a great selection. The bed was comfortable and room was well lit. The staff was welcoming but it was a bit of a challenge to check in as I was driving a car. Stalls are narrow so if you’re renting an SUV hope you have great parking skills.

We enjoyed our stay, and breakfast was crowded but tasty. The only thing is that the parking was very limited and VERY expensive! $35 a night! If you're just staying in Waikiki, skip the rental car and save yourself the hassle and expence. The hotel itself was recently updated, comfortable, and in a great location.

The hotel is decent. The free breakfast is very good, and the pillows and bed are very comfortable. The wifi was very good as well, and the staff was pretty friendly. The downside is that there are way too many rooms and people staying at the hotel so the breakfast area is very crowded, the elevators take forever and are packed all the time, and the pool area is overcrowded as well. The location is great though.

I spent 3 nights at this hotel with friends, while the location is fine, the rooms are the smallest rooms I have ever stayed in when staying in an American Hotel or a Holiday Inn. The air conditioner is a window unit and it blows directly on the bed, that may be a good or a bad thing for you, but at least you know to expect it.

Terre S
150 Great Wolf Drive

review_body: Front desk and bell desk staffs were friendly and polite. BUT, the hotel itself was bad - 1. room is very small 2. the AC is very noisy and right next to the bed, it blows directly on you that made us keep waking up 3. breakfast was awful, below average 4. the elevator was so slow, it was a long wait every time. Overall I would not recommend anyone to stay in this hotel. It's not worth the price that they charge.

The hotel was booked through a regularly used travel agency, and looked to be a good choice, disappointed that is was not as comfortable as we have become to expect from Holiday Inn Express.The hotel has been updated and is well kept and clean. However it is an older building and rooms are very small, more like dorm rooms. They have been updated in decor and nicely done, but leaving no space for storage. The closet area has been modified to hold a refrigerator, coffee maker, ironing board, iron, leaving only enough hanging space for 2 shirts an a pair of slacks.The window air conditioner was noisy and the cabinet built to conceal it next to the bed stuck out so it was hard to move around it getting in/out of bed often bumping into the sharp edges.Hotel location is nice for walking downtown and to Waikiki beach. Their charges for guest parking with taxes was nearly $37/day, and limited so not guaranteed there would be a place for you, they would refund that night's parking if so.The mandatory daily $25/day "Resort Fee" another charge added to keep room rates appearing to be more reasonable.Lobby was nice, staff friendly and helpful, but disappointed I was not able to register with my IHG membership for points during this stay because my number was not on the original booking.Included breakfast was standard HI Express fare, but plenty to choose from, fresh and dining staff kept the dining area clean and helpful.

I have never used so many points on a room, and this time it was for 2 rooms for 3 nights. Guess lot’s of travel for work pays off??? Anyway, the place was ok, but not as nice as I’d hoped. First, if you are in to walking around Waikiki it’s not bad. Parking in their garage is expensive and on the street is a huge challenge (plus it seemed sketchy parking on the street). The walls are thin, and the rooms are small. If you miss the days of dorm rooms it’s for you. The plus side: The staff were friendly and they have breakfast figured out! Ton’s of people in and out in a hurry. The serving area was 4 times the size of any other HIE I’ve ever seen and they have staff keeping it up and cleaning tables. The work out room is well stocked and large.

The hotel front desk ppl are awesome but I was very disappointed with the hotel for what I paid. Each room has an old fashioned window air conditioner that is so loud and constantly turns on and off. I had to ask them to remove furniture from my room because it was so small. The room was uncomfortably small with no balconies. The wait times for elevators was ridiculous. At most times it was quicker for me to take the stairs if you can believe that. Also housekeeping did quite a poor job. They didn’t give me new toilet paper so I ran out a couple times and twice they changed my bed cover to something that had old blood stains and yellow stains. They would also forget to replenish the coffee. The free breakfast was not up to me standards. On the positive side- the hotel is clean, front desk staff are very attentive, they gave me a late checkout even though it was busy, the pool and games area is cool although the hot tub and pool were way too cold. Given the price I don’t think it was worth it.

As stated in other prior reviews, cons are the small, thin-walled noisy rooms, slow elevators, same breakfast everyday. To add info: Bathrooms appear to already show wear & tear and smell musty; no elite benefits available for upgrades or late checkout; constant long waits for elevators (need reprogramming since elevators would suddenly switch directions after one elevator reached the bottom even though dozens of people waiting in lobby. one elevator's weight alarm sounded after only 5-6 people entered didn't help); $25/day added hotel service fee is essentially a rate upcharge since water is just a regular water fountain in the lobby, amenities were unavailable when desired (golf ball, ping pong equipment and game room locked up but nobody around to get them) or nonexistent; partial ocean view room was a mere sliver of the ocean. In the end, the partial ocean view room just did not justify the $400+/night after the $25/day fee and taxes.The breakfast staff were very nice and efficient at clearing tables as it got pretty crowded quickly. Housekeeping was cheerful and always said hello. Location is good to walk to both beaches and restaurants.

Pros: Beds and pillows are very comfortable. Rooms are cleanStaff are friendlyCons: Rooms are ridiculously smallBathrooms are smallest I’ve ever seen in a hotelSuper noisy, you can hear everyone’s doors shut, to the point where it sounds like they are being slammed so don’t expect to get much sleepWalls are thin, noisyNo lanai so you feel like you are in an officeI would only ever stay there again if it was for a 1 night stopover but then again probably not as I’d prefer something more central and quieter

So I booked a room weeks in advance and apparently that didn’t matter to them. So I showed up early so I had to wait for my room to be ready (understandable) so... 3pm comes around and they tell me that the room is being cleaned and that it would be ready soon. 5, 10, 15, 20, 25, 30 minutes later they tell me the room is ready ( I’m like what????) so I asked if the check out time would be increased by 30 minutes since they took 30 minutes to get it ready for me and their answer was “oh, I’m sorry... we can’t do anything about it, check out is at noon” so if I stay a minute later than noon they will charge me for another day. So... what I don’t understand is why wasn’t the room ready if it was booked weeks in advance? Why did they take 30 minutes of the time I paid for using the room and won’t give that time back or maybe a refund for those 30 minutes they took away for me???? So I ended up paying for a room full price but they didn’t give me he full time I paid for it!!!! What a scam!!!! Never ever ever would stay at any of their places, specially the one in Honolulu, that’s for sure!

This Holiday Inn Express is in a very good location - about 10-15 mins. walk to shopping and dining and the beach. Everything was very clean and modern. It's also cheaper than some of the other hotels. However, it has some of the smallest hotel rooms I have ever been in, even smaller than those in Hong Kong and Tokyo! It wasn't that much of a problem for me and my partner but anyone who is on the bigger side or have a lot of luggage might have some trouble moving around. Nonetheless, despite the small size of the room, it has all the amenities you would expect to find in a hotel room and it was very clean. The bed and pillow were also quite comfortable. Free breakfast was also included and the options were decent. What made my stay enjoyable was the level of service. All the staff, from the front desk to the housekeeping to those manning the breakfast were all super friendly and helpful. Some things I didn't like about the hotel - the $37 per day parking fee is utterly ridiculous. There is no reason why the parking has to be that expensive. Having a car makes the vacation much more convenient and enjoyable, and you're essentially held hostage by the hotel since you'll either be forced to pay to park there or give up on renting a car. Also, I find it odd that no complimentary water is provided. All the other Holiday Inns I've been in provides complimentary water and I don't understand why they can't provide it here. The AC is somewhat awkwardly placed since it blows directly at your head. It's also super loud and has this weird smell, but thankfully the window opens and there is a fan that you can use if you don't want to use the AC. Finally, I think there can be better quality control on the cleanliness of the towels. Most of them were clean and fine, but some still has stains when I held it up in front of a light to check.

Took a weeks vacation in Hawaii stayed at this IHG hotel and had a great time. The staff was welcoming and great all the time the breakfast was included with room and they put out a good amount of food every morning. The hotel is just a few minutes walk from the beach, shopping and food. We used it as our base of operations for our Island adventures.

We stayed in the hotel twice recently and our experience was much as we had expected from HI Express ie fairly basic accommodation, clean and efficiently run overall. The rooms are smaller than usual and a bit hard to move around, the bed was quite comfortable and good to sleep in. The bathroom is very small and shoehorns in a shower, toilet and handbasin but it works ok. The arrangement of the rooms had a cluster of doors which is quite noisy at times .The buffet breakfast is basically fine and what should be expected of an Express. The external dining area is quite pleasant but suffers from many pigeons trying to get food from the tables and scattering plates etc to the floor.On both of our stays the room safe would not work as the battery needed to be changed On our first stay this reluctantly resolved after quite a bit of hesitation by the maintenance worker but the on our return action was efficient and promptThe hotel is easy walking distance to the beaches and the main shopping area.At all times the staff were very helpful, efficient and courteous, checking inn and out was simple and all details were correct.

I don't think that words can express how comfortable and welcome I felt from the staff at this hotel. Each member of the front desk staff provided excellent five star customer service. I have been to dozens of IHG properties all over the world and the customer service here is better than any InterContinental I have stayed at. The staff made me feel like a good friend that they haven't seen in awhile. This may not be a 5-star property but with the service that was provided it sure feels like it. I myself work in the hospitality industry and know the basic training we have to go through to provide good customer service but they went above and beyond the basics. I would highly recommend this property to anyone wanting to have a memorable and enjoyable stay. I wish that all hotel staff could be this accommodating and pleasant.

This was our second trip to Honolulu and this hotel using our points as a spiral elite ambassador status and points. Cami Silva assigned us to 4006 which is a corner room with an ocean and Diamond Head view. Rooms are compact with two queens but totally adequite for storage with a fridge, microwave and Kuerig coffee maker. Breakfast was a well organized event with a smiling Karen collecting the vouchers as always It is a short ten/fifteen minute walk to the beach and close to the main street for shops and restaurants. The entire staff are helpful and this is a well managed hotel for it's size. My only downside is the "resort fee" when it's not on the beach. I would recomment this hotel and will return again.

The hotel is a typical Holiday Inn Express. We just needed a room to sleep in for 2 nights before our cruise. I was super impressed with Sebastian at the bell desk (side entrance). He went above and beyond to help us figure out how to get where we were going. He had excellent recommendations for activities, food, how to maneuver the crowds ("10 toes down" is now my life motto), and even wrote down what we should order at the best local shave ice shop. He was always helpful and smiling and greeted us like we were old friends. He is a great asset to this location! Tell him thank you from the Kansas City gals!

Stayed 6 nights, was lucky enough to have an ocean view room and had a great stay. Room was a little small but perfect for solo or a couple. Very clean and well maintained. The property was great including the pool and games area with a free breakfast every morning. A short walk to the beach and shopping in Waikiki (maybe too close!). Loved everything about my stay.

This is an amazing hotel, great location, great public transportation located next to the hotel, amazing staff, great breakfast. Room is a bit small but very comfortable big bed, with great shower, fridge and microwave. Highly maintained.Highly recommended.

The hotel is centrally located. Includes a great breakfast. The staff is very friendly and helpful and knowledgeable. They made great recommendations for local family type food and helped us use our time well. I will definitely stay at this hotel next trip.

The security guard got tight I guess employees park in the garage too or something apparently I had a suv and I parked to far over and took anther spot by accident. So I wake up at 5:30 am to go see the sunrise the security guard in the parking garage waited for me to get the my car after harassing and threatening me saying he is going to key my car and pop my tires he writes a not saying you @$& $&@$ in red pin. Great hotel just do not park their also the front desk didn’t take care of the issue properly, they clearly do not care about your safety specially after the note was left with red pin and the harassment by the security guard his name was Randi please do not park in the parking garage it was 37 bucks a day and apparently they are not there to protect your car well at least with randi there. They promised me and full refund but only refunded me the day I did not stay their because I felt threatened. So if I were you I would stay far away from holiday inn express Waikiki

The good: right in the middle of it all. The bad: right in the middle of it all. The hotel is maybe a 5 min walk to the beaches and 5 min to shops and restaurant. If that’s what you are looking for, this hotel matches up. If a quiet relaxed stay, this isn’t it. We stayed on 36 floor with partial ocean view. The room was quaint and had a ceiling fan and noisy air conditioner. The size of the room was not bothersome. The elevators were slow and difficult to navigate. The breakfast was standard and it works. It served a great place to sleep and then hit the road in the morning. Anything more than that shouldn’t be anticipated.

Rooms have small fridge & microwave. Closets are small but not much clothes needed, it is Hawaii! Sliding door for bathroom saves on space. However glass panel lets too much light in bedroom. Should have a shade or darker frosting. A/C window unit a little noisy but able to sleep. Also a ceiling fan for additional air. All staff encountered were polite and helpful. Morning buffet breakfast was enjoyable. Property location easy walking for shopping and beach. And "The Bus" stops right in front of hotel and offers daily passes.

It's not very close to beach, but walk-distance to shopping centers so still convenient. Probably an okay choice comparing with the price, we didn't expect too much anyway - I am IHG Spire elite and ambassador member. I didn't use ihg official booking but used chase portal so I'm not able to post comment there, so putting it here instead. Earlier this year I stayed here temporarily for 1 night during honeymoon then move to other hotels - the luckiest thing is I only booked for 1 night. After the whole day sightseeing we are tired and just want to take a shower and sleep, while the elevator was broken for long time - 3 or 4 hours? We asked frontdesk the fix timeline, they don't even want to answer me with word, just shaking his head and rolling his eye. After another question, not even look at me, he replied with a simple waive "no I DON'T know, why no just go to stairs? many other can do it." NOTE this hotel has 40+ floors and many hopeless people waiting here including me are near 40 floor, even a few hopeless senior person (We were 34 or 36 IIRC). Am I paying for $200+ here just for such ridicule? There's a Wyndham time sharing sales desk in the first floor and advertising - no other choices, we sat there for a while then eventually climbed all the floors back to the room. Not saying any thing for compensation, there's not even a simple sorry when check out. I think I won't be here again.

We enjoyed our stay at this hotel for six days at the end of October.The staff was very prompt and gave us the room in less than 5 minutes from our evening arrival. Much appreciated, considering we had a long flight from Toronto!We got a nice (although small) room with a view of the ocean and the streets on the 16th floor. The bed was very comfortable.The air conditioning was, as other said previously, very loud, but we kept it on only when out (which was most of the day).They serve continental breakfast, plenty of choices, very consistent! There is a line at the opening, at 6:30, and outdoor tables tend to be occupied faster, since most people want to have the breakfast on the patio. The hotel is very well situated in walking distance of the amazing sights of Honolulu: Waikiki beach, shopping centers, Kapiolani park, Fort DeRussy park and beach, the Diamond head, etc.There are bus stations very close by, 42 or 20 takes you to Pearl Harbor (Arizona memorial visitor center) in about 50 minutes. Other buses take you to the Ala Moana center, and Iolani palace, in downtown Honolulu.We walked most of the time, the place is very safe. Highly recommend the Paia Fish Market restaurant, which serves fresh fish at good prices, and is about 10 minutes walk on Kuhio (the hotel's) street, towards Waikiki beach.

I was very surprised for this place, it was perfect for a full week of work and holiday.. breakfast is included and is not to bad to be honest.Location is good access to anything the gym was very good also, the staff very friendly I did enjoy the place even if the rooms are small.

We came in October midweek so the prices were awesome and lower than usual. Crowds were still there but not horrible .The front desk and concierge were super friendly. Gladys was super friendly and accomodating seeing as my family of 4 just got off the plane at 1pm and we are hungry. Concierge was nice and kept my 7 yo entertained as we finish checking in. They were very nice. Even if we waited for about an hour for our room (which we were there a little earlier than check in time) they made sure we were comfortable. Room was great for 2 queens and a view. Slightly tight in space but there was adequate closet room for our carry ons. Bathroom was sufficient space as well. I mean we aren't hangin out in the room during this stay anyway. It was comfortable.Breakfast saved us money. It was your usual continental breakfast fare- it wouldve been nice if it rotated. It was the same during the 2 weekdays we were there but we were happy. Sausage, eggs, pancakes, bread, fruit, yogurt, hard boiled egg, oatmeal.. to name most of it. The staff kept the area clean. If you want to eat outside just beware of the pigeons they are around and get close to the folks. Staff does a good job of keeping them awsy but they cam be aggressive.I used the laundry facilities due to beach wear etc .. i brought my own soap but otherwise they have dispensers that sell soap. It is about $4 per wash or dryer. It takes card or there is a change machine.All in all - hotel is kept clean , staff is wonderful- we got in at a good price. You want water view it is a little bit more. They have one of the lower resort fees. I was able to use their beach towel and just made sure to bring it back. The kids enjoyed the mini golf ...there is a small pool and jacuzzi but we hung out at the beach more.We went to the beach across the hotel - Fort Derussy park - not as crowded as waikiki beach - stands nearby -food and alcohol and clean! It is also across a Coffee Bean and Tea Leaf as well as Whalers or ABC store.The pics attached show the view we had which was great, the room size and bathroom size. Where i was taking the pic - the room- right at ent behind me is the hallwsy closet to put items in which was a lot as well as the fridge and microwave. The RR pic , to the left behind the door is the sink and then the tub right beside the toilet. Thank you Waikiki Holiday Inn, my family had a wonderful time thanks to your staff.

Great stay, central location, walking distance from the beach and the Kulio street. The lady who checked us in was very friendly and professional! Complimentary breakfast was a treat! They can also book activities for 3rd party companies.

Had the common problem of having to rebook my reservations numerous occasions, each time the nightly rate increased. Check in was easy, front desk person was friendly and helpful. The room that I was allocated is the smallest I have ever experienced. After the shock of how small the room is, how did you get the beds into the rooms? Straight away I saw that the rooms AC grill was hanging off, and the AC would not switch on. Contacted front desk who sent a maintenance person to fix the AC, who managed to start the loudest turbocharged, diesel powered helicopter engine AC in the world. The small room I can handle, but the AC noise is unbearable, I have a suggestion for management, replace all AC units with split systems and your negative reviews would disappear. The breakfast was very good rooms are clean and well maintained, laundry is clean,and the location is perfect, but this Hotel is let down by basic, ancient, noisy AC units. I would definitely return if the AC units are replaced, until then I will be staying elsewhere

We very much enjoyed our stay. All of the staff were very nice, friendly and helpful. Room was clean and comfortable. Easy walking distance to a lot of the restaurants and shops. Would definitely recommend and would stay again. Only downfall is the heater on the jacuzzi went down and pool not heated. But other than that it was very nice!

My boyfriend and I spent one night here at the Holiday Inn Express Waikiki. Lobby is open air and had been remodeled so it looked chic and modern. Front desk staff were all very nice. A big Mahalo to Rosemaria and Bea who were so friendly it almost felt as we were family. They were genuinely nice and embraced true Aloha. I was aware of the parking being so limited, but I never encountered any issues with finding any even though we arrived late maybe around 8pm on a Friday night. The complementary breakfast was okay. It wasn't super crowded, we were able to find a table outside which was nice since it was quiet. The room is small. We reserved a king room. But being it was just the 2 of us, the space was adequate. I don't know what everyone is talking about the A/C being so loud. Its just like any other wall mounted A/C unit. Granted it did blow on you, but you could always adjust it to where it would blow away or just simply turn it off and open the window and enjoy the cool trade winds Hawaii offers. We did have a city a view which was nice. The hotel doesn't offer any lanais to sit on. We really enjoyed our stay here. When we return to Oahu, this is will be our place of choice to stay at. Mahalo, Holiday Inn Express Waikiki!

We stayed here for our honeymoon in Waikiki and from start to finish the hotel, ameneties and staff were amazing. When you check in you will even receive gummy pineapples and cookies as a welcome!We had a slight error with our room when we checked in but after contacting hotel management the issue was swiftly resolved to our content - the hotel absolved themselves. Staff are really fantastic. The rest of the stay was fab - hotel breakfast is amazing, you won’t want lunch (omelettes, White egg bites, sausage, turkey patties, boiled eggs, biscuits, bagels, yogurt, cereals, fruit, juice, pancakes, coffee, cinnamon rolls, toast and spreads). There's a full compliment TV and strong wifi throughout.The pool area was always clean and had facilities around it like mini golf and games. The hotel dispense towels at the pool area so don’t bring your own.The only downer about the pool is that the hotel shadows it after a certain time, and it’s a bit on the smaller side - but all hotels in Waikiki seem to have smaller pools (size restrictions?) ... but anyway you’re at the one of the most amazing beaches in the world so why hang at the pool?The only one thing about this hotel was bothered me was the fact the windows can fully open even on the 41st floor - and I mean fully.You can walk to the nearest beach in 10 mins or less. Waikiki area more around 15-20 minutes away and a bit confusing to get to without walking through the beaches. Activities - If you’re interested in pearl harbour, get the public bus from across the bridge as it’s only $5.50 return. This bus also goes outside Ioalani Palace.You can also do Diamond Head this way but opposite, we did and it was amazing.Food wise there’s so much choice, I recommend - Gyu-Kaku Japanese BBQ which was absolutely incredible.Target is about 1 mile walk away but ABC stores are not much more expensive.Location wise this place is good

The regular rooms are small but the upper floor ocean view rooms have an unrestricted view over a park towards the ocean. The pink Royal Hawaiian is visible off to the left, with surfers always out in the ocean. A convenient tour bus pickup is across the street at the hotel La Croix.It may be October but thank goodness the air conditioning works.Large breakfast area for the many guests, including outdoor seating. Standard Holiday inn Express menu but 3 lines and several toasters and hot cakes cookers makes the wait minimal.5-6 block walk to the beach,but we were more interested in seeing the other island sights on this visit.

This is the only IHG hotel in Waikiki. I had not stayed at the ‘Express’ brand before and I have to say although it was clean, central and the staff were very friendly, I am surprised in a resort spot like Waikiki they don’t have more alternatives. Location is good, good views of the sea, standard breakfast with quite a raNge of food to choose from. The biggest downside is the pool, which is very small, plus being ‘express’ there’s no bar or restaurant. However, these are all in walking distance of the property. There are laundry facilities on site plus a bus stop across the road which is handy for the mall and other tourist sites. Also the age of the property means the Aircon is the old in window style which is like having and A380 in the room with you.

The scenery pretty much says it all about the location; now on to Holiday Inn Express: the price is a bit higher than mainland, but that is to be expected around here. The service is good, but they are on the stingy side with toilet paper, kleenex, and they would not give me a glass to take to my room for my 12 yrs old single-malt scotch, they offered paper cup! Yuck! I had to go buy glasses, luckily there are many stores in less than a mile radius. The rooms are clean but small (think Japan) and in the morning, one must get up and go downstairs (no room service except Doordash) the coffee and meals available in their school style cafeteria, leaves something to be desired. The beach is within 8-10 min walking distance and if you are on a budget, buy your meals at the local 7-11, they are actually healthily prepared meals (next to the cashier) of local and filipino style foods for less than $8, only 7-10 min walk from the hotel. I hope this helps. Gabriel C. Doe Jr.

It is very convenient to access to Waikiki beach and downtown. The hotel have swimming pool , hot tub and mini golf court, ping-pong table on 5th floor. Self-parking is available 35$/night. After parking, you need to bring ticket to front desk for validation. They didn’t tell us about that when we checked-in so it made us back-and-forth trip to have it done. Room is pretty small but clean. Beds are comfortable.

We enjoyed our stay at this location so much. Location was convenient, room was decent, had a nice pool, gym and outdoor area. Cons: There are too many pigeons on the open breakfast area. As much as we love animals, it’s not sanitary to eat in a place where pigeons are flying around your food and if you turned around for any reason, the next thing you know is that you’ve got a couple of them on your table eating your food.

Had read reviews and was nervous about my stay. I am a travel agent and had a group of 40 people. When we checked in the staff was very friendly and efficient. I had sent two boxes and when I checked in they immediately informed me that they had arrived and I didn't even have to ask about them. The rooms were ready and they were clean. Only two guest had minor problems and they were given different rooms immediately. The rooms are small but it was only for two days, and the beds were very comfortable. Breakfast was fantastic and the lines moved very fast because they had three food lines featuring the same thing on each. I needed a room to pass out information to my guest and the staff was very accommodating in providing one immediately. The pool, hot tub and relaxing area on the fifth floor was very nice. We were walking distance to the shopping district and also the beach. There were several restaurants within walking distance also. I will refer to other agents who need property for pre or post for cruises.

Nice property. Clean updated rooms and a great breakfast buffet. The property is just a few blocks out of downtown Waikiki so it is a tad bit quieter and not quite in all the hustle. Great pool on the 5th floor. Very friendly staff with a knowledgeable concierge desk for all the fun stuff you want to do in Oahu. Biggest hotel convenience store I have ever seen.

We booked this using points for 2 rooms to stay 2 nights after our 10 day cruise from Vancouver. My husband had a bit of buyers remorse as he usually stays at Hilton properties and there was one down the street for more points but there were no refunds. This property is nice for the price and the staff is fantastic! We disembarked our cruise ship at 9 and arrived at the hotel around 9:30. We thought we would have to store our suitcases (we had a lot!) but they were able to find us 2 rooms beside each other and one was ready, so we moved all our suitcases to that one. The attendant was already cleaning out the second one. Very few other hotels would make you wait until the allotted checkin time but they went above and beyond to get us 2 rooms together. Shoutout to the hotel employee Virginia! She was awesome. We left for the airport to pick up our car rental and by the time we got back our room was clean. The bathroom is small but to say it’s smaller than a cruise ship bathroom is not accurate. The shower is spacious unlike a cruise ship. It serves its purpose. There is no real closet space but they do have places you could lay your suitcase down off the floor and the enclave by the door stored our larger suitcase. The AC is loud but it works and serves its purpose of keeping your room clean. It’s an easy, albeit crowded journey, to the freeway but it’s close enough to be convenient and approximately 15 minutes to the airport if traffic isn’t ridiculous. The free breakfast is nice. It has a lot of different options and while it looks crowded it has 3 lines of the same food. Also, it has 4 different toasting stations so you’re not waiting for others. It does stay consistently busy for breakfast but their break crew is on the ball with cleaning tables and replenishing stock. As this is downtown Waikiki parking is a premium but we paid more for even more remote locations and they do warn you the lot could fill but they’ll refund you if you can’t find a spot for the night. We didn’t have an issue since we were touring each day and when we got back at night there was space available. Overall I would definitely stay here again for the clean rooms and the amazing, friendly and efficient staff!

We chose to stay here two nights prior to our NCL cruise. Us and another couple booked 2 suites which looked very spacious in the pictures. We arrived at the same and their room was ready...ours wasn’t. We were told the front desk would call us when our room was ready...that never happened! We were told at the front desk that both of our rooms were on the 25th floor. No problem, right? Well there was a major problem...the elevator doesn’t stop on the 25th floor. You have to stop on the 26th floor and walk down this odd stairway to get to our room. I do not do steps very well and for anyone else that used a wheelchair, walker or crutches it would be almost impossible. No where on the website does it mention that this is the case for the suites. We had to have bell service get our luggage to the room. Once inside the room was nice. Sitting area, extra chair, king bed and two window air conditioners. Now for the bathroom! It is by far the smallest bathroom I have ever seen in all of my years of traveling. Bathrooms in cruise ships are bigger! I am attaching a picture of both the stairwell and the bathroom so you can see. Morning breakfast is quite nice, the have three buffet lines as it does get quite crowded. There is a laundry on the third floor. Washers and dryers are both $4.00 per load. Word of advice..buy your detergent at the ABC store. It’s about half price! Would I stay here again...not sure. If I did, I would make sure it wasn’t these particular rooms.

We only stayed for 1 night, but it was nice and suitable for the price: clean, very friendly staff and good location! The 5th floor amenities were fun( kids loved the mini golf). The breakfast room was packed at 7am and it was a ton of food but nothing spectacular: coffee was good with oatmeal and toast but really it’s just what I could make at home. Kids liked the cinnamon rolls! Elevator rides took a lot of time. Views were great from the 42nd floor but the room was so small! We didn’t spend much time in the room which was good because it was tiny for 4 people! It worked out fine for 1 night but I wouldn’t want to spend a week there!

Very clean and friendly hotel.Free breakfast eggs bacon cereal toast pancakes muffins danishes bagels Juice coffee yogurtClean rooms but smallOutdoor pool mini golf on fifth floor outdoors Walking to shopping and beach

I booked a general room, which in the description notates that bed availability is determined upon checkin. On the day of check-in, I called earlier to inquire about early check-in and about availability for a room with two beds. I was told that there was a room available with a partial ocean view, but would need to pay an upgrade fee. I informed the front desk staff that I am a spire elite member and inquired about a room upgrade based on my hotel status. I was then told that assigning me a room with two beds is already an upgrade. I informed the staff that general rooms can come with one or two beds, which is assigned during check in. It was only at check out that I was thanked for my loyalty. The rooms were very small and the ceilings were very low. I am 5’8 and can easily injure myself if the I raised my hand while the fan is on. The AC was also SUPER LOUD. In the two bed room, one of the beds was located right under the AC. The breakfast spread was good considering it was free for all guests. The staff were very hospitable. The swimming pool was super short. The amenities was definitely not worth the resort charge. Hotel is lacking for the price charged per room. The only good thing about the hotel is the closed proximity to the heart of Waikiki.

nice room with new renovatednice viewmodern breakfast normal (everyday the same)fast wificlean roomac a little bit noisythere is an ABC store next to the hotel also there is one on front of itBut need to think more that the beach is 10-15 mins walk from the hotel

Our room was pretty small. Beds were comfortable enough. Solid breakfast buffet. The best thing about this place is the location. And the price was very good considering how close we were to everything. The staff were friendly and helpful

Small room but clean. Bed was good. Very difficult to control a/c, so, Was very cold at night. Staff are all very friendly and it is in a central location. We were on 19th floor with great views. Excellent breakfast and coffee

We stayed for 1 night in August and did not enjoy our stay. The rooms were really small and bathrooms even smaller. It made for an uncomfortable stay. During the morning breakfast, people were lined up outside the breakfast room before they opened. The food was average and nothing to write home about or complain about. They did have several on hand to help people out which was a good sign. Staff were all very helpful though. When we checked out, we were glad to be leaving. Unfortunately this will not be a hotel we would visit again due to the small rooms. I believe the rooms were less than 200 sq ft so it is extremely small.

If you’re anything like me, I rely on reviews a lot when booking with points or cash, so I know what I’m getting into. So I’m going to do this review justice and give full details/photos including what rooms you should request for the best beach view. Breakfast: First off, the biggest plus I can give this hotel is the breakfast. It is a very large room with 3 different lines to help get everyone through quickly. It is a full continental breakfast including a delicious cinnamon role, and even 4 machines that make pancakes instantly in an assembly line format at the push of a button (I had never seen a machine like this before and the fact you can watch your pancakes cook was very cool). Another great thing about the breakfast was the fact that every morning about 10 or so of the hotel staff lined up at the entrance to the dining room all giving a warm “Aloha”. Breakfast is served from 6:30-9:30 am however most people get down there right at 6:30 (since everyone is wide awake being so many hours behind the mainland USA). There is a lot of indoor seating however it does fill up quickly, thankfully there is a huge shaded outdoor patio that stretches around the entire dining area with plenty of seating as well (just watch out about leaving your plate, the native birds out there are big time scavengers). Room: As far as room size goes, I’ll be the first to admit it is close quarters. There is a chair and a desk that can be moved around (it’s the kind that is L shaped and slidable) however not much room beyond that and the bed. The rooms all have ceiling fans (a plus to keep you extra cool) and inwindow AC. I know some people said it was loud for them, personally I like the sound of air blowing and if you have heard any window unit AC work before it’s basically that. Not that big of a deal.Resort: The 5th floor is where the “resort” part comes in. It’s an inside/outside area with inside being the fitness area, but outside being a huge deck that is the size of the parking garage below (as the rest of the building is tall and skinny for floors 6-40). There’s one pool, a large hot tub with plenty of seating area (looked like it could hold 10 people on each side as it was a large rectangle with bench seats on both sides), a 9 hole mini golf course plus a life size chess board. Had a lot of open seating and I felt there was room for all outside.Parking: There is 3 levels of parking (floors 2-4) for this hotel. Cost is $35 a night. Spaces are tight and the hotel does fill up at night (if you charge 5 nights of parking and can’t find a space one night the hotel will reimburse you for it). However, we normally left around 9 am and were back by 6 pm every night and found plenty of spaces every time. Elevators: Being a 40 story building, it is easy to see why some people could be concerned with elevator functionality. There are 6 elevators, 3 on each side with each bank serving different floors. The left side serves 2-24, right side serves 2,3,25-40+ (I think the top floor was 44 but not sure. Elevators came pretty quickly on both sides, only time it was a few minutes slow was breakfast time when everybody was either coming down or going up. But otherwise elevators were fast and efficient. The one thing to note: the 2nd floor is for housekeeping (you can go here to request more towels/soap/etc. and 3rd floor is guest laundry. Both the 2nd and 3rd floor elevators also service the garage and are available on both banks. However, the 4th floor garage elevator and even the 5th floor resort area must be accessed from the left bank (that goes up to floor 24). So if for example you are staying on the 30th floor and either wanted to go to your car on the 4th level or wanted to go to the pool on the 5th, you’d have to first ride the elevator to the lobby then take the left bank up to those 2 floors. Some people may find this to be a terrible inconvenience to take a couple extra minutes, if so you will want to request to not be on a floor higher than 24 (so you can be serviced by the left bank elevators that access 2-24).Beach access: The hotel is under a half mile to the beach, as Fort DeRussy beach park is directly in front of it, and you can walk through the park directly to the beach. There is a nice boardwalk there with food places and a beachfront bar.My Advice: So now you’re probably wondering; what room/floor should I be on for the best view? Well I happened to stay on the 22nd floor in room 2205 and my view of the ocean was great, totally unblocked and I could see Fort DeRussy Beach Park as well. However, the Hotel La Croix is directly in front of the Holiday Inn, and from my view on the 22nd I would say that if you want an unobstructed view of the ocean, you need to be at least on the 20th floor to see over the hotel in front. I am not sure what the back side views are as there are hotels to the left and right, I know from the resort area on the 5th you can see over the canal and into the mountains unobstructed so I would guess any backside rooms would have this view at least. But the ocean side rooms are all in the single digit room numbers, something to keep in mind when requesting a certain room.Hopefully this review helps those that are particular like me when looking for a hotel. I’ve included photos that show the room size, view (from 2205) and breakfast area.Thanks and have a great day!

My hubby and i just got back from our 7 days stay in this hotel. We stayed in their kingsize bedroom which was small. Including the bathroom. Though they were able to maximize the space very well. It comes with a mini ref, microwave and coffeemaker. The room looks updated. The weird thing about this room is the window type air conditioning is pointed towards the left side of our headboard so we had to put a cover so it doesn’t hit our faces while we sleep. On our third night the air conditioning conked out. But it was immediately replaced within an hour. I must also say our housekeepers on the 43rd floor were very nice and efficient always friendly and accommodating to our needs. The room rate comes with buffet breakfast as with other H.I.E properties and with the same spreads. I only wish that they would have a little variety everyday like maybe sausage on monday and the next day its bacon and so forth. On our third day we just bought malasadas for breakfast since we got sick and tired of the same menu.  They have a huge dining area with indoor and outdoor sitting. The staff at the dining area a very efficient. They are used to the crowd and efficiently replenish the food, clean up tables and even shoo away the birds bothering guests eating outside. The parking is on first come first serve basis. There are more rooms than parking slots. You have to settle for street parking if you run out of slot. They also have a nice size swimming pool and jacuzzi on the 5f. With a number of pool chairs and cabanas. There is also a mini golf, ping pong table, chess game and game room good for families with kids.  Location is 10 minutes walk to waikiki beach. You can cut through the park with beautiful banyan trees. I prefer this than being right on the crowded Waikiki beach area. There is an ABC store across the street for your emergency needs. Overall we had a pleasant stay and wouldn’t mind coming back.

**BE CAREFUL, PARKING IS NOT GUARANTEED**After looking high and low for a place to stay in Waikiki that wasn't crazy expensive, we opted for this place after the reviews seemed okay and the pictures of the rooms looked good. Arriving at the hotel, they have a valet service, but they only stay for a short time throughout the day *if* they're even at the podium. They have a drop-off section in the front of the hotel, but there's nowhere to park and leave your car while you check-in without someone pulling up behind you and needing to leave.After checking in, we went to our room. I know most places in Hawaii don't use air conditioning, but they did have a window unit in the room. The problem is, it gets extremely hot in the room and if you leave the window unit running, it's extremely loud, so you can't hear the TV or anything as the rooms are quite small. The unit is also located right next to the bed which blows directly on you. We ended up having to put a towel over ours to get some decent sleep without it 1) drying us out and 2) being able to sleep in quiet.The worst part about this place is ultimately the parking garage. They told us in the beginning that the garage is first come, first serve. There aren't enough spots for each guest at the hotel. They stated that if parking wasn't available in the garage, they'd help us find a spot. One night, the garage was full, so we went to the front desk. She stated to go to one of the other parking garages, bring in your ticket, and they'll refund the parking fee for that night. We drive over to that garage and it's full. We go to the other one they suggested and it's full. How do you build a 43 story hotel and not have a place for each guest to bring a car? Most people will rent a car and end up trying to park on the street or they'll have to park so far away that they end up needing to get an Uber just to get to and from their car. Luckily we only had an issue with finding parking for one night, but it does get crowded fast, especially on the weekends when more people come into town.One of my biggest pet peeves with the parking situation is that their laundry room is on one of the parking garage floors. They ship off some of their laundry to be done because there's too much of it to be handled on-site. Not a problem, except the carts they keep their laundry in take up SIX PARKING SPACES, so no matter what time of day you come in or out, there are laundry carts taking up six parking spaces that people could have parked in. From the beginning, the garage didn't work properly. It's supposed to read a ticket that they've validated for your entire stay when you enter and when you leave. You use the same ticket each time. Sometimes the tickets would get eaten on leaving and you'd have to get a new one each time, prompting you to have to go to the lobby and re-validate it each time you used the garage. Other times, it wouldn't even give you a ticket. There were some times it kept saying the garage was being blocked and you'd have to call the front desk and ask them to open it for you every time you left. It wasn't just us either, we watched countless cars have the same problem ahead of us causing traffic down the street of people trying to get in and out of there easily.While most of these things seem minor in comparison to other problems, it's the convenience of things that makes your vacation relaxing and dealing with these was exhausting after a couple of days of it.Overall, it's not a bad place to stay if you're not driving anywhere on your own and staying directly in walking distance of places or taking Ubers/shuttles everywhere, but if you have a car, it wouldn't be my first choice, especially if you like sleeping in peace and quiet.

For 4/7 nights we had to find parking somewhere else. Honestly, save time and money and park across the street.
