You might have to wait 5 minutes or more to catch an elevator, especially if you’re on a higher floor. We were on floor 39.-Laundry is expensive to do.-Rooms are small-High traffic areaOverall I would not stay in this hotel again. We mainly used the hotel as a place to sleep at night, and tried to spend most of our days out enjoying the island.

The hotel is decent but for the price one would expect more, customer service for one.Upon checking the attendant was rather rude, maybe having a bad day. The parking lot is 36.50 a night but they have limited parking. Better off to save and spend $24/nt. across the street at the Public parking. Upon arrival we parked in the Garage and to get out your ticket need to be validated. No one told me that. So one of the people in our party ran in while We sat at the exit gate to validate (garage is tiny no way to turn around or notImpede exiting traffic) They were turned away saying only the registered name could do it. The room is roughly 15 x 15’. I wouldn’t have stayed here but our company booked the room. I won’t stay there again. High price, and no value.

.......but, that’s been a really difficult thing to do.We stayed here once before (December 2018) for one night ~ in a king bed room. Getting to our room was a trying experience, as there aren’t enough elevators to accommodate the guests. Once we got there, we found the room to be uncomfortably small. And, the noisy A/C is placed right beside the pillow on one side of the bed (so, it blows air in one’s face all night). On the positive side, the room was clean and the staff was pleasant.Being IHG Spire Elite members, we thought we’d give the hotel a second chance, as we earn points and perks with every IHG hotel stay. In order to have a bigger room, we booked their best: a “suite” (sort of ~ they use the term loosely). We scheduled our flight and hotel arrival for 3:00PM ~ their “official” check-in time. We waited in line ~ only to be told the room wouldn’t be ready for a half an hour more. Then it was another half hour. Then, another. Our suite was finally ready at 5:37PM. (Credit where it’s due: Sylvia waived our amenity fees for our trouble.) Next came the usual long wait at the elevator. OK, we knew that. Then, the suite...... It was located on the 25th floor. No elevator goes to the 25th floor. Seriously. So, one rides the elevator to the 26th floor, and then walks down a short flight of stairs ~ which would be fine if one wasn’t in HNL for medical reasons ~ which we were. The “suite” is one large room with one small cruise-ship-sized bathroom. The door to the bathroom was ridiculously narrow (see pic ~ yes, the door is all the way open). Again, noisy A/C ~ but, they do provide a white-noise effect to muffle the street noise below. And, for all this, our room wasn’t even reasonably priced ~ a bill well over $800 for three nights! Never again.

Hotel located close to the center, just 10 minutes walk from the beach. Near many restaurants and shops. Spacious rooms and a nice swimming pool atea. Breakfast is complimentary and average. Highly recommend

Very close to Waikiki beach and shop, the hotel is not expensive.Even though the rooms are small. 5 star for breakfast. I checked out early and they were happy to keep my luggage for 10 hours.Need renovation and air condition can be noisy.Try booking top floors the view will make you forget everything

The check in staff is super friendly, the rooms are clear (impressive) but are very tiny. I stayed on the 43rd floor and the stench was horrible. At first I thought it was a pet friendly hotel because of the smell. But I believe it is from all the moisture in the air. As with most older hotels, they do not have central HVAC so the in room (wall) AC unit blows right on you and turn on / off all night long. I had breakfast there, and contrary to reviews here I thought it was descent. Consider the number of patrons they serve daily breakfast too. Overall it was pricy, but it's what happens when you stay at a tourist trap. They charge for parking and one night we got back late and the parking garage was FULL. WTH! FULL, the employee standing outside said we could park in the adjacent garage for $25 and get reimburse. But wait, we pre paid $32 daily for parking. He basically said TOUGH $HIT! Wish I would have gotten his name, he was a outside the entrance to the garage flossing his teeth. Can't make this stuff up!

Stayed here for a week with family of five and appreciated the free breakfast which was a full buffet of hot and cold foods, although could use some tropical fruit. Best option is the higher floors with the amazing views of Waikiki, Diamond Head and Honolulu. Elevators are a bit crowded at rush hour. Hotel is an older design and rooms can be small but the interior and rooms are newly renovated.We were most impressed with the customer service from the front desk, in particular Jeremy. He really helped us secure the best rooms available as we needed two rooms and with check out as we were leaving on a late flight. He was patient and tried to work with our IHG membership to get us the best options.

I got there about 90 minutes early and to my surprise my room was ready. The room seemed small but very functional for 2. There was a restaurant in the hotel for guests only with a breakfast script, no lunch or dinner. But there were other restaurants within walking distance like Tony Roma's. The elevators were always busy I think it was because only 2 were working the 3rd was out of order. Would have given 5 stars but the parking was very limited even with a parking pass, if you can't park in the hotel thye will re-embuse you for the 1 day. Overall had a great time here clean, quite and safe.

Midway through a 9 day stay and absolutely horrified with how it’s panning out. Ideally I’d have kept this till the end but after tonights events I’ll vent now. Neglected to remove the dnd sign when we left this morning. Not to worry we requested a turn down with fresh sheets, towels and a vacuum when we stepped out for dinner. Astounded to return to one bed having been made up (poorly with no sheet change) and the other left as it was!!!) Add to this the bins haven’t been emptied, no vacuum and the towels are still on the floor!!!!!I mean, why on earth would you come into the room after our request and only make up one bed yet leave the rest of the room as it was!!!!!Duty manager incapable of comprehending the situation and far from helpful. Perhaps the GM can contact me in morning, we’ll see. Back to the review proper. Pool area small and pools dirty, chairs stacked and we had to untie and move them ourselves (midday Friday) We haven’t used since. Room is tiny, half size of a normal hotel room and the air conditioning unit has been designed by a moron. Two speeds, full blast and off. Good luck sleeping with this cycling constantly. Breakfast although free (included) is poor in quality. I’ve stayed in many IHG hotels worldwide, this is by far the worst.

Booked three rooms for five nights for a family of eight vacation. Rapid efficient check-in.The rooms are small but fully functional, nothing missing, even has iron and ironing board. WiFi excellent. In room safe excellent feature. Overall facility very clean, staff friendly, staff neat with nice dress,Great breakfast offerings, well stocked, well attended breakfast room, seating never a problem, staff friendly and cheerful. In room coffee nice feature, only problem us that the number of service packs (sugar/creamers) never match coffee provided; this is a universal hotel/motel problem with some exceptions.Good Concierge services. Good location for driving around the island and for walking to good restaurants.Only downside was inadequate on site parking, staff did direct to very nearby parking at two-thirds the cost of hotel parking which was all but impossible to get into. Small but easily solved problem.Would go back if in Honolulu again.

Having less than 24 hours to spend in Honolulu en route to American Samoa, we looked for a reasonably priced hotel for our one-night stand. The Holiday Inn Express was perfect for us. Although the room was tiny, it had everything we needed: ample space for opening and using our suitcases, in-room coffee service, a good shower, thick towels, comfortable bed, peek-a-boo view of the ocean, a mere 10 minute walk to Waikiki -- thus perfect for enjoying the beach ambience without all the crowds and noise. The excellent breakfast was well presented and could be eaten inside in a comfortable dining room environment or outside in a shaded, covered patio area. We would definitely stay here again if our travels take us to Honolulu.

Well, I don't know where to begin on this one. I've been traveling for a long time and I travel inside and outside of the USA. This Hotel and service by far has been the worst hotel experience I have ever experienced in the past 20 years. I cannot believe the non-sense that happened. I booked rooms with this hotel from the 3rd-8th. Unfortunately, when we got here to check in, they did not have a room for us on the 5th. So we figured we could find a room for that 1 day some where else and return to our reserved rooms. The person helping us “Brea” mis-heard my wife and I discussing this and decided to cancel my July 4th reservation. Which by the way was my 3-year wedding anniversary. So on the 4th morning we go travel the island on a tour and return by 5pm to get to our room. The door key would not work, so I went down to get new keys. This is when this got ridiculous and I could not understand the logic they where trying to feed me. They said I was locked out and needed to pay for the day. I initially purchased the rooms for $114.00 a night. Good deal right??? Wrong.... the wanted me to pay $387.00 in order to get my bags. I said, this is not my fault that you cancelled my reservation, note that I have the 5th, 6th and 7th booked. They wanted me to pay the $387.00 or pay at least 1/2 of this amount just to release me bags. I was so upset, I asked to speak to the manager or supervisor and this is where it got even worse. I own a construction business and a restaurant and both businesses are successful and have a 4-1/2-5 rating. This supervisor "Silvia" was the most rudest, non-sensible, heartless person I have ever spoken to in my entire life. The reasons for the 3- star rating on this hotel comes from the management supervision of this person alone. She was so rude, she would not listen to what I was saying and would not take the mistake that her employees made into any consideration and just treated me like a homeless person. She continued to talk down to me and not even listen to what I had to say. It takes me a lot to get upset and still with all the low blows and nonsense that she was giving me for her peoples mistakes, I still kept my self relaxed as I felt like screaming on top of my lungs. Again, our anniversary was on this day and I would have hoped for her to do the right thing and let me stay in the room I booked for $114.00 instead of charging me 1/2 of the room and ask me to leave and return the following day. This gets worse, I had to go book 2- nights not one because her employee cancelled the 4th - 6th. I had to find another hotel during the holiday just so that my wife and I don't sleep on the streets. During my whole stay in Hawaii, I had 3- credit cards not working due to the deposit holds from all three hotels that I booked only because this women Silvia who calls her self a supervisor, not caring or having any type of sympathy for us. I was not asking for anything free or for anything ridiculous. I just wanted her to know and acknowledge that her team made a mistake and we should have been able to stay for the rate that we originally purchased the rooms for. I really hope she is removed from her position as I wouldn't want her near my businesses. I hope some one reaches out to me and makes this up as well. As I will be writing this same review on all websites to assure you that this should not ever happen to any human being. I was treated like an animal. Felt like I didn't even exist during our conversation. I want full refund or free rooms and I feel I deserve it as my anniversary was ruined due to this hotel and this supervisor Silvia.

Stay here for convenience and reliability of a national chain. Waikiki is outrageously expensive and crowded but this hotel is the exception. Check in was fast, friendly, and easy. Park in the garage across the street from the hotel because it is much cheaper than using the often-full hotel garage. The free breakfast was delicious and almost paid for our hotel room in the value we saved rather than eating elsewhere. Rooms are very spacious and newly remodeled. Location is steps away from the beach, shopping, and restaurants. Pool is small but adequate. Putt putt and other outdoor games are available on the pool deck. My only complaint was the staff collecting the putt putt equipment at 7:30 PM. They could have left the equipment out at least until midnight. I highly recommend this hotel for a busy and budget conscious family.

Overall the hotel is fine. Rooms are tiny. Amazed the staff called me by name. Loved the Whirlpool. Breakfast was good. Very safe hotel. No restaurant for lunch or dinner. A/C very noisy. Tiny room. Internet was good

Have just spent 5 wonderful nights here after we had to leave the crummy hotel next door that we had previously booked for the length of our stay. The staff were outstanding- from the welcoming and efficient check in staff, to the cleaning and maintenance staff. Rooms looked newly decorated, were fresh, modern and spotless. Bathrooms were gorgeous with decent toiletries. The included breakfast had something to suit everyone and was an extra bonus. The pool was welcoming as was the really lovely hot spa at the end of each day and we could tell that families with children were enjoying it.We ended up having to spend an extra day here, due to a delay on our flight home, and staff were only too happy to arrange a day stay, so that we could enjoy the beach, rather than hanging around the airport. I genuinely would not look at any other place for my next visit. Five stars

Stayed here for one night due to late flight arrival. The rooms are clean and comfortable but absolutely tiny! We had a room with 2 Queen beds and not much room for anything else! The bathroom was also very small but clean. Breakfast was included which was decent enough, then we checked out. I would of given 4 out of 5 but the rooms are verging on claustrophobic.

Wonderful place to visit, well located. Rooms a little bit smaller, however great service and the lady who was in charge of our room did and amazing job, Esperanza thanks for everything!I also miss the pigeons at breakfast (I'll be back buddies)

Hopefully you didn’t come wanting do do anything else in Hawaii because this hotel will keep you very busy... Looking for a parking spot in their parking garage... Waiting for an elevator (usually takes 5-10 minutes going each direction)... And the line for the mediocre free breakfast is usually backed up to the elevators... not to mention there’s no seating in the dining room once you finally get your food.Luckily we checked in at 1am, so we didn’t deal with lines at the front desk, but everyday I see lines out into the street of people trying to check in.Basically this is a 44 story hotel with the staff and facilities of a 20 story hotel- so if you book this hotel, just know you’re going to spend most of your time in this hotel.

As a frequent visitor to Hawaii, I’ve stayed several hotels. They are all grossly overpriced, of course, but this particular hotel is a dump. The elevator doors squeaked all day and all night, which is particularly annoying when your room is directly across the hall. And the free breakfast, well, it’s just nasty food. Plus they charge a resort fee. This is super annoying because the hotel is about the furthest thing from a resort. Bottom line, there are many other better places for your money.

The room is fine. It’s clean, the maid service has been consistent so far, the breakfast is great, and the amenities are fairly nice. My only issue is the air conditioner designed by satan himself. It is a window type unit and was definitely the first thing I noticed when walking in the room because it was SO LOUD. Even with that, I would be fine, however, the constant cycling on and off makes it impossible to sleep well. AND...there is no way to turn it off. Not on the wall thermostat and not on the unit itself. You can hit off but it will still cycle the fan on and off no matter what you do. I verified with another guest and they are having the same issue. You can’t make it run constantly and you can’t shut it off so it is an endless cycle off shutting on and off about every 2 min to 45 seconds.I am a sailor and have been serving on ships for 18 years. I have slept below flight decks with chains being dragged above my head, I am used to sleeping with noise. This AC unit has defeated me. I get 4 hours of sleep and then I finally get woke up and just listen to the damn thing turning on and off the rest of the night.If you are a heavy sleeper (I usually am) then you might be fine. If you aren’t, this is your warning.

Pool area closes at 8pm, by far the earlies t closing time I’ve ever seen anywhere I’ve stayed around the world. It seems in a beach community of all places there would be reasonable hours. Rooms are really small but adequate. Good location.

Good for couples staying in near waikiki area. Cheaper compared to all other decent hotels in Honolulu which is located quite centrally. Although the aircon seem to turn off by itself when it reaches the set temperature, we had a comfortable stay. Bedding were fine. Bathroom was clean. And it feels like the rooms are newly renovated. However, my friends' room had a problem with the aircon and it wasn't serviced until after two nights and they had to move to another room, and they were upgraded for free after complaining. But I hope they check all the room's condition before they accommodate guests. We were there to have a comfortable trip. The breakfast included was OK. But if didn't have any other options so you'll have to eat the same every day. Good this is that The staff were accommodating. If it didn't have the aircon issue, I would have given this hotel a perfect score because it is value for money.

Rooms was too small, water flow in shower no good, no dresser and chair, no tea begs.Only good part was nice breakfast and services at breakfast.bed was no good, parking was very bed and i have to park in different building.

This sky rise hotel is ok! The rooms are somewhat small! If it is a solo trip it would be ok but I wouldn’t try it with more than one person! I didn’t stay anywhere else on Waikiki to compare it! I will say the staff was friendly!

The good points:We had a king room with Ocean view. The view really is wonderful. The location is great if you don't mind a 20 minute walk to Waikiki beach (and we didn't mind at all).There is a terrific place for coffee just over the road.The bed was super comfy. Slept very well each night we were there.The breakfast is more than adequate - cereals, bakery items, hot items, fruit, yougurts etc. All the stuff you expect. The coffee was ghastly - hence my reference to the coffee place over the road.There is a capsule type coffee maker in the room.There is a small "market" near reception where you can purchase odds and ends - drinks, toiletries etc.USB connections at each bedside was a big plus.The hotel is clean.Now to the bad points:This building seemed tired. The elevators are slow and there are only 3 for levels L-24 and another 3 for levels 25-42. There is no service elevator, so often housekeeping staff are competing with guests to fit in these small elevators (12 people maximum).The elevators and common areas on each floor are NOT airconditioned. The air conditioner in the room was so loud we had to turn it off and rely on the ceiling fan, which did work well.There is very little hanging space, although there are adequate drawers for clothes.Although there is a coffee maker, they gave us 1 coffee, 1 decaf and 2 tea capsules. We did try to buy additional capsules without success.Hence the reference to the coffee shop across the road (much nicer coffee)They claim to be mindful of the environment, but each day you get 2 plastic cups in the bathroom each covered in plastic. The coffee cups are disposable cups too. What's wrong with proper cups and glasses?There is no facility to sort your trash into rubbish and recyclables.When we checked in (and we stayed here on 2 separate occasions), reception took ages to find our booking. They even sent us to sit down while they took 15 minutes tracking it down. This happened TWICE! I can't complain about the people on reception because they did they best they could, but TWICE!?As others have said, the rooms are SMALL. They wouldn't seem so tiny if they had a balcony. Sadly they do not. That's my mistake for not finding a hotel with balcony.The lady that takes your ticket at breakfast needs to be more cheerful. Seriously - she is not a good start to the day. Each morning I said "Good Morning" to her and she just sort of grunts at you. The other breakfast staff are pleasant though.The windows in the room are not double glazed, so you get a lot of street noise - particularly the sirens up kalakua Avenue.And now the annoying:The fire alarm went off and we had to evacuate. Got down 17 floors before it was called off (false alarm). Then it took ages to get back to our room because of the 3 small elevators. Waiting in an airless floor lobby for 30 minutes was no fun at all. I appreciate that a fire alarm is possibly beyond the control of the hotel, but.... we heard from other guests that it went off again a week or so later.

Jill at the front desk did an outstanding job of sorting out our family and in-laws, including g one person who unexpectedly required the use of a wheelchair. The buffet was excellent and the rooms great, but what struck me was how genuinely friendly all of the employees were. From the porter to the maids to the hardworking guys in the breakfast room - everyone was extremely helpful and quick with a smile. Mahalo!

I would like to take this opportunity to thank Jeremy (check in staff) who made me feel warmed and welcomed the moment I walked in to this Holiday Inn Express Waikiki hotel.The complimentary breakfast buffet is good and the service is incredible. The staff were VERY friendly, polite and helpful.The room is small but clean. The air conditioning unit is very loud.I really enjoyed my stay at the Holiday Inn Express Waikiki hotel for four nights. The staff were very friendly, polite and helpful. They made my stay very pleasant.I definitely recommend a stay at this Holiday Inn Express Waikiki hotel.

The gentleman at the check in desk was absolutely wonderful (David). He was so kind and helpful when me and my children arrived in the middle of the night. I couldn’t have done it alone and he offered more help than he needed to! Not only is the staff the best but the hotel itself is so nice and cozy! 100% would be my top choice for a place to stay when we come to Waikiki!!

Overall the hotel was ok.Pros:Good BreakfastWaikiki pink trolley stops across the streetConvenient locationFriendly check in ladyCons:The problem with this hotel is that the room was smaller than I expected. I have stayed at Holiday Inn Express in other cities and this was the smallest room. In my opinion, the room was too small for a vacation. If the rooms were bigger I would have enjoyed my stay more. There are other hotels in the area that are in the same price range but with bigger rooms.

My wife and I stayed at the Holiday Inn Express Waikiki for six nights for our anniversary vacation. The room was small, but the price was quite affordable for Honolulu. The breakfast is very nice and can save you a lot, given the prices in Honolulu. The hotel is only a few blocks from Waikiki Beach -- a very easy walk. If you have a rental car there is parking for about $33 per night. The hotel even has a concierge. Very friendly and helpful staff. I would spend the small amount extra and get the ocean view. We were on the 33rd floor and the view of the ocean was beautiful. One small negative for the room is that the air conditioning units are quite loud. We would definitely consider staying at this hotel again if we were to go back to Waikiki.

Situated 2 blocks away from Waikiki, it’s a short walk to Kalakaua Avenue next to the luxury row and international market. Parking is a premium with valet and self-service parking. Hotel parking gets full at night. Rooms are small compared to the average mainland hotel room. Delicious breakfast buffet with good seating indoors; be watchful of the pigeons if using the outside tables. Touristy, and lot’s of them. Have fun, sun, and take your time, or shall I say”Hang Loose”.

I wrote a bunch of reviews of things we did in Hawaii and neglected to recognize our hotel. We were going to spend a lot of money with a five person family so I was hoping to stay somewhere affordable but still nice as this was my kids first time in the island. Due to being a Platinum member for business traveling I was able to get a good deal on two rooms for almost two weeks.I didn’t expect a lot as there is a reason IHG is affordable but we were pleasantly surprised. Part of the hotel was closed off for construction but it didn’t cause us any problems. Parking was tight and I did have to pay for it but that’s Hawaii.The breakfast was really good and included in the price which was great so we didn’t have to overpay for more than one meal a day on the island. One Hawaiian employee came over to talk to us and gave us some nice recommendations. He didn’t get harassed for wasting time like you would probably see at home. The ticket taker for breakfast was a tough older lady but I assume people wander in as the hotel is open to the main drag.The location was great and we walked to several things we wanted to do without wearing out. My daughters went down to the desk almost every night for snacks and liked the staff.Overall I really recommend this place especially if you want to spend your money on fun and still enjoy where you sleep.

The hotel is located within walking distance to the Waikiki Beach. There is parking on site for $35 a night (Multiple entries into and out of the building).The breakfast was really good with a great selection of pastries, eggs, bread and other breakfast items. We stayed on the 21st floor which had good views of the city and the mountains. It came equipped with a microwave and fridge. The rooms are rather small and the ceiling is really low especially for a tall person (6’ 2”). The fan is almost touching my head. The air conditioning unit is very noisy and not so effective. The hallways on my floor at some unpleasant odors from the carpet.

Less than 150 parking places and over 500 rooms. Over $36 to park. Smallest rooms I have ever seen with this brand. Awkward layout of rooms, no desk, 9" of closet space, not enough elevators, single tiny sink in the bathroom, no room for anything! No clue what this used to be but I had to leave after 2 nights of a planned 6 night stay. I changed rooms to a higher floor to see if that would help but small is small. Staff was friendly but you cant fix small.

Up until this ONE hotel I have always been satisfied with my stays at Holiday Inn Express hotels. I can't say I have any complaints about the cleanliness of the hotel, but I do agree with all the other reviewers that the rooms and bathrooms are extremely small, and the air conditioner is ridiculously loud. RIDICULOUSLY loud. My biggest complaint is that EVERY single employee we engaged with wanted to sell us some sort of tour that included a timeshare presentation. It didn't matter what information we were asking for, it ALWAYS led back to a tour with a timeshare attached, and the moment they found out we had no interest in paying them to be trapped in a 4 hour tour of their partner resort, they had ZERO interest in "helping" us any longer. It was like we ceased to exist. It was so bad that THREE different times employees walked away to "find out an answer for us" and just never returned. We couldn't get even the simplest question answered like where can we catch a shuttle or what restaurant would you recommend? I have never experienced such a blatant disregard for service over selling in my life. The pressure they must get to sell, sell, sell must be extreme. Oh, and did I mention that the air conditioner is ridiculously loud?

Great hotel surprise upon my early arrival, entered into my upgraded room with great views of the beach. Shopping and a great bar nearby. Gym and pool are great, plenty of equipment so no waiting in busy times.

The Holiday Inn Express -Waikiki was very nice, but our room was tiny! To be fair, ours had two double beds, but they took up the entire room! You couldn’t walk around one of the beds because it had to be pushed against the wall. The bathroom was small but adequate. Everything was very clean. The hotel is very new and modern. The breakfast area was nice. The location is very convenient, just a few blocks from the beach. The staff were very friendly and helpful! As long as you are prepared for a very small room, I’d recommend it.

3 blocks from the beach. Beds were very comfy.A strange set-up with the lifts as we had to change from one to the other if we wanted to go to the pool/spa pool and gym (outdoor games) on the 5th floor, although these facilities were great. Lobby to level 24 and the other was level 26-44 or the like. We were in level 27. We opted for the upgrade to have a beachfront room. (Pleased we didi) Receptionist Gladys and Melonie were super helpful and pleasant to talk to.Rooms were small but functional and a tad dated but clean. Our daily cleaner was smiley and upbeat.Breakfast is included although very much like a production line (cutlery plates and cups all plastic) and food was average. Staff very pleasant and we had toast, bananas spreads and coffee most mornings. Overall I would give the hotel a very fair 7.5 from 10.

I travelled as a single mother with my two children, 9 and 11. Had I known how far from Waikiki beach this hotel was I would not choose it again. I was told it was 3 blocks from the beach but I found it was a deceptive. I was 20 weeks pregnant on arrival and maybe that took our “10 min walk” to more than 30 mins but who knows. After the first couple days we got bus passes and just took the bus up and down the strip. This was our first time traveling to Hawaii as I’ve gone to mostly all inclusive. On arrival we did receive “lei” on the bus and that was awesome. Check in was smooth, and the front desk staff were courteous. Our room was extremely small, the view was okay but I couldn’t imagine coming back to this resort and having to spend a week in this size room with young kids again, but we always make the best and my kids were happy. The complimentary buffet breakfast is great, the cinnamon buns are the best. It’s nice that there is a 24 hr snack store for ($) and you get a discount as a guest and always lots to choose from. Prices are more than affordable. The pool is decent and nice way to spend the afternoon after going down to the beach. Everything in this hotel seems to be very “express” meaning compact. There is mini golf which is a nice treat and the gym seemed satisfactory. I think it would be a nice resort for a couple perhaps but I would not book a stay again traveling with kids. The continental breakfast is a crowd pleaser and is a great feature to have when traveling to Hawaii.

I would like to thank the entire staff at the Holiday Inn Express Waikiki for making our first trip to Hawaii the most memorable experience ever for my family and me. From the moment we arrived until we sadly closed the door behind us for the last time, they treated us like royalty but even more than that, they made us feel like part of the family. It was a week full of wonderful memories we will cherish for a lifetime. This is an exceptional group of people and a magnificent hotel, although the staff made it feel more like home. By the way, the breakfast buffet is exceptional and kid certified as well.

We are here at the moment,there’s 4 of us in our group from Scotland.We can’t believe anyone can put a negative review about this hotel.They go on about the airconditioner but I think it’s great.We don’t use it during the night as we use the overhead fan which is fantastic,pardon the pun.We have more than enough storage space for our clothes.The rooms aren’t the biggest but to us they are more than adequate,fridge is a bonus and coffee machine and microwave there if you want to use them.The shower is great and the bed and pillows are so comfortable.Breakfast has a great choice of foods,cold and hot.Great choice of breads too,great coffee and tea is good,being from the uk we like good tea.The location is great and every time we walk in the area we find something new,we found I hop along the road and to us that was a wow,as we don’t have them back home.The staff here are so very nice,very helpful with anything you ask their help for.This is our first time in Hawaii and to us it’s just the best experience we have ever had.Well done holiday inn Waikiki.

We booked a king bed room and we checked in around noon time due to our early flight, they upgraded to double queen bed for my daughter to enjoyed her own bed with four nice and comfortable pillows, preparing for her Marathon! Free good breakfast included in hotel rates, love it ...Walking to the beaches is not closer like the old location but everything is newly renovated and very clean

Stayed here because we got a Government Rate. After getting there I have to wonder if it's legal or safe for a hotel room to be this small? It's definitely not comfortable or relaxing. They have crammed as many rooms as they can possibly get into the building with no regard for their customers comfort. Felt like we were packed into a can of sardines. They chose to sacrifice quality for quantity. This was a very bad decision and will definitely cost them customers in the future. The loud window air conditioner was mere inches from the bed and blows onto your face. It wasn't controlled with the thermostat. A maintenance man finally came to the room hours after we complained but said he was unable to fix it. (I wonder now if the HVAC is set up like this due to so many people being in such a small space). You get too cold and wake up to turn it off, then you get to hot and wake up to turn it back on. I ended up getting sick because of this. Other reviews talk about a nice view but our widows were so dirty on the outside that the view was obscured. The ceiling fan is way too large for the room and hangs dangerously close to your head, someone is going to get hurt. I wonder if their insurance is aware of this? The water pressure is terrible in the shower and gets worse when the person on the other side of the cardboard wall is taking a shower or flushes the commode. The doors aren't slow closing doors and are VERY loud and rattle the walls when they slam close. The walls are very thin with zero noise barrier. People snoring in different rooms kept us awake. BUT to hear people using the restroom was just plain gross. It was like we were literally in the restroom with them. I will never forget this. Parking is EXPENSIVE and you get charged EVERY TIME you move your car and re-enter the parking garage. If the garage fills up you can park several blocks away and walk to the hotel but this feels unsafe as there were some suspicious people hanging around the area and in front of the hotel by the parking garage entrance. There are quiet a few people in our group of Government Employees and Contractors and I will definitely dissuade them from staying here.

An affordable hotel. The mini golf area was a big hit for my two young boys. The rooms were fine and location was only a short walk into the main centre of town and a short walk to the beach. The check in staff were great and most front line staff were friendly to deal with during my staff.The table tennis area needs to be relocated to an area which is more sheltered with the winds that are common at this level from the ocean area it makes playing with a light ball difficult. I was able to quickly identify various more ideal locations but I will leave you to see if you can see them too.We returned for a second stay after coming back from the north shore. The check in lady was a manager or supervisor and manner due to wearing a different attire our experience with her and her attitude at check in was unfortunately not great. She was more interested in telling me about the Hawaii laws and regulations rather than providing a friend check in process. Some training is probably required with this member of staff as they approach this work with an iron fist rather than aloha spirit and I don't really need to hear about their policy and procedures at check in.If the property requires a specific set of requirements around check in with the booking then these should be detailed as part of the reservation. My wife presented all passport holders of guests at check in, credit card and disappointedly was dismissed that this was not sufficient and only I could check in. My wife was left unable to check in with two young children left waiting until I could arrive which was less than ideal.I am not against law requirements and happy to meet any of these obligations, if they are however required the hotel needs to clearly outline these in the confirmation email.I note that the confirmation email did not provide this requirement that I needed to be in attendance nor did the reservation information request this information despite prior knowledge that 2 adults and 2 children would be present.Frustratingly despite initially providing all the passport holders, I was asked again to write down the names of all the guests again by the check in member of staff.The property really needs to proceed towards a frictionless checkin process it seems the procedures have not captured the enhancements in technology to remove a number of these obstacles and probably requiring some review with technology advancements now available. The conduct of the manager or supervisor that performed the check in was only interested in reciting the Hawaii law rather than handling the situation with grace. After a long days travel this was not what we expected especially from management.As a member of IHG too this was less than an ideal experience.No doubt a short 30 minutes brain storming session on how to approach this next time could address such short comings in the future.

First I need to qualify by saying this was my first trip to Waikiki. This hotel may be sensational when compared to others nearby. It definitely had all the essentials for me. Friendly staff. Clean comfortable room. Decent and safe location. Everything in the room worked. The rooms were unexpectedly small. I mean Manhattan small. No room even for a small desk. One small chair and a king size bed filled it. Free breakfast was typical for Holiday Inn Express. Nothing memorable. But the way they have it set up is genius. Very easily accommodates a large amount of people. You don't wait in long lines. Easy to get to the coffee. You can even enjoy breakfast outside. Decent facilities, pool and exercise room. $32 a night seemed high for parking. Even in Waikiki. Location is good. Walking distance from great shops and restaurants. It's a hike to the beach but then again this is not an expensive hotel. Some rooms have a good ocean view. This hotel is definitely a great value.

I took a trip for my bucket list. Hawaii was so beautiful. The people treat you like family. The breakfast buffet was well rounded with great variations. Highly recommend this property to anyone aspiring to spend time in Waikiki.

The hotel property is beautiful. They have a fabulous breakfast with a variety of food. Waikiki beach is just a 10 to 15 minute walk from the hotel. We stayed on the 37 floor with a fabulous ocean view. The neighboring hotel had a firework show every Friday night. A lot of restaurants are in walking distance.

The location of the hotel is great, just a short walk to the beach and wherever you want to go in Waikiki. Pros -The breakfast each morning is good, they switch the items up which is nice. It was good to have a refrigerator and microwave. There is an ABC store right across the street so we go some drinks and snacks for the beach. Cons- If you are a light sleeper the AC is loud and the doors to the rooms slam. Also since it’s a high rise sometimes the elevators take a long time. We had to ride the elevator down and take the other ones up (they are split floors 1-24 and 26 and higher) to get to the gym and pool on the 5th floor. We realized halfway just to take the stairs down to the 24th floor and use that set of elevators to get to the 5th floor.I would stay here again if it’s just 2 people, more then that would be very tight.

Unfortunately, there’s a lot more cons than pros for this place. The breakfast is awesome. There’s a great selection: Sausage, biscuits, gravy, omlets, assorted cereals, oatmeal, bagels/English muffins/toast, pancakes, cinnamon rolls. It is a GREAT breakfast. The location is good. It’s within walking distance to pretty much everything. The staff is AMAZING. Every single person we spoke to was polite and helpful and just incredible. Sadly though, we’ve got to be honest about the cons. The rooms are TINY. I’m talking: 2 people can’t walk through the room at the same time. I could touch both sides of the bathroom walls at the same time. The beds were not comfortable. The air conditioning is brought to you by WINDOW UNITS. I’ll say that again. *Window unit* air conditioning in freakin Hawai’i. Needless to say, the room was overall extremely uncomfortable. The pool is just embarrassingly tiny (the pictures can be deceiving).The parking is way too expensive for guests. $35 a day when I’m already paying over $1000 for the week?!? The laundry room is an insane rip off. $4 to wash and $4 to dry each load?? I know this is a touristy place. But please don’t add insult to injury by waaaaayyyyyy overcharging for self service laundry too. The doors slam, so when the other guests on the floor come back in the middle of the night....everyone else on the floor knows. The elevators are painfully slow, which seemed to be the icing on the poo cake that was this overall experience.  I’m a die hard Holiday Inn Express fan. But this one hurt my feelings and I wouldn’t recommend it to anyone visiting the area.

The Holiday Inn Express Waikiki is a bit of a contradiction! The staff are very good but the facility itself has too many negative limitations. The rooms are too small and ours was just that. Imagine a room with one low level chair, a high table and no bar chair to provide appropriate seating at the table which would allow a guest to sit at the table and look out at the view! The view was ok but I want to sit comfortably to look at it. No such luckThe doors are very noisy in this hotel and they need something to reduce the crash every time a guest tries to close the doors. The air conditioner is so noisy that it was almost impossible to hear the audio! How useless is that?The breakfast does not provide enough good food to make it worthwhile to bother. The breakfast room is ok but the outdoor seating is disgraceful! I watched pidgeons all over the outdoor tables even when guests were attempting to eat their meal. This must be a health hazard to say the least. The pancakes were pitiful as far as nutritional value is concerned. Not a whole grain to be found!Overall, I cannot recommend this hotel as a place to spend any time at! Go elsewhere where the facilities are better and cleaner.

Visit Waikiki during Chinese New Year in Feb. Search hotels and choose HI Express cuz it's located in Waikiki beach. Location is ok about 15 mins walk to the beach and shops just 5 mins away. Room is tiny but clean. There is no more space for your luggage and sitting area. Bathroom is even smaller and it can fit only 1 person to stand. Breakfast is always included in Express, it is very simple but just fill up your stomach. I booked HI Express thru a travel agent and it is expensive to me cuz all hotels are very expensive in Waikiki. Agent didn't tell me there is extra charge for hotel amenities which is USD10/room/night. That;s make the cost even more expensive. For the total amount I paid, I can choose even better hotel in Waikiki.

My wife and I had a wonderful two week experience at this hotel. The staff is impressive from the front desk to the room cleaners. Our room was quiet and everything in the hotel looked clean and well maintained. Super location. Pool area had ample seating and covered a good size area to suit most patrons. Room is small and sometimes we needed to put a pillow between us and the AC, but we new this ahead of time from the previous reviews. Breakfast is really outstanding - great choices and well prepared. Our only concern with breakfast was the large flock of very aggressive pigeons. Much effort was needed to chase them from the tables plus they are not sanitary around food. The staff tried hard but at times were overwhelmed. We look forward to returning.

I stay here for a week with 30 teenagers on a tour our company planned. The hotel is about 4 blocks from the beach. It was an easy walk. Along the way there is high end shopping, restaurants and a pharmacy. Right across from the hotel are a few convenient stores to buy water, pop, alcohol, sunscreen, fruit, snacks, souvenirs etc. As a large group we used a tour bus a few times-other wise we walked to all locations. Like the beach, hard rock cafe, international street food market, italian buffet, and flea market. Its about a $45 taxi ride and 25 minutes to the hotel from airport. The continental breakfast includes-cereal, oatmeal, fruit, eggs, bacon, yogurt, milk, juice, coffee, pancakes, toast, bagels. It was sufficient for the week. The rooms are little. They have what you need but tiny. Hairdryer, coffee maker, and extra towels at pool. The pool is not heated and closes early-8 pm. The pool is also small but the beach is near so we did not use much. Service was great. Very cheerful staff and helpful. Security monitored our kids halls. It is a little noisy. We were on 18th floor. With air conditioner on it was ok.

i was solo, did not mind the size of the room, i've seen smaller rooms in tokyo, free breakfast, free wifi, parking $36, kinda high like all waikiki hotels, room and bathroom clean, bed comfy, ac right next to bed, did not use.

At first glance it seemed like a typical HIE you would find any where. I have stayed at HIE's around the lower 48 states and in Shanghai. The room we are in is a matchbox. The A/C unit blows right in your face when you sit up in bed. We are talking 3 feet away. You just have enough room to enter and walk around the bed. It does have the in room fridge, microwave and coffee pot. The complimentary breakfast is also included. However, you cannot charge anything to your room. When I booked the hotel for March 8 -10 no such service charges appeared on my invoice. They informed me that the service charges were like resort fees. This is no resort. It has a fitness center, a small pool and hot tub. Notice the A/C wall unit next to the bed in the attached picture.

Breakfast is the only thing is good a lot variety, but room is to small not good for a family.Parking to small too, if you late to come back at the hotel you need to find a parking on the street.Shopping walking distance a lot signature branded that you can buy with a lower tax.

The location and breakfast are great and room had great views, but had an awful smell of cigarrettes. Got changed to a different room. Staff was kinda rude. It's okay for the price you're paying, very close to the main street in Waikiki. Comfy beds.

After staying in a hostel this was paradise. Concierge was friendly and welcoming but not the receptionist (she had had a bad day). None of the staff had a smile for us. I am not sure how to be politically correct in saying that we were not considered customers, maybe because we appeared to look like them. Included breakfast buffet had a spread of north american food, nothing local except for fruit (disappointing). Keeping with Holiday Inn standards, our room on the 19th floor was clean and decent, had a fridge and coffee maker (Kureg) but no kettle. There was a cold water dispenser in the lobby. Parking was exorbitant at $35/day. AC was pretty noisy. The washroom extractor fan was loud and there was no choice in switching it OFF, it was made to work with the light. Literally could not hear anything else if it was On. We are IHG customers so we will stay here if required again.

Holiday inn did its best to renovate an old building. That means that rooms are tiny, bathrooms are tiny, no central air, just a wall unit that can be loud and struggle to keep up, low ceilings and lack of additional elevators. Furniture and decor is new.But beyond that, the rooms are clean and renovated, they have mini fridge and microwave, and very nice views on top floors. I enjoyed beautiful sunsets and also Friday fireworks from the Hilton.There is a large hot tub and a small pool.Breakfast is included and is standard buffet style. Met my needs.Location for shopping and restaurants is great. Also it is located at west edge of Waikiki, closest to the airport. It is half a mile or 10 minute walk to beach.Every singe interaction with staff was positive. They were very professional and courteous.

The room was very small! Not much room to hang our clothes. The room was also very small as well as the bathroom. The free breakfast was okay - the standard free breakfast I guess. However, it was a place to stay, the rooms were clean, the staff was good. Had no real complaints and nothing fantastic either.

Have been staying at this hotel for the last 3 years. Even after the renovations the elevators are extremely slow, waiting times in the morning averages 20 minutes. Lady collecting tickets for breakfast, very unfriendly, you can tell that she does not enjoy her job. Yesterday Jan. 23 there was a different person and she was a breath of fresh air. As a Spire Elite member, not impressed at all.

The room was much smaller than anticipated, very little storage if there are two people in the room. The hanging space for clothes was about 14 inches wide. The bathroom is also small. Don't pay for an ocean view, yes the view is nice but the beach is three blocks away and the extra price isn't worth it. We had people slamming doors at all hours of the day. I will say that everyone on the staff we had an interaction with was friendly and helpful, they displayed the spirit of Aloha, too bad the hotel wasn't up to the staff level. Parking is outrageous and if you return to the hotel late in the evening, good luck. The elevators are slow, we waited 10 minutes once for an elevator we could get on that wasn't already full. On a positive note, the breakfast and breakfast staff were great, especially considering the mix of guests. I've stayed in different hotels in the area, this one would not be on my top five to go back to again.

We go to Hawaii every year and decided to try holiday inn for our 2-week stay this year. We were with our 9-month old and stayed at room 4009, 2 bed with partial ocean view. Views were amazing, room was good size but could use some improvement. The AC was loud and could not be controlled by the thermostat, toilet paper holder was broken, ceiling fan was a safety hazard. The ceiling was not high enough and if you arent mindful, you may hit the fan and hurt yourself. Breakfast is ok if you are staying there for only a few days but we got sick of having the same breakfast menu every single day for 2 weeks.We inquired about late check-out right when we got there since our flight back was not til 10pm. Having an infant, we were prepared to pay an extra day but the way they handled the situation was very frustrating. We were told that it is best to check the day before or the day of checking out but when we did, we were told that our room type was not available anymore even for half day rate, which was a lie because when we checked on Expedia it showed an availability of same room type. We talked to the manager, who allowed us to check out at 2pm but did not apologize at all. We felt like they never appreciated our 2 week stay. So never again Holiday Inn!

I already posted a review earlier. We went on a couples trip and stayed at the holiday Inn express . It was not a good experience. Its not usually the type of hotel that we stay in but we wanted to try something different . My husbands card was charged twice as I said in my previous post. Also the first day my shoes were stolen out of my room . I would not recommend this hotel as there are other nice hotels that you can stay in while your visiting Hawaii.

The hotel was 10 minutes walk to the beach. They had a really good breakfast. The rooms were very small and the bathroom extremely small with no counter space. I was in room 2014 I would not stay there again. .

We stayed at holiday inn and staff was very helpful getting around and we used Concierge to book trips to do on island. Was in walking distance to beach and all stores. Very good stay! Pool on roof nice relaxing feature.

Ohio, United States

review_body: We arrived around midnight. They gived us tiny old room with broken aircondition. After night I asked about upgrade , because one of my privilege as a IHG PLATINIUM customer it is. They proposed to change room (with upgrade) for additional cost! what a surprise! Because of tiny room which looks like hostel room we decided for "upgrade" with additional $25+tax (for each night) change room. It was just before Christmas, beginning of holidays so this was the reason why we agreed with this"deal". However I think that is scandal....Regarding property - it's more like hostel not hotel... paper walls, very dated, food under any standard - Breakfast like a joke almost nothing to eat only unhealthy and tasteless. Starbucks is walkable from this property fortunately. I'm loyalty IHG customer but will never stay in this property on Hawaii again! I'm disgusted

I only had a short layover in Honolulu and decided to stay here rather than at the airport. Rooms are small but clean. Excellent air conditioning. Very friendly staff. Would stay here again (though must admit that there appeared to be a lot fo other options --- though probably much more expensive).

This hotel is like a hostel. We will never stay again. The rooms are the size of the bed and you can't lay in bed because the AC window unit is blasting air at you from 2 feet away. There were hairs in the towels. The walls are paper thin and we were woken up in the night when people talked in the hall. Never again.

The reception staff failed to advise that my deposit would be returned in 5 to 7 days, as I had planned a further trip to Maui, using the same cc. Had I known this I would have used another cc. Staff weren’t forthcoming with information as to the charges. Waited at the bell’s desk for over 10 mins so that the bellman could finish his irrelevant conversation with other staff members. Due to the above issues, I paid my security deposit via cash and on check out the reception staff almost forgot to return my $100! Rooms were clean but the other hotel visitors slammed their doors without regard for others! This occurred well into the late night. Buffet breakfast was free because the food was below standard. The gym was the only positive experience. Do not buy anything in the hotel’s small kiosk. Bottles of water was way over priced when the ABC store is just around the corner and way cheaper. Never again will I stay or recommend this hotel to anyone, there are better hotels to stay at in Waikiki. Don’t waste your time or money!!

The Holiday Inn Express was an ideal place to stay before and after our cruise. The staff was very attentive and helpful. Breakfast offered a wide variety of foods, and was very good. The hotel was close enough to walk all over Waikiki. A problem with our air conditioner was fixed immediately.

When we arrived, we were greeted in the open air reception (the weathers is so nice), and the staff were very friendly and helpful. The room were small, but hey, its just a base, the views over the Pacific were great, as we were on floor 26, so couldn't hear any street traffic either. Yes, the air conditioning units were slightly noisy,but we had a fridge and coffee maker and tv. The gym was good, and the laundry had plenty of machines and washers. All in all, the price is good compared to a lot of the hotels on the island, and the breakfast was ideal too, we loved the fact you could have either pork or turkey sauages, as not everyone eats turkey, and the range of other items was pretty good too

Went to this hotel for girls trip with my mom and two friends. As a platinum member we travel a lot for work and know great service. The front staff service was amazing. One team member really stuck out. Melonie made us feel warmed and welcomed the moment we walked in to the place. We ended up getting another room since my friends couldn't handle our snoring (oops) Even though they weren't on the same floor as us, she got us a room near by at no problem at all. We were blessed that she also check us out with no issues and very seamless. They held our bags as we went to get food the last day before our flight back to Texas. A couple of flaws though hot tub on the 5 floor wasn't as warm as we liked it (and it closed at 8) and i would have liked a bit more fresh fruit at breakfast. Small rooms but we weren't in the rooms a lot. Would come back to this hotel when we are back!!

Wow, what a contrast between the airy open lobby and the cramped room above on Floor 27. This must be the smallest room I ever have stayed in lately in a major hotel. Granted, the Holiday Inn Express brand is at the lower end of the IHG chain, but here the architects went too far.The room is dominated by the very comfortable queen-size bed with not quite 3 ft space on each side for the night tables and 4 ft at the foot end, where they still squeezed in a small drawer cabinet, which also serves as luggage rack and above a good-sized wall-mounted flat screen TV. A reading chair with an overhead lamp fills the corner. There is no writing desk, only a small movable and height-adjustable over-bed table meets that requirement.The window fills the entire width of the outer wall with the air conditioning unit stuck into one pane of it. Unfortunately, it is the side and height where your head rests on the bed. Extremely uncomfortable, if not impossible to sleep or even to lie on the bed with the unit turned on and the cold air blowing at you.The entrance hall is the width of the door plus a very narrow open closet, housing a fridge, coffee maker and microwave, but leaving just Inches for hanging your cloths. Even for Hawaii, where one doesn’t have to dress heavily, this is skimpy considering that most guest don’t just travel with an overnighter.The bathroom is sufficiently functional with a bathtub-size walk-in shower. A little more water pressure would be desirable.The hotel is extremely clean. The staff is very friendly and helpful like almost everybody in Hawaii. The free breakfast is simple but satisfies a normal hunger. To sum it up, the HI Express is not a bad deal, considering price and location if one travels light, stays are short and most time of the day is spent somewhere else. I would give it a 4* rating, but for the ridiculous placing of the A/C it is only 3*.

Booked a last minute solo trip to Honolulu and decided to stay at the Holiday Inn Express due to cost and location. Front desk staff was very friendly and check-in was quick and easy. Yes, the room was on the small side, but completely fine for 1 person.I was impressed by how clean the room actually was and also quite comfortable. There were plenty of options for breakfast. The hotel is just a few blocks from Waikiki Beach, so it was an easy walk. Thank you for a nice stay.

As everyone says, very small rooms. But the real issue was the constant mechanical noise in the room.It’s overpriced for poor quality sleep.Breakfast was good for holiday inn.Overall I’d advise you to stay somewhere else.

Room is overlooking to waikiki beach.Walking distance to shopping and dining. Friendly helpful filipina front desk. Rooms are a bit small but it’s enough space for us 3. Too bad we are only staying here for 1 night. The next time we’ll be back to visit would love to spend the whole week here.

This was out third stay here and absolutely loved it! The kids had a ball with all the activities available to them. Room was spotless and plenty big enough for us! The breakfast was good, plenty to choose from and the kids thought it was good, a cooked breakfast every morning! Staff her exceptional as always, will stay here again

I have stayed 3 nights in Holiday Inn Express Waikiki. When I checked in on November the 21st, I asked the front desk young lady that I will take a cruise after my stay and will be back on December the 1st, since the cruise arriving in the morning and my flight back to Los Angeles is departing at night, if it is possible I can store my luggages in the hotel for couple of hours on that day. The lady told me ‘That is fine, we can do it for you.’ When I arrived the hotel in the morning on December the 1st, I politely asked the front desk lady who named Bea to store my luggages for a few hours, she was extremely rude to me. When I approached the front desk, there were 3 employees there with no customer. When I starting ask her to store my luggages because the other lady told me yes when I checked in, she rudely said no and asked me to stay away from her because she wants to help other customers, at the mean time, the other two employees were standing there with no customers. She yelled me out many times without explanation of why they promised me I can store my luggages when I checked in and then denied when I arrived. That made me so unconvinced because I have to spend my whole day with my luggages to go everywhere. I totally understand the polices you may have, but should all the employees knowledgeable to that and tell me no at the beginning? That I would have chance to store my luggages in the harbor. The worst part was the frond desk lady Bea was very impolite and none professional of treating the me with her rudest way made me feel like you guys got my money already on your hands days before and no longer need to care of me anymore. The WORST hotel experience ever!

Staff was welcoming upon arrival- even past midnight! They were always smiling and greeted us every time we walked through the lobby and were happy to answer questions. They upgraded our room for free, without us asking. The room was nice, clean and quiet. The location is great- within walking distance to restaurants and the beach. Breakfast was included- although busy at times, there was lots of options to choose from and yummy!

The location is perfect. You can take a stroll to the beach, shopping centres, the high streets and good eateries. From our 43rd floor, we could see the sea and a vast view of the area.All the staff at the reception will make you feel at home. They're always ready to help you on information. The rooms are comfortable and well furnished. The coffee maker is always handy each time you need a refreshing beverage. There's also a microwave oven just in case there's something that needs to be warmed. The bathroom floor is safe as the tiles are not slippery.The breakfast bar is so well arranged that queues move very fast. Multiple appliances like the toaster, fridge to get yogurt etc, the hot drinks/coffee machines are placed along various rows so you won't have to wait for someone whose delaying. The concierge too will whet your appetite for the many tour packages available. There's also a little grocery store where you could buy a few things if you dont feel like going out. The whole of the lobby is extremely relaxing, you could just sit if you enjoy watching what's going on around you. It's also amazing how friendly all the lodgers are. I think it's a reflection of the joy derived from being part of the big picture. You will have access to the swimming pool, gym, spa etc. The restaurant too is worth giving a shot. This is definitely one of the hotels that will give you sweet memories

I am an IHG Platinum Elite Ambassador. This is the only IHG property in Waikiki. The hotel is a bit of a walk from central Waikiki beaches. When I checked in, he didn’t welcome me or thank me for being a Platinum Elite Ambassador. I asked about an upgrade, and before I could even get it out of my mouth, he said there weren’t any. I also never hear a word from the management team; usually, you at least get a welcome letter or call, but I guess I shouldn’t expect so much from a Holiday Inn Express.The rooms are tiny, in fact, the table they have in the room looks like one of the hospital room bed adjustable tables. The room modern and was clean, but housekeeping lacked consistency. I asked for extra coffee daily and had to keep asking. They didn’t leave enough bathroom products; we ran out of soap, one day left two towels and one day three. They also charge you a $25.00 amenity fee per night, which is absurd. I am not sure what the amenities are unless you include the plunge pool and small gym “amenities.” The elevators are old and very slow, so expect it to take a while if you are on a high floor.It came with breakfast, which was borderline edible. I tasted the sausages and had to spit it out. It was a lot of processed foods and very few healthy choices.

Good and recently renovated to IHG consortium standards. Nice souvenirs and bars included. Beach towels provided for your use. Great sea views though some are partial and you may be facing hundreds pairs of eyes in the revolving restaurants while you are at the balcony. Great location but expensive US$25 per day valet service for your car parking.
I had an excellent experience at this hotel.Rooms are very clean.Breakfast is excellent. It's only 5 minutes walking to Waikiki beach. Great location. I would like to come again.Love it. :D

I had an overall good stay here. The rate was much cheaper as compared to the other brand name hotels on the island. As I was arriving late at night, I decided to book this hotel as I didn't need anything necessarily right on the beach at night. Check-in was extremely friendly. The staff member checking me in recognized me IHG Platinum status and upgraded me to an oceanview room, which was very much appreciated. The hotel is huge, and I was given a room on a high floor, with indeed good views of the ocean in the distance. While there is no bar or restaurant in the hotel in the evening, there is a mini-market in the hotel, where one can purchase drinks and snacks.The room was SMALL...like, European/Asian sized-room small. If I was here for more than one night, the small size of the room would have been a major issue, but it sufficed for one night, There is a complimentary breakfast offered in the morning, which was the standard Holiday Inn Express affair...adequate. There is a pool on-site, which was never very busy, as well as a hot tub with powerful jets. There is a mini-golf course in the hotel as well on the same floor as the pool, which I thought was a great amenity. There is also a game room for kids on the same floor, as well as a gym.Check-out in the morning was again very friendly. Overall, this hotel fit the needs for me for the night. Under similar circumstances, I would consider returning the hotel again in the future.

The staff was very helpful and polite. The pool was nice on the 5th floor and so was the hot tub. Free breakfast was acceptable. My biggest complaint was about the room. I did not request a handicap room but that is what I got. I thought the room was very small with no chair in it.

We researched quite a few hotels in Waikiki to find they are all very expensive by Australian standards. We finally decided on the Holiday Inn Express in Waikiki as it looked okay and was a reasonable price compared to other hotels.We found the hotel to be well maintained, good accommodation, friendly and helpful staff across the board. We were offered a room upgrade to an Ocean View for $10 per night and it was well worth it.If there was anything we could find fault with it was that the air conditioner was quite loud but we turned it off at night and ran the overhead fan, so we had no issues sleeping at all, as a lot of other reviewers have mentioned.

We came to Honolulu on business and chose this hotel because of its proximity to our business (and the past relationship we have with this hotel chain). The breakfast was delicious but be prepared because it tends to be busy. The good thing is that there’s plenty of places to sit and eat, inside and outside. Now on to the rest of the hotel. There are two sets of elevators (which is fine) and you choose based on your floor number. That’s not such a big issue. However the elevators for the upper floors (floors 26-44), goes to the lobby, floors 2 & 3. If you choose to use the amenities you’ll be paying for ($26/day), which includes the pool, hot tub, games, chairs, fitness center, etc, you’ll need access to the 5th floor. Since we were on the 41st floor, we had to take one set of elevators down to either the lobby, the 2nd or 3rd floor, get off that set of elevators and get on the other set so we could go to the 5th floor. I’m not sure why both sets of elevators don’t have access to the 5th floor, but they don’t. As for the pool, hot tub, etc, the sun hits this area for a short time in the morning (the other high rises block part of the sun, that is, until it moves to the other side of the building). The hot tub is great, small but great. And unfortunately it’s used as a pool because the pool is freezing. When kids complain about how cold it it, it’s cold. As for our room, it was tiny. We had to ask them to remove the only chair because there wasn’t enough room for us to move around. The shower stall was the biggest part of the bathroom. We had a king size bed and while it was comfortable, it took up most of the room. We had to move things around to get in the mini fridge and around the room. The only part of the room of any size was the tv (and who goes to Honolulu to watch tv?). Now, on to parking. There is a charge for parking. Good luck trying to get a spot in the garage though (yes, they’ll remove the fee if you don’t get to park in their garage). It’s supposed to be for hotel customers only but since you don’t gain access to it with your room key card, I’m not sure how they know who’s parking in it. We found ourselves having to park a block away and walking back because their garage was full. If your hotel has almost 600 rooms, you should have more that maybe 136 (give or take) parking spots for your customers. We walked when the places we were headed to were close enough. And I think there’s public transportation close by, but since we didn’t use it, I won’t comment on it. This being said, the staff is friendly.

We spent 8 nights at Holiday Inn Express in Waikiki beginning Sept. 25th. The room was small, but for 2 people, it worked just fine. It was clean, and housekeeping was considerate of our needs. I would like to give a shout out to two staff members, Kenneth L. and Rosemaria, who went above and beyond helping us through a glitch which was not the hotel's fault. They were so helpful for our entire stay. The entire staff treated us like family. Many attractions were within walking distance.

Had a decent stay here for two nights. The staff were super friendly and the facilities are decent. The rooms are ok and are fairly big however the aircons are a bit old. Def an easy stay and in a quite a good location.

Ho Chi Minh City, Vietnam

review_body: I stayed here for 5 nights and the room was hotrrible. The airconditioning is so loud, called maintenance twicr and they couldnt solve it. You can hear everything going on outside, even the person next door showering. If you are looking for a relaxing holiday dont stay here!

Found this hotel to be a complete disappointment. Our room although quite clean, was very small and pretty basic. Comes with a free breakfast, kiwi style its crap, no wonder it was free. Has no restaurant or bar to console one self, and is not really situated that close to central Waikiki or the beach. The only saving grace this hotel has is that the staff are very polite and helpfull, and that the pool area is very pleasant.

The front desk staff were very nice and informative. We checked in then went to the elevator which was very clean. All the way up to the 35 floor (rm# 3507) opened the door to a cozy clean nicely setup room with a decent size TV (55”). Turned on the AC and slept like a baby all night with out any noise. I would recommend staying here again. A few more details. This hotel isn’t on the beach but it is only a 10 min walk to the beach or a $4.00 Uber ride. There are two close restaurants Tony Roma’s steak and Seafood and Cheeseburger Waikiki. There are 2 stores as well an ABC and a small general store.

We stayed the week, with the family booking 3 rooms in the hotel.Staff were friendly and helpful and room was clean with a great ocean view.Pool was a little on the small side but there were plenty of loungers and clean towels.Good selection at breakfast.Great location and I think good value compared to some of the other hotels of similar price and room size, that other parties in our group stayed in.

The group wish to thank Gladys and Jeremy at the reception for their attentive and swift check in which makes a “warm welcome” at this property. Obtained all rooms ><13.30 iso 15.00+. strategic Waikiki location walk distance to eateries all levels of shopping all rooms clean and bright. mine #2304 sea view comfy tall queen bed 55 inch TV. All rates inclusive buffet breakfast free Wifi a good Superior First Tourist category. Set back ‘noisy’ dated individual window type air con unit but functional & cooling. Again Gladys & Jeremy crafted a good start at the front line

Despite the small room, I had a pleasant stay and would recommend the hotel. Sure, the room isn't large, but I had space for all my stuff and was able to do sit-ups on the floor. I was here for business and stayed over two weeks and didn't have any problems with the hotel during my stay. The hotel was clean, the staff was pleasant, and the location is nice for vacationers - it's a short walk to the beach, shopping, food, parks, and museums. There is a good spot to run along the pathway bordering the canal along Ala Wai Blvd, and on the weekend I had a nice longer run along Diamond Head Road. It's just a short walk to the beach to the west of the hotel. They have a very nice self-serve breakfast. The mattress was firm and comfortable, which I appreciated since I really dislike old, unsupportive mattresses. I never had any problems with parking (though it is pricey). I stayed on the sixth floor and parked on the fourth floor, so I never used the elevators other than on arrival and departure to move my luggage. I asked for a lower-level floor so I could use the stairs instead of the elevator. The air conditioner is a little loud, but it helps drown out any other noise while you are sleeping. Overall, a very nice stay in a small, but completely adequate room.

Honolulu is full of hotels, so it was hard to choose but this turned out to be a good one. Reasonably priced, newly refurbished, clean establishment with breakfast included in the room rate. Most breakfasts offered by hotels in the US is not considered as a meal by me but this is a nice exception. Especially liked the "pancake machine" which spits out two freshly made pancakes in no time. If you don't wish to be frozen by the heavy AC of the breakfast room also can sit out where pigeons are a bit sneaky. Our room on the 42nd floor was small but functional with a stunning view on the city below and the hills around. The fridge is a nice touch instead of the useless minibar, so that you could have your own drinks cooled. Bed was comfy and the tiny bathroom had a usable size shower cabin with a proper glass door - not a bathtub with a disgusting curtain, thanks Holiday Inn! We only stayed in the room for the nights and early mornings when a fresh breeze came throgh the window, which combined with the ceiling fan was far better than the loud and freezing AC. The only annoying thing was the occasional noise of the slamming doors and flushing toilets of the adjacent rooms. The location is good, five mins walk from the ocean and in the close vicinity of dozens of stores and restaurants. Also there's a Dollar car rental two blocks away, where we rented a Mustang convertible for one day and drove up and down on the island. It was a great fun! Public transportation is pretty good - but freezingly ACd, like everywhere in this country... - so no need for a car otherwise. All in all we had a wonderful time in Hawaii and spent an awesome holiday in this inn! :-)

The hotel location is pretty good, you are at Waikiki Beach after a few minutes walk and the shopping streets where you can find restaurants and all shops you can ask for are also nearby. The rooms are a bit small when you travel with larger suitcases but for a few days it was ok for us. Everything was clean and the bed is very comfortable. We had a room with ocean view from the 44th floor which was beautiful. Unfortunately our air condition stopped working after 2 days, but we went to the reception and they fixed the problem within about 15 minutes (it was 9 pm so we appreciated that there really was someone there to fix it right away, we were sure we had to wait for the next day). The breakfast is ok for american standards, I think you have to arrange with that when you're travelling in the U.S. ;-)

Pros: Great location and reasonable price for Waikiki. Within walking distance to beach and high end shopping galleria. Room had microwave and small fridge. Breakfast included with lots of options for food. Con: room was dorm sized with little extra room. Coffee and tea not available outside of breakfast hours. One thing to stay away from are the tours that hotel sells. We did the Pearl Harbor tour which essentially was to take us to PH which is a National Park and because the dock is still closed you take a ferry out to look at the memorial from a distance. This is for $115 per person. Save your money and simply take an Uber because we pay for the parks with our tax dollars.

This was to be my husbands first trip to Hawaii as well as our children's first trip so I was really hoping that when I picked this hotel, that it would hit all the points to make it a great trip. We booked a room with 2 queen beds and requested a higher floor. At check in, we were pleasantly surprised to be given a room with a partial ocean view and a view of Diamond Head which was really nice. Great beginning to the stay!
