The room itself is just what other reviewers had written, small, but in my opinion, it was good enough for what it was. After all, its Hawaii, how often are you in your room? The hotel had also been recently refurbished. For anyone that's been to Hawaii before, this used to be the old Maile Skye Court hotel.Hotel had the standard amenities..There's a pool which was located on the 5th floor. Very small and we had to take 2 elevators to get to the pool since our room was on one of the top floors. Other than that hiccup, towels were plentiful and there were also some outdoor games that the kids could play like a putting green, chess, ping pong, etc... There's also a hot tub on the same level but just like the pool, its also very small.One of the big pluses for this hotel was the fact that they served breakfast daily and that breakfast was already included into your rate. The standard of Holiday Inn Express. At check in, the front desk agent will give you vouchers for the duration of your entire stay. Upon entering breakfast, you will surrender 1 voucher per person attending. None were needed for the kids. The breakfast always consisted of some type of egg (scrambled or omelette form), breakfast meats, pancakes you can make on your own and various other choices. My kids loved the pineapple and mango yogurts that they had to offer. Nice Hawaiian touch added to the breakfast. Get there early as the seats fill up quick. But the staff was always helpful and replenished things promptly. If you sit outside, beware of the pigeons. They will lurk until someone drops a morsel... lol We also liked the location of this hotel because it was within walking distance to the old international market place and nearby restaurants and shopping centers of Waikiki. You can easily get a cab or the trolley pickup is right across the street at the La Croix hotel.So why the 3 star review... Although we enjoyed our stay here, the one big annoyance during the trip was the obnoxious concierge!!! Beware when booking any type of activity here... Although they may be somewhat knowledgeable about the tours and attractions, they have their own agenda which is to push Wyndham time shares. They will offer you a 200.00 credit in exchange for your time of seeing a timeshare presentation that they said was less than an hour. I almost laughed. What time share presentation has anyone been to that's been less than an hour? And it wasn't just one individual too. It was almost all of them. Any time you stopped and inquired, they're breathing down your neck about supposedly saving money by seeing the presentation. I'm sure that while some people may find this offer attractive, I did not. I'm in Hawaii to enjoy my time, not waste my time on some time share presentation.That being said, will we return to the Holiday Inn Express in Waikiki? Perhaps. Good amenities, short walks to nearby restaurants and shops...but will DEFINITELY stay away from that concierge desk..

We enjoyed our stay here. Our room was on floor 22, it was quiet and had a good view towards the beach, we had a great view of some fireworks. The room was small, but well laid out, we even found a good spot for the babies portable cot. The staff were friendly and helpful when required. Location was good, it's a nice walk through parks to the beach. I was disappointed we had to leave before breakfast started, I love a buffet breakfast. i had arranged for cot\crib to be in the room for us, and it wasn't, we didn't actually need it so I didn't bother asking about it.

We initially had requested an “ocean view” room. When we walked in to the room, it was small. My 7 yo and 1 yo could barely walk around. We requested a bigger room, and Jeremy at the front desk happily helped us out and gave us a bigger room, but we sacrificed the beautiful view. Breakfast was good. My picky eater was happy. The pool is a little small, but served it’s purpose. Great location, Close to everything. Over all a wonderful experience. Would stay again.

The positives... the staff at this hotel is friendly, efficient and quick to attend to your needs. The beds are comfortable and provide both firm and soft pillows. However, this is the smallest hotel room I have ever stayed in, room 3910 was our room there are bigger ones. I am 5'2'' and my elbows hit both sides of the shower when washing my hair. There is absolutely no counter space in the bathroom. I had to dry my hair outside of the bathroom to avoid hitting walls. The AC... big problem ...loud and right beside the head of the bed. So...you are blasted with air all the time you are in your bed. Due to the size of the room you can only be on your bed. We ended up trying to place suitcases in front of the ac unit to deflect the air. The closet is only about 18 inches wide so even if you are hanging clothes they get squished and need to be ironed. The breakfast is included which is nice but being in Hawaii you should have a bit more fresh fruit to start the day this is a bit disappointing. This hotel is fine for a short stay but not more than a day or two. We walked to the beach each morning through the park so that wasn't too bad but it is a little far from the restaurants in Waikiki for some people.

I am platinum level so expect better. When I checked in, I was told I had an upgrade. Huh? The room is so tiny, the bed takes up the entire space. Two people cannot pass each other. There is a tiny closet with NO hangars. So I ask what use is the bar across the top? And it actually infringes on the bathroom so that it takes up half the space in front of the sink. You cannot stand in front of the sink. How is this possible? The air conditioning unit is a window unit and it is so noisy you cannot sleep. There is no desk at all so no place to put your stuff and forget about opening your laptop. And to top it off they charge a $22 resort fee. For what, I ask? For the wifi that is free anyway? For a pool that is standard? Bah, give this hotel a miss if you can. My stateroom on the cruise was bigger than this.

We booked this because friends were staying there and so wished they had checked the reviews before booking1. The rooms were extremely small with very little room to hang any clothing. The wardrobe had the iron, ironing board and hairdryer in and then we were expected to put our clothes in a gap of 10 inches.2. When the air conditioning was on the room stunk. We had to turn it off when we got in the room because it was so bad. We asked to be moved but was offered two rooms even smaller and accepted the third, but even then the air conditioning stunk3. The air conditioning was so loud we couldn't have it on during the night if you wanted sleep4. The room was so small that when I got dressed one day and lifted my arm it caught to ceiling fan and hurt like hell5. The bathroom was so small that you couldn't have two people in the bathroom at one time6. Finally there was cockroaches in the bathroom. 7. The breakfast finished sharp at 930 and they didn't place any new found out after 9amI would visit Honolulu again but would not recomment this hotel at all

I paid for full oceanview and they put me in a partial. When I called the front desk convinced me I couldn't see the ocean because it was dark. In the morning. I called back and after haggling over views I was switched to a room with a full view. I had to pack and unpack which was inconvenient and they didn't offer extra IHG points or credits for the first night without view or the incovenience of switching. Most irritating: they didn't have any ocean views when I checked in and tried to hustle me. Also parking is a nightmare...

The staff was always welcoming. They had a very good but busy breakfast area for free. Only issue would be the parking tickets were a bit confusing. Rooms were clean and they were cleaned early. No complaints at this location

Great location with bus route outside direct to main strip for $2 a day Very clean and modern Extremely high but gives you fantastic views I was on 37th floor Good selection of breakfast choices weekend seemed particularly busy but staff cope well with keeping tables cleared and food coming out Nice pool area on 5th floor Didn't use but good gym and games room as well as large laundry area We were on a 5 day trip and perfect for us location wise bed very comfy and cleaned daily

Very clean. Checked that first. No balcony - sad about that, but I should have checked. Air conditioner was like a 474 airplane. Bath fan almost as bad. Window opened maybe 6 inches so had to use air conditioner. Definitely not for a vacation. Business maybe but bring ear plugs.

I visited This hotel during the week of September 19, 2018. The best thing about this hotel is the breakfast. My biggest issue was the cleanliness of my room. As a travel agent, I travel extensively. I was very disappointed. The first night I noticed that my comforter was dirty. When I woke up that morning I realized that the pillow case I slept on had something on it which resembled ..black dye. I spoke with the rep at the desk and was told that a request would be submitted for the bedding to be changed. When I returned to the room that afternoon I realized the bedding was still dirty. The pillow case had been changed but the comforter was still the same. However, the bed was made up. The next day the room was not cleaned at all. This in addition to the air-conditioner unit being only about 16 inches across from the head of the bed made me very uncomfortable. I suffer from asthma so this is a health hazard for me (both dust & air blew directly in my face for several nights). Today I not only have bronchitis but a rash on the right side of my face which the dermatologist claims is from some type of germ. I’m pretty sure it’s from the bedding. Needless to say, I was very disappointed with my stay at this hotel. I will be sure to let all of the agents at my agency know not to promote this Holiday Inn Express. I’ve attached pics.

Rooms are on the small side and a dissapointment after having a condo on Kauai. Our aircon was very noisy and only have one speed, and the room had no fan, unlike out travelling companions. Make sure your room has a fan! Bathroom and shower was small but worked fine for the two of us. Bed was comfortable and Good view from 43rd floorBreakfast was part of the price and was a containerised and I wouldnt bother with it, go across the road for coffee.We found there was always a wait for lifts being a busy hotel

Our 7 nights 8 days stay at the hotel was amazing until it got ruined by the two staff mentioned in the title. There were a few staff in the concierge desk. When i went to ask one of them how to take the bus, i was told "I drive to work so don't know how the bus system works." She could have just said, please ask the front desk. On another day, she was super friendly coz she wanted me to attend a Wyndham seminar for time share. She didn't even remember how rude she was to me the day before.During our stay there, there were two staff in charge of this desk. One of them was super friendly. When i asked for directions on how to navigate the bus, he was very accommodating and comprehensive. However, the other one was the extreme opposite. On our last day, we decided to leave our luggage early not knowing they do not normally allow it. He tried to explain the policy to my sister who didn't quite understand what he said. When i went back to inquire, he was so rude and said" "i already told your sister" and "That's why you have rooms to leave your luggage." Everyone else was super friendly

Super friendly staff, very accomodating and let us check in early, as a room was available and upgraded our room for an ocean view, which was amazing.Room was very neat and clean, mini fridge and microwave, was fantastic as we travelled with kids.Rooms are very small, but as we were there for the beach, so that wasn’t a problem. Easy walk to Main Street and beach, about 10 minutes. Felt very safe at all times in this area.Breakfast was awesome, even provided takeaway coffee cups, again the staff were awesome and constantly cleaned up.My only complaint, was that the guest laundry was super expensive, over $4.00 usd each wash and dry, dryers needed at least 2 cycles for washing to be dried, so over $12 usd plus washing powder.Overall I would highly recommend this property!Travelled with 2 teenagers who loved the mini gold, table tennis, giant chess set, spa and pool, although it is small, it was perfect for our stay, as we wanted the beach over a pool.

I'm a platinum level member for IHG, but I wouldn't stay at this Holiday Inn again. I did have a beautiful view of Waikiki, but it was an extremely small room size--a small foot path around the bed, with a shower I could have climbed out of bed and into. Add to this the $25 non-Hawaii resident fee and my rate was quickly equal to the hotel rates sitting directly on the beach. Parking, as it is all over Waikiki, is expensive and add tax to that parking rate--not included. The bed was comfortable, the TV worked fine, and the room included the standard coffee pot. It was clean and the plumbing and shower worked fine. Air conditioning is a window unit that hangs over the bed. For the price, I want a larger room, a desk to work at, and A/C that's not sitting in the window like a trailer home.

My friend came to visit. Although he got a room at a reasonable price , $131. All inclusive, it didn't mention the Resort fee of $50.. Really ? What resort ? It doesn't have a pool, it's not on the beach but on a side road, and the breakfast was passable. When he checked in he was told there was a room availabile for the next day but when he checked , he was told it would be $275. Plus the resort fee. Come on !!!!! I know Waikiki is a busy place but that is stretching it.

Stayed here for one night for business and don’t think I could have stayed here longer than that. I was given an ocean view room which was amazing and the furniture itself was new. However, the rooms are super tiny like European rooms. I had a double room and you can barely fit sideways in the bathroom if you are a larger person. Only one place to really put a suitcase without blocking a walk way. The AC while adjustable blows directly on one bed constantly and is fairly loud. Also the way the rooms are set up, while I didn’t hear people through the walls, you definitely here the hallway noise, doors slamming housekeeping etc. The biggest downside is parking. They have a garage but it is public so if you can’t find a spot you are out of luck. It’s really bad at night. So park your car and never leave it. There’s is also no restaurant onsite except for breakfast but the bustle of Waikiki is a few blocks away.

Crowded busy hotel super service from check in to check out. The rooms are a bit smaller than what I expected but the overall location is convenient to shopping mall (Ala Moana and Ward Centre), about a 20 min walk.Breakfast was crowded but great value, the pool area was a nice get a way. Because of the high density of rooms there may be a wait at times for the elevator but I would definitely go back and stay again.

We came here for a 3 night stay in Honolulu. The location was fabulous - we walked everywhere and the Waikiki trolley stop was only a couple blocks over. That was our main means of transportation so it was extremely convenient. Staff was very pleasant and helpful - no problems there. Now to the room - VERY small. If you're here for awhile, you may want to upgrade to a suite. There's not much room if you've got your biggest luggage and there are only a few places where there's drawer space. The bathroom is also very small. Space is limited to put two people's toiletry bags and spread out. Definitely impossible to get two people in there to share the mirror. This room reminded me of a Manhattan hotel - they cram everything into a small space. The bed was very comfortable. No issues there at all. Now to the biggest complaint...the air conditioner. Obviously, Honolulu in September is a tad warm. While the thermostat operation is on the wall, the a/c unit is right next to the bed. When the unit is on, it's blowing right at you on the bed. It's noisy. If you're trying to watch tv, you have to crank it up. Thank goodness there was a ceiling fan in the room, because we had to turn the air off at night because of the noise. By the time we got up in the morning, it was 80 degrees in the room but the fact that it was blowing right on us (even after adjusting the vent) and the noise, it was just too much. I can't say a suite had a different a/c set up, but this room, being as small as it was, it was literally right next to the bed. Breakfast is absolutely wonderful. Lots of choices, and a huge breakfast area with plenty of places to sit - even outside. Clean and replenished often. Coffee cups are pretty small - I did see a lot of guests bringing 'to go' cups down from their room. The pool area was very nice - there are cabanas and ample lounge chairs around. Lots of things to do too - the 9 hole putt putt golf was fun. A bit of a challenge when the trade winds are kicking up, but a nice amenity. There's a ping pong table as well as shuffleboard too. The hot tub, however, wasn't hot at all. All in all, the hotel itself was very nice and convenient, but I had to take 2 points off for the a/c issue.

I personally wouldn't consider Holiday Inn Express a luxury location, but compared to some Marriott properties, this hotel has everything! Free breakfast is included (at least for our one night stay), parking was easy (although $33 per day), great temperature, lots of modern USBs to charge everything, a refill station downstairs for water bottles, and a place to do laundry yourself if you need it (open 24-7). A+ in my book. We booked this location as a breaking point between returning from KOA to BOS.

Nice clean, friendly staff and the breakfast is very good, quite the variety of stuff to choose from. We didn't rent a car but that was ok lots of stuff within walking distance. The pool area was pretty cool.

It may not be a big bad high roller hotel but it’s a pretty hotel and in a great spot! The rooms are a little small but nice and some have ocean views. The major thing about this hotel is their breakfast, it’s free for hotel guests and truly is a great breakfast! CINNAMON ROLLS ARE SO TASTY!:) I would definitely stay here again!

We stayed here for a few nights during Hurricane Lane watch. The room was small, but clean and comfortable. The air conditioner was a little loud, but considering how hot and humid it was it did a good job of keeping us cool. The included breakfast was great and included a range of food, including eggs, pancakes, bagels, fruit and yoghurt. Location was good, as it was a 10 minute or so walk to Waikiki beach and the main shopping area. The only thing I didn’t really like was the resort fee, especially as we were unable to use the pool while we were there due to hurricane threat. All of the staff were great, we had good help from the front desk, concierge and the bell hop. They were all friendly and welcoming.We would stay here again.

I stayed here for one night and it was in a very good location with a nice view. Fast and friendly Check-In. Very clean and this particular room was perfect for me, but if you are looking for a large spacious room, this is not it. Close walk to restaurants, beach, and shopping.

The hotel was nice and the staff very friendly. The rooms are really small, we stayed with our 2 young children and it was really tight. I think the rooms are made for one bed and 2 people, it's hard to walk and turn in such a small space. However, the location of the hotel is fantastic, it is within walking distance of Waikiki beach, many restaurants, parks and shopping. I'll be honest and say that I don't usually like Holiday Inn hotels as their cleanliness is not consistent but this one was great. The rooms were clean and housekeeping was great.

I stayed here for one night on transit and simply chose it was the only IHG hotel in Honolulu - plus it was a 'new' hotel... as I later found out it is 'new' in that it had only been re-branded as a HIX but that it had previously been a different hotel - not a new built.As an IHG Spire I was upgraded from a basic room to one with a sea view - but the room was tiny... you couldn't hold a cat singing convention in this hotel. I had anticipated a small room, but this was more akin to a Japanese hotel - which I suspect it was in a previous life. To give some context, it was that small that I could not lie down on the floor to do my morning sit ups... I am 6 ft.However, my biggest complaint was the aircon unit - which not only was one of those units that are mounted in the window, but the noise that it generated was so loud that I had to turn it off at night to sleep or to hear the TV. My friend has a similar experience in their room.Apart from that the rest of the facilities are in line with what you would expect from a HIX hotel...Given the size of the rooms I would only really recommend it for 1-2 people and only for those people who just need somewhere to sleep, wash and store there stuff - it is Hawaii after all! Its most definitely not for families.Would I stay here again... probably not as there are a lot of alternative options available that are, in my view, better value. However, if you just need somewhere to crash and can get it for a good price it ticks all the boxes.

Room was a little small, but well layed out, had a telescoping table that could be used on bed or with a comfortable chair. Well thought out. Really nice view, especially on 32nd floor. Keurigs had medium and dark roast coffees. Nice big TV. Air conditioning was a window unit but controlled with central thermostat. Continental breakfast was really impressive. Maybe the best continental breakfast I've ever seen from a hotel. Apparently very rare to find this in Waikiki. But it closed abrubtly at scheduled closing time, so get there on time or early. Kids enjoyed the game room and WiiUs. The exercise room had these cool treadmills where you could simulate hikes which was cool. Wish pool had been open but better safe than sorry I guess. Staff was great and were quick to respond to needs. Parking might be an issue. I found parking along the canal, but I think the city was a little empty because of the potential of Hurricane Lane (which didn't really end up doing too much in Oahu).

It is a Holiday Inn Express. It was clean, comfortable, low frills hotel. The "resort fee" was annoying, though most other hotels in the area have similar, though they have more "resort" attractions. Not far from the water, 5-10 minute walk.

I was able to visit Hawaii after living there 28 years ago, we acted like tourist. The weather was perfect as I remember. My favorite part of Holiday Inn express was the breskfadt, the pancake machine was the best. I have a new outlook on pancakes and let's not forget we got to eat with the birds everydsy

This place is by far the most deplorable hotel we’ve ever stayed at. The walls are paper thin, so you’ll get to know your neighbors weather you you’d like to or not. The rooms are so small two average size people can’t pass. The $30 per day parking fills up by mid afternoon every day, so plan on walking several blocks if you can find a spot at a neighboring hotel. The sliding bathroom door won’t stay closed. The air conditioning are window units that are noisy and don’t work well. None of the rooms have balconies and the windows don’t open. We waited an average of 15 minutes for an elevator to get to or from our room and often it was full, so we had to wait again. Do yourself a favor and pitch a tent with the homeless in the park next door.

We stayed in Holiday Inn express Kuhio on early week of August The hotel location is close to store, restaurant and beach just a walk of 10-15 minutes you will reach Waikiki beach they offer free breakfast which is reasonable for the price their pool is okay better go to the beach if you want to spent to the water our room is located in 42 floor I don’t have complain on air conditioning we just open the window at night time you can feel the Hawaiian breeze going in our room the staff is really nice to house keeping and front desk over all our stay is superb highly recommend it.

The room was incredibly small. The closet was unusable until the iron and ironing board were removed. Then there was room to hang about 5 or six items. the coffee service (Keurig) was above the mini fridge and below the Micro with no shelf space and no way to pour water in without pulling the tray out. The A/C was a window unit that was so loud, the TV volume had to be maxed out to hear, and was mere inches from the bed so the cycling on/off during the night was disruptive to sleep. The shower stall was so narrow I constantly bumped my elbows, and the water pressure was so low, it took twice as long to shower. Twice I had turned off the water, only to find I still had soap running down my legs. Housekeeping did not always replace coffee supplies, and never once replaced the plastic cups in the bathroom. I've stayed at other hotels in Waikiki, and the parking was never $33 (plus tax) per day. As a government traveler, there are many per diem options in Waikiki...I will never use this location again.

You get what you pay for. A clean tight room no real too to move around, small bathroom and average free breakfasts. Good location with lots to do near by. Would only stay here again for a short stay.

Great location. Tons of hidden fees. Free breakfast. Long waits for elevators. This place is the definition of a 3. It has a great price for a great location. If you're just looking for a place to sleep while you're out and about it is probably perfect for you. A couple friends complained about the size of the rooms, but if you're just sleeping then its perfect. no room for yoga or activities though. The service was good. The breakfast was crowded but good. The biggest negative is that the elevators are a long wait. In the morning you will probably wait a solid 5-10min and then its crowded.

Nice rooms. Easy check in. Parking is awful. If you get in after 6pm the lot is usually full and you have to park down the road. They need valet parking. Breakfast buffet is good. Maybe add waffles and fresh fruit cut up. The breakfast drink area needs to be moved out of the breakfast food area. Trying to navigate back to the drinks in the far corner is crazy. Maybe have it out by the coffee somewhere. All of the staff is very friendly and helpful. The maid we had was wonderful. Gladys Rivera at the front desk is very knowledgeable and helpful. If she is not a manager, she needs to be one. She gets stuff done. Overall, I would definitely stay here again. Only a few blocks from the beach. Very easy walk.

This property has been recently updated and is quite lovely in that regard but you must know when you book this that the rooms are SO SMALL that there is barely room to move in the room and the bathroom is hands down the smallest I have ever seen in a hotel. I know that you do not come to Hawaii to hang out in your hotel room but please be advised that this is not comfortable at all for a family to operate in any capacity, so much so that we are checking out after one night and making other arrangements. I usually only leave reviews when they are positive but I feel people need to know how these rooms are before they book a week in this hotel.

I had read the TA reviews before booking, so I booked with my eyes wide open fully expecting that the room would be: a) tiny, and b) have a noisy air-conditioner that is close to the bed. Both of these things were true, so we weren’t in shock when we entered the miniature guest room. It reminded me a lot of a hotel room we had stayed at in New York City near Macy’s. You can touch both sides of the hallway by your room with your outstretched arms. While sitting on the bed facing the air-conditioner, you can touch the unit. It’s just a couple of steps from the bed to anywhere in the room. The wall-mounted TV looks huge in the room. The room was fine for just the two of us. What we did was turn the A/C down to its lowest setting a couple of hours before we went to bed to make the room cold. Once we were ready to turn off the light and go to sleep, we just turned off the A/C altogether and we were comfortable all night long. When we woke up in the morning, it was only 76 degrees in the room, which is what we sleep at at home during the summertime. The room is tiny, but is is a small version of what you usually get in chain hotel guest room: closet, drawers, chair, coffee maker, refrigerator, and microwave oven. The bathroom was tiny, too, and I had to make a one-person rule when it came to being in there. The shower was nice as a completely glass-enclosed area. They had Bath and Body Works shampoo and lotion. The lighting is easy on the eyes in both the bathroom and guest bedroom. We had a view from the 40th floor ocean side, which we loved and were glad we paid extra for the magnificent view of the ocean and surrounding areas.As for the public areas: The breakfast area seemed to have adequate indoor and outdoor seating. The food was standard chain hotel food. The pool and hot tub were rather small. There were cabanas for your use if you could get them at the right time. After reading some of the reviews, I will have to agree that it’s not a good idea to have a family in one of these rooms. It would be too crowded. As far as the parking garage goes, we didn’t have a car. With all of the cheap transportation in the area that can take you anywhere on the island, I don’t see any need to have one, so skip the car rental and use the available transportation instead. You can be paying more for parking + rental car costs in many cases than you would when hiring transportation. Also, you can walk anywhere from this hotel: the beach in ten minutes or less, many restaurants, stores, International Marketplace, etc. Many buses are available by the hotel. The location is good at the Holiday Inn Express. I will give this hotel 3 stars because of the room size. Also, I don’t understand why this hotel, which really isn’t a resort, charges a resort fee (even though they don’t call it that, it’s what it is). If you booked this place and are worried about it, it’s really not all that horrible. Just be prepared for a tiny room.

Stayed here for 2-nights and walked to just about everything in Waikiki. The hotel is in a great location so you don't need a car to get around the nearby area. My room was on a high floor with a great view of the city. I would highly recommend staying here if you're looking for a hotel in Waikiki.

1. I've stayed here in the past.2. Seems as if the rooms SHRUNK.3. Air conditioning unit was AWFUL, turning on and off therefore this made uncomfortable sleeping. As well as uncomfortable room leisure.4. Paid 33.00 for parking, left garage for less than 3 hours only to arrive back to GARAGE FULL, refunded then they found me a spot; charged again.5. I live here, I will never be staying there again.

Good afternoon, just saying! I normally stay at Hilton properties. Embassy suites hotels are usually the best no matter where you go. You will find a bad one occasionally. I love Marriott properties but have trouble finding them where I travel. Approximately 2 years ago all of my Hilton stays started being subpar all but Embassy suites. I changed over to the IHG group. Which includes Holiday Inn Express. I have been staying there ever since and quite honestly very impressed with them. I am now staying at the holiday inn express at this location. Unfortunately I have to give a negative response. I would not recommend this hotel at all. It is poorly designed. There is not a service elevator so you spend a lot of time waiting on the elevator because house keeping keeps them tied up. I definitely would not stay on the 25th floor. They explained to me that this floor was special as you would not have to be near the elevator doors opening and closing. Lol, they were correct I can't hear the doors at all due to the fact that the elevator mechanism that makes the elevator go up and down is right next to my inner wall. I was up all night. If I had not been so tired when I got to the room they would have changed it for me I promise. Just saying!

This was my first time staying at this property and I was pleasantly surprised. I was in Hawaii for 2 weeks and this hotel met all my needs. Mini fridge and microwave worked. AC was cold. Free breakfast-not much variety but it worked. Fitness center was perfect. Onsite laundry. Room was a little on the small size but the view was great.I would certainly consider staying here again.

Let me start by saying that I have been in the top tier of the IHG program since 1998,,,20 years. So I have stayed at ALOT of Holiday Inn Express' over the years. I have never had such a TINY, crappy room as this. Nor have I ever experienced such poor customer service as I did from the manager, Tiana. As much as I appreciate IHG, this hotel is a HUGE letdown. Please do not stay here. It will be an enormous letdown. Like me, you will regret it.

We are Elite members who have stayed in Waikiki before using points. Unfortunately, the property we used to stay at is no longer under IHG so this Holiday Inn location was available for our stay. Our stay was "worth" 35,000 points so I was definitely expecting to receive our points worth.Let me start off with the positives:1. Staff is OUTSTANDING! From the moment we pulled up confused about where "parking/valet or no valet" was a gentleman named Kenneth walked up to our car and assisted us! He helped us unload our bags, explained parking and the check-in process to us. He also let us know our bags would be delivered to our room after we checked in! 2. Check-in for Elite members has it's own line, it was super easy and quick! I witnessed the front desk staff dealing with some difficult customers in front of me, and again staff was extremely patient and professional.3. The hotel itself is very nice, great decor and relaxing! Good location to walk to stuff as well!4. Hello AC AND FANS in the room! I loved that and the beds were super comfortable. Negatives:1. THE ROOM...oh my god I thought we were in the wrong place. We are literally on top of the room next to us and a utility closet. When we walked in the room, I had to laugh. We had 3 suitcases and 3 carry-ons..not to include our personal bags. How we fit into the room is beyond me. It is so tiny the beds almost touch.. I could use the toilet and wash my feet in the tub at the same time.2. Parking was $33. We had just stayed at a Wyndham resort near the marina. Valet parking was $28. And they cannot assure you parking later in the evening if you move your vehicle. But if you find parking elsewhere they will refund the $33. Can I have that back to pay for my uber cost please. 3. Breakfast was just ok. Standard Holiday Inn food but I would have enjoyed seeing something from Hawaii on the menu. I did appreciate the Guava yogurt and Passion Orange juice.Staff and mild comfort would bring me back to this hotel. The place was spotless. We had originally booked 2 nights but went down to one instead. I'm grateful for that because we need rest and some room to back our staff before we head home. Unfortunately because the rooms are on top of each other and we were near the utility closet, the loud slamming of doors woke us up at 6am and now we are just exhausted. It is worth a nights stay if it's only just a couple or someone who just needs a quick spot to lay down at (in Waikiki you should be out and about anyways). Thank you to the staff at the Holiday Inn. You made this stay great!

I am here for business. Parking is limited and the lot across the street is full tonight also. The front desk found a place for me to park. They are really nice and helpful. My room is lovely and has a beautiful view of mountains and the ocean. This hotel is very close to the beach and nightlife but far enough away to be peaceful and quiet.

Stayed 7 nights in 38th floor partial ocean view room with 2 queen beds. Beds very comfortable. Housekeeping very good. Complimentary breakfast outstanding. Hotel staff at front desk and breakfast area very courteous and efficient. Only significant negative is on site parking capacity. On site deck fills by 7 pm some days. Next option is public parking a block away which $10 cheaper and well maintained and secured.

Stayed her one night on way to Guam. It is a coupl3 of blocks off the main shopping and restaurants of Waikiki...but with a breakfast. free WiFi, gym, putt putt folk, shuffle board, game room and a gym, it can't be beat. The breakfast buffet was decent with lots of choices and a pancake maker that is like a pasta machine. rooms were clean but bathroom a bit cramped. Had a room on 39 floor facing diamond head and ocean. Go to 5th floor and enjoy pool and hot tub.

Hotel was very nice and close to many locations including Waikiki Beach. While the rooms are small they are comfortable. However, they do have a $22 dollar resort fee that seems pointless. While the gym is much better then others the fee seems excessive. Pool is small and the extras they offer don't seem worth the added cost. Other then that the hotel is great and the staff is very helpful.

The room are not really large enough for 2 adults. The bathrooms are extremely small. If you sit on the toilet, your knees will be hitting the toilet paper holder. This also has you wedged between the wall and the bathtub. They charge $22 resort fee, with horrible amenities. The internet is slow at best, the pool is again very small, they offer a mini golf that is nothing more then a succession of putting greens. The highlight of their amenities is the chess game from the 1980’s. The parking garage, which is $34 per day, has 129 spots that are for 500+ rooms. If you stay here make sure you take the rental car insurance, the van I rented has 6 new dents from door dings. There is only about 4 inches between each car. This is not a good hotel. The only redeeming grace is the employees seem to care and understand, as they hear it daily. They are very used to the frustrations.

Great option if you’re ok not being on the beach. Easy walk to Waikiki Beach, beside luxury shopping area, very friendly staff, and excellent breakfast included. We were on a higher floor and the room had fantastic views of the beach, the Princess hotel, and of Diamond Head (we know we got a great room). We were also able to watch the Friday night fire work display from our room. The rooms and bathrooms have been updated but are quite small. We’re glad we booked two rooms for our family.

Smallest rooms you will ever see in your life it’s an absolute shame. Parking is terrible and don’t expect to find ANY parking late hours. Breakfast is mediocre to say the least and the size of the pool is barely enough to fit 10 people. If you have a fear of elevators I would not suggest staying here. When we boarded the elevator, we suddenly dropped 2 floors and were stuck for an hour. There was no assistance and had to call the police for help. Overall terrible stay!‍♂️

I missed my flight into HNL due to a delay in a connection flight. The hotel charged me for a no-show. I made several attempts to talk to a manager, but was gaffed off every time. Even when I called to talk to the reservation supervisor, she quickly dismissed my issue stating that if she waived everyone's no-show charge they wouldn't be in business. What a ridiculous policy! Every person I talked to was rude, apathetic, and had no consideration for the customer. Don't waste your money here. There are a lot better places to enjoy your stay in Hawaii.

I stayed here for a week on business. The place is newly remodeled, clean and nice. The staff is helpful and the people that help you find things to do are great (thanks for the friday night fireworks on the beach tip). The cons. 1. The rooms are super small. There is not even enough room for a chair! 2. The parking is a scam. They make you pre pay to park in their garage, but don't guarantee you get a space. Then when the garage is full you have to roam the streets for a street spot (hint .... there is very little street parking around the hotel) or go park in the next closest public garage about 8 blocks away. Then go back to the hotel and ask for a parking refund. This happened twice during my trip.#3 who on gods green earth closes the pool at 8PM?! Holiday Inn Waikiki does!

Needed a night to crash, the room and bathroom was small, I MEAN SUPER SMALL. I felt like I was in NYC. Way too small for a family of 4, would never stay again. We didn’t use any of the amenities other than breakfast which was great. All the added fees for less than 12 hours were over the top.

For what you pay this hotel is a good deal, especially if you have a meeting at the conference center.Rooms are smallish but perfectly fine and equipped with all one needs. Breakfast area can be packed. Breakfast is good but not exceptional. It does lack a bit in healthy choices.Wifi in the rooms is fast and dependable.

This hotel is okay if you don’t mind walking to the beach. Rooms are tiny, but nicely renovated. Has a nice gym on 5th floor with small pool and hot tub. We were on the 41 floor of hotel...with not many elevators it would take some time to get to the room. Continental breakfast was excellent in the mornings from 6:30-9:30. If your looking for more of a luxury vacation I would recommend getting a hotel that is beachfront but this hotel met our needs as well.

We enjoyed our stay at the Holiday Inn Express Waikiki. The room was clean and the bed was comfortable. We didn't rent a car during our stay. So, we were especially pleased with the great location. The hotel is just a few minutes walk to the beach and near lots of dining and shopping options. We were also able to easily take the bus to further destinations. The rooms are small, but we didn't spend much time there. So, that was fine with us. As others have noted, the air conditioner fan was loud, but we found that helpful in drowning out the outside noise. (Without it we could hear sirens even on the 31st floor!)

This was a nice hotel. The room was small (3211) but there was room for everything, the airconditioner worked just fine as well as the tv. Microwave, fridge and coffee maker are also in the room. Kudos to the cleaning ladies.Breakfast was interesting. You are given tickets at checkin because this is a large hotel. Mirasol always had a smile and was helpful. It was a breakfast a notch above other Holiday Inn Expresses. The pigeons outside would attack any unattended plates. Shout out to Gladys and Adele at check for their can do attitude. Short walk to the beach. I would stay there again. My only beef is a resort fee. They are not on the beach

Nice hotel, rooms are smaller, parking is a challenge depending on events in the area.I do not usually stay in Waikiki area, to busy for me. If you want to do the tourist destinations type trip, good location for that. Breakfast was typical, service was very friendly.

I preferred the holiday inn beach comber but it was sold to outrigger I guess. Now the holiday inn express is the only IHG hotel in Waikiki. It’s a bit of a walk to the beach, at least 3 major road crossings which is inconvenient when carrying all that you need for a day at the beach. Parking and resort fees are way too high for what you get and location The room and lobby are nice and breakfast is included

Hotel is in a good location, but our sink overflowed on the first morning. Rooms were small, but were nice. AC needed adjustments but was comfortable every day. Breakfast was good and variety of choices each day included with room. Thank you for having an Expedia travel rep on site.

Stayed in Room 3503 for 4 nights. Ocean view Air conditioner is a window type not central. Room small bathroom small. But New looking. . Walk to beach about 3.5 blocks. Kuhio Street can get food by walking to Royal Hawaiian food court. Or many other food places. Car rentals nearby dollar about a block away. Used hot tub. Has PeeWee golf shuffle board and outdoor chess board near out door pool on 5th floor. Need to take separate elevator if staying on 26-42 floors. . There is a video game room. Yoga class Breakfast was good they give you meal tickets. Pretty much the same at other holiday inn expresses. Has pancake makers. Staff helpful. Taxi ride to and from airport was $28-$34 from cititaxi. I recommend this. Cleanliness very good. Rooms small for family of 4

Was there first week of June 2018. This is a great place if $$ is a focus and/or you're not doing more than an overnight stay, otherwise, keep looking. The staff are wonderful, but that's about all Holiday Inn Express has to offer. The rooms are suited for overnight stays not for vacation stays. The A/C is a window unit that blows in your face all night, the pool is nothing more than a waist-high wading pool. There are no food/drinks of any kind allowed in the sunbathing/pool/hot tub area. The parking is a complete, expensive joke. If you're doing a rental, be prepared to fork out $30/day. If their lot is full, which it usually is by sundown, "may the odds be in your favor" that is IF you have a lot of cash. Did I mention crowded? It's very crowded. The pluses-5 min walk to beach/shopping/dining. If you're looking for a nice relaxing atmosphere, keep looking as this place isn't it.

Very clean and comfortable. Beds are nice and TV and AC are top notch. Rooms are so tiny. Literally two people can’t move about at the same time. Have to lean over toilet to throw trash out. Nice reception. Decent breakfast. Quite a walk for food.

Out here to attend training. This hotel was the first in our DTS selection so chose it. Front reception was friendly and helpful. Unfortunately the parking is $30 a night and this hotel only has about 100 slots for 600 guests. They will take the parking charge out of your bill for the day if you can’t find a slot. Bad part is you’ll have to find parking elsewhere, either at the paid public parking a street down which is about $25 a night, Ft. Derussy (sp?) or at the Hale Koa both are something like two blocks away. Room is very nice but SMALL!!! At $177 a night, thought we would get something wth at least a kitchenette. We have no choice now but to eat out everyday. Size is comparable to some folks walk in closet. Lol! They have a microwave, Keurig, and a small refrigerator. Tiny closet to hang clothes. Going to be hard to maintain our weight like this but they do have a gym on the 5th floor (haven’t checked it out yet). I’d recommend for short trips, not extended ones like ours will be. Good for singles or couples, not family with kids. Overall good except for the size of the rooms.Pics is of me standing at the front door taking a pic of the room and the closet w/microwave and refrigerator. Everything is clean and nice in this room, just small. If you don’t mind being cramped, I would recommend.

I so want to like this hotel for what it is, but it's just not up to par with Holiday Inn Express's new look and feel across the US. There are some good points about this hotel, but mostly it's a let down. Pros - Good location, only a few blocks to Fort De Russy Beach (one of the better beaches in Waikiki), decent/ample breakfast include in the price, friendly front desk staff, lots for kids to do on the 5th floor. Cons - small pool, long waits on the elevators, smallest "closet" ever, super tiny rooms, horrible air conditioning system, and clean the fish pond for goodness sake. I don't think we'll be back, even if the price is right... I had the Hilton Waikiki Village booked for about $650 more for four nights, but I thought I'd save a few dollars - I wish I'd spent the money or went for any of the Hilton or Marriott brands around Waikiki.

This place is not up to Holiday Inn standards. Third rate hotel near Waikiki, at best compared to a Motel 6 in an inner city. The rooms are small, the elevators suck, the parking is an embarrassment, and the fact the staff don't seem to care about the guests is apparent. Let's start with the list:1. The rooms are at best the size of the walk-in closet at my house. The bathroom is fit for a small child.2. The banking of elevators is awful. Want to wait in a line to get to your room, feel free to stay here.3. Parking may or may not be available. If it's not, go to a lot nearby. Great way to run a hotel.4. Asked the front desk about the issues with the AC unit. It says room temp is 77, is set to 68 but the AC won't turn on to lower temp much. If and when it does turn on, maybe it will lower temp to 75. Let the front desk know about this, but nothing was done. Contacted front desk again and they say they'll look into it. I don't someone to look into it late at night. It should have been corrected in the morning when the original request was made.This hotel should be removed at a hotel from the Holiday Inn chain. Don't stay here if you want comfort or to relax. This has been a nightmare and the staff doesn't care.

Our family stayed for 3 nights. Beautiful hotel, great breakfast, and breakfast area. Close to walking to downtown Waikiki and the beach. Activity are on 5th floor was great for kids, staff was outstanding, beds were comfy. Would definitely stay again!

Pros: location serving room. This small space could lead to a disaster should there be an emergency since guests cannot navigate around. Also, the pigeons in the outside eating area battle guests for food. These birds are also unsanitary. is good because you can walk right to Kuhio Beach, which is superior to Waikiki itself. Kuhio has better views of Diamond Head. The hotel also has a large breakfast selection; the room has a useful ceiling fan that cools the room well; the staff were helpful when I needed a mending kit (sewing kit) for a small repair. Cons: the breakfast area is inefficient. It is too small for the large number of guests so that too many are wedged into the

I stayed at this hotel for a week, and found it to be a very pleasant experience. The decor of the lobby, and reception area is nice, the staff is very friendly and helpful. Everything is clean and very well maintained. The breakfast area is great, and the breakfast food excellent. The bed was very comfortable, the room reasonably spacious, and the Wifi connection worked perfectly. The location of the hotel, just off Waikiki beach, is perfect. There is a shopping area nearby, and restaurants.

Although this hotel falls in "Holiday Inn Express category" I was impressed at the hotel's fine decor and friendly service.Saying this, I have never been disappointed by any Holiday Inn / IHG group hotels. It proves that some companies know how to protect their reputation in a competitive industry.Good location, close to the beach and shops, no worries hotel for a day or more.

Top floor room with 2 queen beds. Comfortable, clean, beautiful view. A little cramped for us and our two little grandaughters but adequate accommodation for the end of our trip to Hawaii. Didn't really spend a lot of time in the room. biggest problem was the aircon which was exceedingly noisy. On top floor windows only open a crack and it was far too noisy, So sleep wasn't easy being so hot/noisy. Normaly we book at the other Holiday Inn but there were no rooms available at the time we booked. The breakfast is included in your rate so you have no choice. It isn't something I would recommend.

Very neat and clean hotel. Close to all amenities. They are very welcoming. They let us check in earlier and gave us complimentary breakfast. In a words, they have very efficient staffs. There are many good restaurants around. My favorite was Bill and Red Lobster. Every tour was good but the exceptional one was Hoku Tour and the guide, Captain. He is a very knowledgeable person and good sense of humor. I would like to go back again. ❤️

This hotel is a mistake! Very very old air condition working worser than my old cutter! Staff very unpolite and not helping with anyting. Breakfast like a joke almost nothing to eat only unhealthy and tasteless things!

Overall, this location was a good experience. The staff were friendly and helpful, facilities were clean, amenities were nice, and location is excellent.There were two factors that could be a turn off for you. 1) The window a/c unit was really loud and even if you turn it off it the fan comes on frequently. This interferes with sleep and watching tv. 2) The elevators were really slow and really warm, probably because there is no central ac, this could be a problem if you're on the higher level floors.If those two aren't deal breakers, you should definitely stay here, it's a great value!

You can reach the Waikiki beach or Convention Center or Alo Moana Mall by walking. The hotel is very clean, the staff is amazing.The breakfast is very rich. The only thing I can say negative is the air condition works makes so much noise in the room. Mostly we switched it off when we are sleeping.

What a beautiful property and possibly the friendliest hotel staff I’ve had the pleasure of dealing with. It’s a perfect location and worth the couple extra bucks for the ocean view. Yes, the rooms are small but how much time do you really spend in there anyways? Everything is surging walking distance of this property. We’ll be back for sure!

From the moment i contact this hotel until the day our group of over 40 people departed it was nothing but greatness. Staff go above and beyond and have a genuine kindnesses towards guest. Rooms aren’t the biggest but make up for it with style and appearance everything in great shape ac worked too well haha...will definitely return to this location Regan and starr made this out best group trip ever we are very appreciative

Now, I dont usually complain, much. But this stay needed to be explained so others can avoid it. I am born and bred in the GC, so I could be seen as biased - but I dont think so. The staff here are nice enough and the lobby is clean, sharp and inviting. We paid $350AU PN for a king ocean view room. We walked into a shoe box. The bed was the size of the room. So much so, the wall mount aircon hung over the bed. The floor was wet. As in soaking. It was obviously just cleaned, badly, as it smelt like bleach or carpet shampoo of some sort. It costs $29 USD a day to park. At the hotel. Its $10 a day at the Sheraton ffs.... Moral to the story is, stay at the Sheraton. The extra money you spend will be worth every penny once you realize how crap this dated place is. At least you'll have a actually enjoyable stay. I would rate this a zero if it was an option.

Great location, short walk from everything we wanted. Pool and games area were always popular with families but we did get a game of mini golf in, this was a big selling point when we were picking accommodation. View was amazing from our room, towards Waikiki and the beach walk. Breakfast was busy but staff were quick to clean and restock so there wasn't a long wait.

We stayed here for 3 days before taking our island cruise.We got the shuttle at the airport and were lucky enough to only have 2 stops before our hotel. Driver also gave us a mini tour on our route.Loved the hotel lobby, very tropical with its open air area and plants. After leaving the snow belt this was very exciting. Check in was a little long process because of a large group that had just arrived before us but we were checked in and on our way to our room......2511....a suite....Now this is where it gets weird ...there is no 25th floor on the elevator so you have to go to the 26th floor and walk down one floor. Room was nice with comfortable bed, bar fridge and coffee service area. We had windows on 2 sides of the room so great views of the water and mountains. The ac was awful. They had 2 window units that were so noisy we had to turn one off to hear the tv. The bathroom was very small and the entrance was obstructed by one of the AC units. This was a disappointment. While we were there they gave us notice that they were going to carry out the quarterly pesticide spraying...we asked not to have it done due to sensitivities. But it does have to be done.The included breakfast in the morning was really good and a rarity in Honolulu. Lots of variety and with a large crowd it was very well organized. The hotel is close to good restaurants and the trolley tour stop....and you can't miss the ABC stores on each corner.They have a great pool and patio area on the roof which we enjoyed one afternoon. Nice sunbeds and lots of activities.

The property advertised the hotel as being brand new. It is not. It is a crappy remake just like the Rosanne reruns. Seriously. It’s a Holiday Inn Express that is try to be a big boy in the hotel chain world by charging outrageous resort fees and parking. Now for the rooms. Those of us old enough to know what a phone booth is, that is the size of these rooms. Phone Booth! And how excited was I when I walked in the room and had a lovely window AC unit poking me in the side every time I walked by it. Not to mention, oh why not, I have verbally trashed the place already. Waikiki seems to be in the middle of downtown. And based on what I saw driving in for the airport to this property, you should be armed and ready to defend yourself if needed. The bottom line here is that I’m stuck here for the next two weeks. So, I will make the best it. If you and your family are looking to come to Hawaii and Waikiki is in your plans. Plan not choosing the Holiday Inn Express Waikiki.

This was my first ever stay at a Holiday Inn Express so wasn’t sure what to expect. I was traveling with my family of 2 adults and two teenage kids.So let’s start at check in. We had to wait about 10 - 15 mins whilst a group checked in before us. I am a IHG platinum member and was surprised there was no dedicated check in available. We booked the 2 queen full ocean view room and was allocated it on the 32nd Floor. The top floor is 44. We got to the room and it was tiny, with just enough room to walk around. It also had this blue table thing over the bed..a bit like a hospital. The bath room was tiny with barely enough room to move. Beside from being small the room itself was new, modern and had good amenities. The coffee pod machine and microwave were a great touch. The biggest issue we had was the noise of the air conditioning unit. It was old and sounded like a jet plane engine during the night as it kicked in and out. We complained and they by passed the wifi console on the wall and that kept the noise constant. We tried opening the windows but the humidity made that hard to maintain without the sea breeze.On level 5 the pool and activity areas was great. My kids loved the putt putt and ping pong. The gym was also decent. The only annoying thing was that we had to catch the lift to level 3 or lobby to get to the 5th floor from our room due to the lift configuration.The included breakfast was great and it was unbelievable how efficient the staff were keeping all the food stocked and tables clean.Housekeeping was a bit of hit and miss.Overall I think it is a good hotel and if the there was one bed in a room would be great, as I think the rooms are all the same size. I know the hotel was only recently upgraded but they need to do something about the air conditioning.

It was my first stay in Honolulu and it was just perfect ! I arrived from Bora Bora with a super early flight for a 1 week stay. The lady at the Reception, I think her name was Melany, i'm not sure about that, find me a room who was ready for check in, many thanks for her so I can fall into the bed and wake up 10hrs after !Room was 2015, very clean, modern, bed is confortable, tv is huge and great this the fridge in the room is big enough to put lot of food insideComing from a little island, Waikiki is so nice to walk around ! the hotel have a convenient location, near malls, shops, beaches and restaurants !I really enjoyed being there and i can't wait to come back ! FOOR SURE

I arrived early in Honolulu Airport. I called the hotel if I can check in early, the response was very polite even though it was normal that I was not given a Guarranteed answer. I arrived in the hotel and then Jeremy tried his best to get me a room right away, not even 10 minutes and I was all set with a clean and fresh room ready. On my first day, staffs were calling me on my name like an old friend- it felt like a family especially I was there for 5 days. I believe it’s the people that work there that makes a huge difference. You can feel they love what they do and they enjoy working together therefore, it shows in their customer service.Location: you can walk to restaurants, shopping malls, stores and even Waikiki beach. You don’t have to take the bus or take uber. The beach is about less than 10 minutes walk. Food: you will enjoy the free breakfast from 6:30-9:30am I enjoyed it so much. The breakfast area is wide and big with TVs and Newspapers. You don’t have to worry about sharing a table with another guest. Front Desk: Jeremy, Angela, Gladys and Beatriz will make your stay wonderful. They are very friendly and accommodating. Please be nice to them. Tip: If you are nice to them, you will enjoy your stay. Room: I had a King Size Bed however, my problem was the table. There was a “breakfast in bed table” but there was no normal table for me to eat in the room so I had to eat on top of the dresser because that’s equivalent to the height of the chair otherwise I have to go down and eat in breakfast area. Eating using the table next to the bed is probably romantic but not practical since no one is going to eat in bed all day. I was always eating out but when I had to eat my to go food I realized the area of focus in the room. Room Temperature: the temperature controller is not friendly especially on your first day trying to figure out how it works since it has unique coding. Not difficult to figure out but it is not just the normal controller of temperature and you will be freezing when you realize you have to study how it really works. House Keeping: The employees in House Keeping have the best smiles. They feel so greatful and happy, however I feel like the hotel needs to hire more to make their job easier. I really wish the hotel management will hire more. I can see them struggling and still being patient and friendly. Amenities: The fitness center and laundry room are open 24 hours. Jacuzzi and pool area are open until 8:00pm. Free Breakfast from 6:30-9:30amOverall: I am giving 5 stars to the hotel, main reason are the following: Friendly And Accomodating Staffs Price LocationAmenities

This is how you do a hotel experience the right way. I approve of the all around experience for the Holiday Inn Express Waikiki. Fun fact: this hotel is the largest Holiday Inn Express in the United States.Pros:+ Spectacularly friendly and helpful service. My wife and I got into Honolulu early, and were accommodated for an early check in so we did not have to putter around and be miserable all day.+ Free breakfast buffet is the typical HIX food, with a few lovely additions. Specifically, having the soy milk was a nice treat all around.+ A nice location that is removed from the nuttiness of Waikiki Beach enough that you don't have to deal with all the rowdiness, but close enough that you can walk to the heart of it within 10 minutes.+ Excellent views from the higher floors.Cons:- For such a large property, there were just not enough elevators. During rush periods, you're stuck waiting.- I had the same comment about the business center. Two computers for a 40+ story hotel? I get that most people don't go on vacation in Hawaii to go on a computer, but come on!- The room temperature regulation was strange. Couldn't get the temperature 'just right.' It was either too hot or too cold, no matter what temperature setting we had it set for.All in all, this is a highly recommended property that you should stay at if visiting Honolulu.

The rooms certainly are tiny, but that wasn't enough to deter us from booking. The location is great, staff are fantastic and the price is right. Selected highlights- You can check your bags in advance of your stay free of charge- Included breakfast- Fun sun deck including mini-putt, hot tub, pool, deck chairs and giant chess set- 24 hour fitness centre- 24 hour laundry- large safe in the room- Concierge service- An ABC store nearly every second block in any direction- Quick check-in- Lots of restos within a five minute walk- Huge LG TV in the room- Fast, frequent elevator service- Hilton fireworks visible from some roomsRoom for improvement:- Doors could be better insulated to prevent noise from the hallway (seems to be a problem with all Holiday Inn Express locations; must be a design defect)- Air conditioning has but two settings: loud and freezing or off. Should have a low-fan setting- Street noise was considerable even from the higher floors- Once again, WOMEN NEED MORE HOOKS! An excellent choice in Waikiki if you get a sweet deal on the price.

I stayed at this hotel for five days on a birthday trip. This hotel has an amazing location it’s only a seven minute walk to the beach. The staff is amazing and extremely friendly everyone greet you when you walk in every single time. Whenever I called housekeeping they were at my room in less than five minutes. The rooms are super clean and efficient. This hotel has a pool and a bunch of activities for kids such as a mini golf course foosball and ping-pong. I will definitely be staying here again on my next Hawaii vacation aloha!!

My 8 year old son and I stayed here for a few nights. The rooms were very clean and fresh, beds comfortable - we had a queen each! My son loved the pool area and mini golf. The staff were amazingly friendly.Free breakfast was substantial - and not included in many places in Waikiki.The only thing was it was a bit of a distance to the beach - but still walk able, with some shopping on the way!

Had a great visit to Waikiki for the very first time. Decided to stay in the Holiday Inn Express due to its location (nearby work and the beach) and because it’s an IHG property in Waikiki.Good location for the hotel, I enjoyed the free breakfast each morning and left impressed with how many people they efficiently put through every morning. They have a lot of rooms and people lined up each morning for breakfast...but their efficiency resulted in a short wait. Friendly staff, happy I didn’t have to pay the resort fee due to my work booking of hotel. Didn’t seem worth it to me. Expensive daily parking but I guess that’s just Waikiki.Nice room upgrade received upon arrival. Rooms still small though and still have old window unit air conditioners which ran loud at night.I would recommend staying here again and plan to on my next visit. Overall good trip. Thank you!

We absolutely loved our stay at the Holiday Inn Express last month! Room was very nice on 42 floor no street noise and the air conditioner was loud but I sleep with a fan at home so it was great. Yes it blew over the bed but I just slept with my head at the foot so problem solved! Housekeeping was great!The place was very clean and the free breakfast was the best I have ever had and it was free! The staff was very accommodating at checkout , locking my luggage up since we had a late flight and arranged for a shuttle pickup. Very impressed! Mohela!

No locks on the bathroom doors, beds are uncomfortable, and the water tasted like pool water. Had to use bottled water to brush my teeth because the chlorine taste was too strong. Staying with another couple who has a kid and there's no lock on the bathroom, which makes things uncomfortable. Breakfast buffet was good, but the sausage gravy was lukewarm at best. You can probably find something with better value

First time in a Holiday Inn Express - pleasantly surprised. Staff were very friendly and helpful from the start to the finish. Had a high floor and granted early check-in probably owing to my IHG Member status which was much appreciated!Rooms have been recently renovated and are very clean and tidy. Great with a modern and large flat screen TV. Capsule machine for coffee and tea - if you like milk with either grab a milk carton from breakfast or from one of the convenience store over the roadIncluded breakfast was great with ample choices - kids loved making their pancakes every day.Large Jacuzzi was fantastic and the kids went swimming everyday in the pool - 5th floor also has the games room and a variety of outside games.Reasonable walking distance from everything in Waikiki - the kids and I walked to the zoo and Ala Moana Shopping center and they are 8 and 10 years oldWell worth considering and will stay again

We stayed here for 4 nights in mid February 2018. We didn't have a rental car this trip (save for the last day when we checked out) so paying for parking wasn't an issue. We had four in our room (2 adults, 2 kids) and two queen beds. The room was quite small but very compact and enough storage for us all. It was very clean. Maid service was excellent. Yes the air conditioner was loud but you could adjust it (not the sound obviously, but the temperature) and honestly, we definitely got used to the noise. And it's not like it came on ALL night long, it was intermittent so no, it wasn't an issue for us. The breakfast was fantastic!! I have to say, probably the best 'free breakfast' I've ever had at any hotel!!! The dining area is huge, with a huge covered patio outside and it's BUSY. If you are not in a rush, go down about 8:45/9am, this seemed to be a good time to get a table (once our party of 4 had to split up between 2 tables of 2 on our first morning). And no, they don't run out of food ;-) Get a cinnamon bun - trust me they are SO GOOD!!!The location was good, a bit far from the beach but still very walkable. We walked to International Marketplace, all over the shops of Waikiki, the beach etc. Otherwise we took Lyft/Uber to the aquarium (don't waste your time ,that place is tiny) Ala Moana and out to dinner a couple of nights. The pool and such are on floor 5 and while it's not a huge pool, it's a nice area. Plenty of deck chairs to get some sun. Shuffle board, mini golf, ping pong (watch the wind!) etc are also located here. We would definitely stay here again.

My kids loved the breakfast and mini golf the best. The place was clean although room was smaller and tighter than expected. But overall, it was a great hotel to stay. We also got a $50 credit towards activities. That was a nice bonus to save a little more. Staff were totally friendly and attentive to guests. Will definitely recommend this place to family and friends!

Stayed here for a night, stupidly didn't read the fine print and found out parking is $29 a night! Of course, there is no street parking. Never been to a hotel as a guest and was charged so much to park overnight. Oh well, now I know, lesson learned.

The rooms true to what everyone else write are in fact small. We receive upgrades and the rooms are still small. It is also one of the largest Holiday Inn Expresses we've every stayed at. The people are all extremely nice and helpful. We left a tip for the room service and she wrote back a thank you note. Everything is very clean and the location although not right on the beach is easily accessible to the beach and restaurants. The only thing I would warn about and that I did not care for is they have booths set up labeled concierge and they are not. They are in fact "Time Share" companies that present themselves as concierges. Unless you are interested in using your vacation time to view a time share presentation I would suggest you plan ahead and do not utilize them they can get very pushy.

First thing walking in the room there was crumbs all over the floor... we then opened the closet and there was 3 pieces of partially eaten pizza in it, with a pizza box on the side and two cups of soda. (Called the front desk and they offered to move us. And I told them I would call them back after my step daughter and husband shower.) As they were about to shower, they noticed that there wasn’t even a shower curtain. So we packed up and changed rooms. When I was about to shower in our next room, there was no bathroom toiletries at all. And lastly as we went in the jacuzzi today.. there was a ton green stuff floating in it. Super sketched out to even go in! Totally not worth what I paid.

Stayed one night at Holiday Inn express using 35000 ihg points (not a good use of points btw as it was being advertised at $149 a room when I was there.) The location is off centre from the main strip. It’s about a 10 minute walk from the Westin Moana Surfrider which is the centre of the Waikiki shopping strip. I appreciated the receptionist letting me check in at 11.30am since official checkin is normally that awful 3 or 4pm you get in the States. She may have looked on me favourably due to my IHG Gold Elite status.Room was small but adequate. Bathroom newly renovated. As mentioned by others the aircon is very loud (think jet engine) but didn’t stop us sleeping. Would be good if they replaced those with a quieter unit. Ok for a one night stay but would pony up for a better location if I were actually basing my holiday in Waikiki I did notice that there is a trolley bus (link circle type bus for $2) stop just nearby at Lewers St which is handy for ala Moana mall etc. Reccomend the popular Marukame Udon shop a 5 minute walk down Kuhio Ave for lunch. There's a queue outside but it moves quickly and the food is very fresh and reasonably priced. For a more special meal, Roy's restaurant (asian fusion cooking) is divine, but will cost you so look up the menu before you go and book as they get sold out if you leave it too late.Uber to the airport from the hotel at 630am flight was $35 and took 15 minutes - must have been surge pricing ) however the driver said it takes longer from 7am onwards.

What brought me to Holiday Inn Express was the fact that the Beachcomber is no longer an IHG hotel. I had an amount of IHG Platinum Elite points, but this year they could only be used at the Express. I was a little hesitant to do this, but really I had no choice.When I showed at the hotel in the evening, it turned out I had to park in the municipal lot, which is a up the road and across the street. Small inconvenience, and actually less money than valet at the Beachcomber.On check in, I got a good room that was city-side. It was small but OK. I figured out that the high table could be lowered to become a work table. All the amenities were there and in place. Pretty much IHG standard, and good.What changed my opinion and really made the trip special was interaction with the staff in the lobby. On check in, a gentleman was more than willing to cart my luggage upstairs while I parked. But the next day, when I mentioned to hotel personnel about how I missed the Beachcomber, I was offered a vacant room that was fortunately available, and offered a spectacular view of southern Waikiki! It may be because I am Platinum Elite on IHG, or maybe because of my frequent visits last year to Beachcomber, but the gesture by management really just made me feel like the whole operation cared about my four-day stay at the hotel. They really wanted to make it a positive experience for me.I can name the manager but I don't want to embarrass. She was really excellent.I recommend this hotel as IHG's only property that it manages on Oahu. Not sure why the Beachcomber went to another brand, but IHG's people are working really hard to make customers feel at home at the Holiday Inn Express. It is a couple hundred yards south of the buzz going on on Kalakaua Avenue, the main drag of Waikiki. But everything the hotel does, in my view, is to create a positive stay for you in the resort neighborhood of Honolulu."Express" is a budget-type offering of IHG. But the people (and the people ---the employees----really make a hotel) have taken the extra step to make a budget offering a really positive thing. There are a number of "extras" at the hotel, pools and what have you, but it was a business trip and I didn't get to check them out.When I am in Oahu, I would not hesitate to stay at the Holiday Inn Express again. The people who work there made it such a positive experience.

We spent 4 nights at this hotel and it was great! Good location, just a short walk to a beautiful beach. short walk to great shopping and dining. The lobby was lovely and our rooms was actually kinda spacious, which surprised me considering all the reviews. We had a great view and the beds were very comfy. We turned on the AC during the day and turned it off at night and it was no big deal. Best complimentary breakfast ever! Staff was super lovely as well. Highly recommend!

I put my mother, grandmother and two younger cousins up in this hotel for four nights. Their first night was fabulous! They enjoyed the amenities and comforts of their room. The second night, however, was a disaster. The toilet began bubbling up in the middle of the evening and then the shower began backing up with waste water. My mom called down to the front desk for help and no one answered. She kept calling housekeeping and again, no answer. She finally got ahold of someone in security and they sent someone that tried to plunge the toilet. He worker then told them to see the front desk for a new room at 1:30am. They were moved to another room that was SUPER SMALL and tight. My mom measured 18” of walking space between the beds and the walls. With enough complaining they were moved to yet another room the next day which was comparable in size to their first room. We received a $23/night adjustment to our hotel bill but they still lost out on a restful nights sleep. They were all very tired with our full day of activities the next day. In short, it’s a nice hotel with a chance you’ll run into old building problems.

I stayed for just 1 night and enjoyed the room and my view from the 21st floor, also the free breakfast was good, but it was mental to see about 100 people waiting in line for it to open at 6AM, but plenty of breakfast available.The room was big enough with a nice shower and bed and plenty of TV channels and good WIFI though out.My only complaint was the AC unit, it's a small cheap one, and not a central system like a lot of hotels. The A/C unit sat directly next to the bed and blasted ice cold air directly onto my when in bed, yes I want to use the AC, but I don't want it blowing straight onto me when in bed.

This hotel is very basic. Is a no thrills hotel. Rooms are tiny and views aren't worth it. Showers are small. AC doesn't work good at all. Thermostat wouldn't go below 72. Had to have them disconnect stat and give me remote. Was there for work and work trip got cut short. Hotel didn't want to refund money for leaving early. Had to make reservations several times as hotel kept having problems charging my room. Hotel never reached out to me either time I had to when I got email and saw reservation was cancelled. Called and spoke to manager and she said they had called but they hadn't. The one time they did call I answered immediately. Called again and asked for manager she wasn't in on Sundays left number and am still waiting for call back. I am a spire elite member with IHG hotels and was treated horribly and that is top level of the rewards program. I even went to there website and wrote a review.
