First one they blocked but second one they posted but will not put my membership status. Do not recommend this place. If you need a good hotel in Waikiki go stay at the Hyatt Regency. Beautiful hotel and awesome staff.

The hotel is 42 stories and upper rooms with ocean views offer scenic view of the pacific. Rooms are small. I had king with ocean view which has a nice walk in shower. Breakfast was good but repetitive, however by far better than most Holiday Inn ‘s. Very friendly staff. Only problem was the air conditioning unit control went bad and came on every few minutes. Call desk and house tech came in a few minutes and changed the control to manual with a remote which solved the problem and functioned nicely the whole stay.

I was looking for a nice, clean, comfortable hotel in Waikiki that is moderately priced, and Holiday Inn Express was a great choice. The hotel is recently remodeled/refurbished and you can tell because everything looks nice and new. The rooms are nicely decorated with clean, modern furnishings. The rooms are on the smaller side, but they are certainly big enough for one or two people. I decided to get an ocean view room and I definitely recommend getting an ocean view room if you can get one. The view was spectacular! I even saw humpback whales swimming off from the shores of Waikiki Beach from my room, and that was magical! The AC unit is a little bit noisy, but I only had to use the fan at night to keep cool and I happen to like some white noise when I sleep, so it wasn't a problem for me. The complimentary breakfast was a huge spread and very popular because it was very crowded each morning that I went. But there's plenty of food and seating and the staff is very nice. All the staff I met from the front desk, the cleaning staff, the breakfast staff, were all so nice. I was wondering around in the lobby one day looking confused about where my Uber was picking me up and a staff member helped me right away. If I stay in Waikiki again on my next visit to Hawaii, I would definitely stay here again.

This location has really changed my impression of Holiday Inn's. This hotel knows exactly how to accommodate guests. I was in dire need of rest and relaxation and I got exactly that at this hotel. Everything... I mean everything was perfect and the staff are exceptional. I arrived from Canada on an overnight flight to Honolulu and showed up early in the AM at the Holiday Inn after staying at a horrific hotel near the airport. Although I was early and my room wasn't ready, the hotel happily tagged my bags and hung on to them for me while I waited which gave me a chance to explore the area. When the room was ready, I was impressed at how clean it was and the view was unreal. But what really made this hotel shine was how everyone you came in contact with in the hotel was really happy to assist in any way they could to make sure you had everything you needed.The cleaning ladies gave me extra coffee (since I am a big coffee drinker) and was so friendly and polite. The staff at guest service who recommends trip packages were incredibly helpful in helping me pick out the right Hawaiian experience I would enjoy and I did. I ended up taking the Surf Bus and had the time of my life. It provided me a day full of activities and back in time to catch my bus back to the airport.The front desk reservation agents were just outstanding, super helpful and baggage handlers were funny and always put a smile on my face. They also hung on to my luggage even though I checked out so I wouldn't be carrying around my bags all day until I left for my flight. I never stayed at a hotel that did this before so it was such a pleasant surprise.What makes a hotel shine is really the people that work there. I cannot say enough about how much I enjoyed my stay. There was plenty to do in the hotel from foozeball, table tennis, a big chess board, a putting green, beautiful pool and hot tub with comfortable loungers and covered private loungers as well. The lobby was open and spacious. Offered a decent continental breakfast (although very little vegan options).The hotel is also located within a 10 minute walk to the beach, 5 minutes to shopping, and in a safe and clean neighbourhood. I mean some nights I didn't come back to the room till after midnight and felt completely safe walking around.Thanks from the bottom of my heart to everyone. I needed this vacation so badly, and because of your outstanding hospitality, you helped in making it stress-free and memorable.

This was our first visit to this hotel since it was taken over by Hoilday Inn. The refurbishment is really nice. The rooms are not huge but well designed. The air conditioner, is very noisy. Replacing them with quiet ones would be great improvement. The only thing that would have been nice would have been a balcony. There are none on the hotel. There are good views of either the water or the mountains. The pool and games area is nice, easy place to sit and read etc.. The location is great. A couple of blocks back from the beach, but easy walk to beach and to all the shops and restaurants, easy access to buses, which can take you all over the island and to and from the airport. The breakfast have a good variety, but is standard hotel fair. The staff are all very helpful and always cheerful and glad to help you. We would definitely stay here again.

Very nice clean hotel right next to all the action on Waikiki beach. Easy walking to beaches, food, etc. We very much enjoyed our stay. Only complaint would be the size of the room-ours was quite small.

The holiday inn express location is pretty good. It is close to the Hilton Hawaiian village which is where you really want to be for most of your activities. You have the likes of McDonalds and ihop close by for the kids here. The hotel does not have a bar to drink at so it’s more suited for budgeting families. The pool on level 5 is tiny and not really luxurious at all, there is little mini golf on this level too that looked like fun. The rooms are comfortable, although the air conditioning in the room is really loud and annoying, level 10 stunk of cigarettes which we hated. The hotel has a laundrette on level 3 which is great and you can PayPass your credit card to use the machine. A wash cost $4.00 a cycle. The buffet breakfast was good and had a lot of food to choose from, the breakfast gets really busy after 8:00am so get there early to beat the rush. The one little disappointing experience was when we were checking out early on the final day, and requested some fruit or light snacks before the kitchen opened up and they couldn’t accommodate, this was poor service and the only holiday inn express that we have stayed out to date around the globe that has not provided us with some take away food to go (considering breakfast was included in our package). Overall though the hotel is a good family option if you cannot afford to stay at the Hilton Hawaiian village.

The beds were comfortable but the rooms were very small definitely not the place for families. The breakfast was great if you don’t mind long lines and making some of your own food. The help around the hotel were welcoming but we often found our beds unmade. On the plus side if you ask for ocean views they definitely deliver.

Stupid me I accidentally booked the wrong nights and had to cancel last minute! He was very accommodating and understanding. Wish I had someone like him at my hotel. Will definitely be staying there in the near future.

We stayed 3 nights for a family wedding late Jan. and loved it!! Beds very soft and comfortable and the Breakfast was Awesome!! Truly filling, healthy choices and unlimited coffee and tea. (It felt like we were traveling overseas, many people from all over the world). Breakfast was busy although very organized and staff picked up dirty trays, cleaned tables and restocked items. Lovely to sit outside on patio or together with our wedding party at 1 of the long tables. We had best of both rooms with a ocean view/city corner on 23rd floor. Sure, rooms are small and bathroom tiny but tall family with teens still managed. Big frig, keurig coffee maker and lots of room to store luggage. The $20 resort fee per room was well worth it. The gym and yoga class was a good workout. We all filled up on Breakfast and had to skip lunch :) Excellent service, Expedia service desk clerk very helpful and staff always gave us extra bath towels and coffee. Tips: Walk across street to left side, ABC corner store, and take Pink Trolley, $2.50 to malls. Or walk across street, pass statue, gas station on right side, and cut left into huge open park, across street, to Hale Koa hotel for access to beach and Pool Barefoot bar. Holiday Inn Express is close to trendy stores, tourist shops and eating places. They also offered free beach chairs and umbrella to bring to beach 1 time. (Wedding party had stayed in the suites and they are twice the size of our room. Kinda odd layout with right/left elevators going to different rooms, see reviews.) Would stay again and we got a good deal with flights included on Funjet.com.

I would certainly recommend to avoid selecting this hotel if you have a rental car and not planning on using it a lot. Just $50 per day in local resort fee and parking before entering your room, which by the way make you think that you are in New York and certainly no hope to get a view...in a nutshell look for other options if you can.

This hotel have great location, close to shops and restaurants and that’s the only good thing. Be prepared to pay daily resort amenity fee, and parking is $30 a day. Breakfast buffet was ok, but no waffle maker.

I had a conference to attend and decided to spend a few days beforehand on a 'staycation'. First of all, I detest resort fees and try hard not to give my business to hotels that charge them, especially when parking isn't thrown in with the fee. Having said that, my only complaint is the room was slightly smaller than I expected, with a noisy A/C unit, and a corner configuration for the rooms which meant that 4 rooms, and the doors and occupants in them, are only a few feet away. Could hear lots of slamming doors and loud talking at certain times when people were getting ready for the day.On the plus side, excellent breakfast and the area where you eat has indoor and outdoor tables. So nice to eat January breakfast outdoors under a palm tree! Bed was comfortable, fitness center clean and well maintained, pool area neat and tidy with lots of lounges, and jacuzzi was a nice touch since the pool was a bit chilly. A short walk to the beach and main shopping areas and restaurants.

Welcoming and friendly staff. Small rooms and “compact” bathrooms but we didn’t come to Hawaii to sit in a hotel room so this was not a big issue for us. Everything is new and clean from recent renovations. Air conditioning is a bit noisy and very close to the beds from the rooms being small. People line up early for breakfast. It’s bit of a challenge getting so many people through the typical HIE breakfast. The staff help direct the crowd and it moves along fairly quickly. Don’t miss the outdoor seating. We could see a few inches of ocean from our room. There are no rooms with balconies. Lots of excellent eateries in walking distance. Easy walks to beeches and shopping.

We found the staff to be excellent. Jeremy and Lana and also the tall guy who speaks Korean were really great. The housekeeping staff are honest and keep the rooms clean. My husband left an expensive set of headphones in the room when we checked out and the maid turned them in so we were able to get them back.If you are looking for a hotel with a room with a balcony this is not the hotel for you. None of the rooms have a balcony. The rooms are on the small size and be aware that if you pay extra for a partial sea view check the position of the bed, otherwise the only way you can see the sea is from the one chair or to stand by the window. Some of the partial sea views from the bed are blocked by the air conditioner unit. The bathroom fan is noisy, but can be turned off so that was not a problem. The air conditioner is very effective, too much so when your bed is next to it. There was some door slamming during our stay but not late at night which was great.Breakfast is plentiful and there is seating on the patio if you want to sit outside They change out the selection of hot food about every three days. If you are travelling with teenage boys this is the breakfast for them as there is plenty of choice. Avoid the juice as it is not the best tasting. If you want a coffee to go you have to get a to go cup from the the desk where they check your breakfast tickets.There is a very small adult depth pool basically to cool off certainly not for laps, and a small child's pool plus a small miniature golf and shuffleboard. Parking cost $29 a day and there is a sensor that knows that you are entering and leaving so you don't need to use your room key. It also often says full but this is only for non hotel guests. It is about a seven minute walk to the beach and you are allowed to have a beach chair and umbrella one time during your stay free of charge. This was really nice even if it was a pain to lug them to the beach. There are restaurants within walking distance and also shops to buy supplies. The room has a micro wave and refrigerator plus an in room safe which is nice.Be aware that next to the concierge there is another marked Maps and Information. This is a Wyndham time share set up. Despite the allure of a free stay at a Wyndham property if you visit their time share in Waikiki you will have difficulty redeeming the thank you reward.All in all this was good value for the money but maybe next time I will stay somewhere else and pay a little more money to have a balcony.

We stayed at this hotel in Waikiki for several nights and we were more than pleased with the room and the employees. The room was a corner room with an exceptional view of Waikiki Beach. Lots of space although the bathroom was a little smaller than expected cleaning staff were outstanding and the front desk employees were most helpful in many ways. Free breakfast every morning was more than adequate with pleasant garden tables to enjoy eating outdoors.It was a mere few blocks to the beach or shopping or restaurants. Very satisfied with this hotel!

We stayed at this hotel but was not pleased with the room size. Booked in as a suite but in no way was it a suite. A cabinet in the corner with a frig, microwave and a coffee maker is not a suite. One chair in the room which had to be pushed into the corner if you wanted to get past the bed. The air conditioner was noisy and blew directly on the bed where the pillows were. Room was so small that the bathroom had a sliding door since there was not room for a regular door. Could not stand directly facing the bathroom sink as there was not enough room.Towards the end of our stay went to front desk to extend our stay one more day.We were told the hotel was booked up no rooms available. No offering to check their other hotel for space just there is no rooms available. No real effort to accommodate their desks.Were talking to a large group who just arrived with their booking and confirmations and they were told there were no rooms for them. They did get one night but never heard what happened to the rest of their stay.Generally the staff was very accommodating. The information and trip booking staff were very good and super helpful.Hotel very noisy and morning breakfast was a total zoo. In future I would not choose this hotel again. No food service other than continental breakfast and no bar.Not a top choice for me.

We booked this hotel for our travelling partners whom had requested for breakfast and gym.Well, personally I find the room small and squeeze.We check-in on 22nd Jan. & checkout 0n 30th Jan.Bed was terrible, cos we had backaches. Time to change their mattress.Air-con bad location and noisy!Toilet ventilation – noisy!Breakfast – same thing every day!They only serve breakfast - 6.30am to 9.30amThe good things are –1. Reception service – Great! Thanks to Melonie!2. Information Desk – Very helpful! 3. Room view – Nice!4. Great location – to beach, shops &eateries 5. Convenient – taking public buses & hop-onOverall, the stay was satisfying!

I stayed at the Holiday Inn for 3 nights as I was at a Conference at the nearby Hilton Hotel. The hotel is cost effective and the staff are very friendly and keen to assist whenever they can. However, the rooms are rather small and the corridors are noisy....every door opening and closing echoes all the way down the corridors. Therefore, not much sleep was had as tourists were arriving and departing at all hours.The breakfast is typical American......plenty of bread, muffins and dairy products.I would have liked to rate hotel higher but lack of sleep for 3 days, offset the friendliness and helpfulness of staff.

We stayed here for 8 nights and would gladly have stayed for longer. All staff were very helpful and friendly. Rooms were very clean and cleaned everyday. Breakfast was great a good way to start the date. In walking distance of everything. Shops, restaurants, beaches, buses and there’s plants to see and do.

Staying here after leaving another accomodation that was run down and old and dodgy. Pleasantly surprised with accomodation on the 43th floor. Great property and facilities for same price other dodgy hotels want. Small rooms but great for a short stay.

Booked vacation thru Westjet Vacations. Nice room, comfortable king bed with comfy pillows. Great full buffet breakfast. Eggs, sausage, cereal, yogurt, fruit...... Lots of food to choose from. Nice pool & hot tub with lots of loungers & chairs & tables. Pool & hot tub only open til 8. Guess this is because rooms overlook them. A bit of a walk to the beach, 15 minutes thru Fort DuRussy Park which is down from Wakiki beach. We ended up buying day pass for bus & took to Wakiki Beach a couple of days as better facilities & restaurant choices at that beach. Staff at hotel very friendly.

What a surprise this hotel was. It was super clean. The front lobby was just lovely for a mid range hotel. The room was a decent size but would not call it roomy. Bathroom was very clean and amenities were just what we needed for the last few night of our trip. The biggest flaw of this hotel were the air conditioners. They are extremely noisy and you cannot leave them on if you want to sleep. We were just lucky not to stay longer than two nights. They are fitted at the head of the second bed and sound like something from the 1970's. In saying that I have to say the pillows and beds were amazingly comfortable, in fact more comfortable than Hilton Village! Our price included a continental breakfast but to our surprise it included everything a full buffet at any other hotel. For the kids there was ample here to keep them occupied: games room, roof top table tennis, giant chess and mini golf WOW! The pool set up made us feel like were at a New York Hotel, very cool. The only thing missing was a cocktail bar. The beach was a short walk approximately 10 minutes. Great hotel to stay a few days but I wouldn't recommend any more than a few nights and thats only because you won't sleep with those noisy air conditioners! Maybe in the cooler days it would be ok :) I'm giving the hotel very good and not excellent only because of the air con. The rest of the hotel is excellent.

ProsNice open air lobbyLarge breakfast area with good selection of breakfast items (although not many healthy)Spacious nicely done pool deckClean modern roomsGood quieter location just out of central Waikiki but still only 5-10 mins walk awayHelpful concierge staffConsTiny rooms with very low ceiling, can feel quite claustrophobicExtremely loud air con unitsVery slow elevator

Staff were unfriendly and one particular lady was very rude. Priority was given to marathon runners who were there for Hawaii marathon. I requested earlier check in as we arrived in the morning after a long flight. I was refused but several marathon participants were checked in early. Room was very extremely small with two queen beds. Air Conditioner was fitted in the windows at the bed level which blew air straight on the bed and was very noisy. Won't be staying there again. Breakfast was awful, was a waste of money. One star is only for location, Kalakaua Rd was walking distance. $20 per night charge was waved at the end due to my complaint. Beware of this Additional resort charge!!

We arrive at the hotel 3:30 am by our biological clock. Now I am not that old but it’s still not the time of day I am used to seeing. We were checked in efficiently and the desk personnel were professional, friendly and courteous. The next stage of our travel, however, was not so pleasant. Did I mention it was very late, that we were very tired? Holy doodle my friends the room was no more than a shoebox stuffed with a kingsize bed and a very loud and obviously in need of service air conditioner positioned not 14” from the edge of the bed. We literally had a one foot perimeter around the bed wiith a clothes closet sized for a nudist colony. The bathroom was just big enough to fit one person, you could almost sit and spit.  I spoke with the night desk staff and was told all king rooms were that size. Unfortunately the room sizes we looked at were for the double queen bed rooms; the was not differentiated on the Expedia website.The next morning I explained the situation to the desk manager and we were quickly placed in an available double queen and life was looking better. The breakfast bar is outstanding, the coffee is amazing.Beware the false concierge: The concierge desk (with a big sign) has been commandeered by the owners. Apparently the owners have interest in Wyndham time shares. It’s the old bait and switch... the “ concierge” works for Expedia and offers you some deals, then he says there are even better ones to be had by talking to the person at the next desk. Behind whom is a sign mostly hidden saying timeshare!!! You likely have experienced the rest. Sebastian is the true concierge at the hotel and is most excellent. Find him opening the door of your cab or just greeting you as you walk in after a day out. He is informative and friendly. He also knows football, UK style, not American!

Hotel located walking distance to Waikiki beach and International Market Place. The rooms are small; there’s a roof top pool; gym; on the 5th floor. Your stay includes breakfast. It’s ok if you’re not a heavy breakfast eater. I’ve been to a lot of Holiday inn hotels and I can say this is the most organized I’ve seen. I came down for breakfast around 6:45 and it started to get crowded.

We had two rooms and stayed for 7 nights. Overall 3/5. A nice stay with no major issues. The rooms are relatively small. The air conditioning is built into the window and when turned on it blows and blows. That’s good for cooling down but bad if you expected a quiet room. It’s sounds like you’re back on an airplane. This means that you have to turn the air con off at night and open the windows if you want to stay cool. The staff were very nice. The breakfast area was very good. The gym was functional and had treadmills, exercise bikes, some weights and a rowing machine. The outdoor games and pool area was “pretty” but relatively impractical. The pool is very small (probably a 5metre x 5 metre square). The lifts are relatively slow. Downstairs area in the lobby had some very nice seating areas. They also had a small convenience store inside but we never used that because there are convenience stores (ABC stores) on every corner. The hotel is very well placed and short walk away from most shopping areas, restaurants and the beach. The have an Expedia local expert in the lobby that can arrange tour bookings for you.

First off, let me start by saying the hotel staff are very helpful and cheerful. Location is central without paying beachfront rates. The rooms are modern and clean but much too small, luckily it is still functional, whoever designed the layout of the room definitely maximised the space they had to work with. The bed and pillows are very comfortable BUT you will not get a single night's decent sleep as the air conditioning unit is louder than a jet plane engine. Family member's room had the same problem. Keep your airline ear buds and use it. Breakfast buffet is crowded but efficient.Minus 1 for the size of the room and minus 2 for the temperamental and excessively loud air conditioner.

The rooms are a little small but we did not spend much time in the room anyway. The staff was friendly and helpful. We had an ocean view that was great. Really good hot breakfast every day with lots of food. Air conditioner kept the room cool. We did not use the pool but the pool area was nice. I would stay here again.

When choosing somewhere to stay for 2 nights in Hawaii right before New Years Eve I was a bit limited budget wise and flat out refused to pay the $700+ per night that all the main hotels were charging around the Christmas period. As we weren't going to be staying long I decided on the Holiday Inn Express for a very reasonable price and I'm so glad I did. This hotel far exceeded my expectations for a 'budget' hotel.The view from our ocean view room on the 42nd floor was insane! Completely unobstructed ocean views for around $250 per night I couldn't believe it. Yes the rooms and bathroom are on the smaller side. Yes the air conditioning units are quite loud and if you are a light sleeper you will probably have trouble sleeping but for us this hotel was great for a short period of time.Included in the room rate was a buffet breakfast which was very nice. Be prepared to wait in line as it goes get quite busy. The hotel has been removed and is very nice. There is a resort fee added to your stay however I believe most Waikiki hotels also change this fee. If you're trying to stick to a budget but still want the Waikiki beach views not too far from the action this is your place.

The HI Express property used to be the Maile Court and has undergone major renovations! A vaste improvement with the rooms though small but has comfortable beds and pillows, and large TV screen with cable TV. On level 5 there is a well equipped gym, outdoor pool with other activities for the family. Breakfast is from 6.30am-9.30am. Which means you have to rise early. Buffet room door closes right on 9.30am. So dont expect to rock up at 9.32 expecting a bite. With that said breakfast is good enough.We opted for a room with mountain view and partial sea view. Quite nice. We prefer a room above level 30 for the view.Waikiki beach is walking distance. Good 15-20 minute walk. The Waikiki Trolley pink line to Ala Moana has a pick up point across the road at Gateway/ La Crox Hotel.I would strongly recommend the hotel. Most syaff were friendly, the one yhat stood out was Shawn at the reception was extremely helpful and friendly. There is an ATM and laundry room. Note you can only access pool area, g and laundry with key card. Security is quite good.
user_name:
Evan Qelo N
Viti Levu, Fiji

review_body: The hotel room is a bit small, but they are clean and comfortable. The staff are friendly and helpful. The breakfast is good and well supplied. My only complaint would be that part way through our trip our parking pass stopped working and we had call the front desk to get in and out of the garage. The hotel is walking distance to the beach and most shopping places.

We had a weekend overnighter here. The former Maile Skycourt has been given an extraordinary makeover. The rooms are small, but they've been refitted to maximize the space and redressed for modernity. Rooms were reasonably silent for a hotel is in this range. Our real delight, over grown kids that we are, was on the pool deck. Not only do they have a pool, but a jacuzzi, mini-golf course, shuffle board and a giant chess set. There is also a video gaming room for the kids (LOL!). The free breakfast was plentiful and easily accessed with plenty of seating. My wife and I had a delightful, and playful, time. Yes, there is a resort fee and a parking fee. Potential guests need to understand that these are standard practice in resort areas. Staff was cheery at all locations, especially the fella who was cleaning up the pool deck when we arrived after breakfast. Wish we had grabbed his name!

The hotel refit has actually been quite well done. Rooms are very small but functional. Bathrooms are also compact but well designed. My gripe is with the policy of the hotel to levy a service charge of $22 per room per night. And what does that charge get you? The right to use the swimming pool. Seriously are you friggin kidding me. That's like booking a hire car and then charging you extra for tires. This is a hotel in a major beach location. And they seriously want to charge you and me to use the bloody pool. What's next charging us for sheets, pillow or a TV. I questioned this charge at checkin and asked that it be removed as we had no intention of using the pool. I was told it is a compulsory charge. Well if that's the case it should be included in the room rate. They obviously do this so that the hotel appears higher in search results ranked by price. But it is blatantly an unfair business practice and false advertising. Most other hotels in Waikiki are NOT using these tactics. Vote with your feet. By booking this hotel you are ensuring such practices become standard with the industry.

Would not recommend this HI location. Rooms are extremely small. Booked a room with a king size bed but there is not enough space to open up 2 suitcases so upgraded to king bed / suite after one night. All hallway and door closing noise comes right into the rooms. First person to shut their room door wakes up every room in the morning and the last person to come into their room at night keeps every room up at night. On the positive side, the lobby and breakfast area were well done and perfectly cleaned every day. The breakfast area has a very pleasant outside section surrounded by trees and shrubs. The staff were extremely helpful and did everything they could to make our stay enjoyable.

I spent three nights here on my first ever visit to Hawaii. It look a long time to find the hotel as signage is not the best and the area is heavily dense. Traffic is also very bad most times of the day so you will drive out of your way if you miss your turn. I called the hotel (which by the way is illegal to do in Hawaii while driving, but I didn’t know that at the time), and the directions were not very helpful. I eventually found it on my own.Upon arrival, I find the garage is small and tight. Most people probably take a shuttle or some other sort of transportation from the airport, and as I said the area is very built up. When I get to the main lobby, I find out that my advance purchase on my credit card did not cover everything! Parking was around $30 a day, and I understand not charging that up front since many people do not use it (and this follows other properties), however the $20 resort fee I had no idea even existed until I saw my bill! I would have figured that would have been in the online rate, as it is mandatory. I get my key and take my bag to the 30th floor. Speaking of which, there are two sets of elevators: one set is for the lower rooms, the other is for the higher rooms, but both access the lobby, parking garage, and laundry. However, the 5th floor which has the resort activities can only be accessed from one set of evevators. This means if I wanted to use the area (more on that later), I have to go down to the third floor, then back up to the fifth. Very odd.The room is extremely cramped, as in smaller than a hospital room. This is far much smaller than any Holiday Inn Express I have stayed at. The air conditioning is also loud and runs constantly, the latter may be because of the high floor. It was in the 80s during the day and 70s at night. The bathroom is very small as well, which isn’t too big of a deal for me, but can be if you have more than one person staying there.I had a partial ocean view, which was very nice to see. It would have been nice to have a balcony. TV selection is a little weak, but I didn’t watch much. The bed and sleep quality are fine.Breakfast is down in an area off of the lobby and is very crowded due to the high number of guests. Seating is both inside and outside on the patio, I chose the latter. You do need a coupon to enter the breakfast area, as the hotel is wide open and anyone could walk in and get a free meal otherwise. Honolulu apparently has a decent sized homeless problem, so I can see why they did this.I only went to the activity area on the fifth floor on the last day before driving to the airport. There is an outdoor pool and spa, a few holes of mini golf (with not the best equipment), foosball, and a giant sized chess game. There is a room with video games and exercise equipment. The hotel also has a staff where they can arrange trips and such for you, so I am guess this is where some of the $20 a day goes towards.I understand the pricing since it is a resort and it is Honolulu, but I would hope more would be offered, especially a larger room. If you are claustrophobic, this is not the place for you. I plan on flying to Hawaii again in the next five years, however I am not sure if I would stay here again, or even on Oahu. From what little I saw of the Big Island on a day trip, I may stay there.I do recommend renting a car at the airport, so you can explore more of Oahu. If you have time, try to see at least one other island. This requires flying which isn’t cheap.

Good location. Breakfast was very good. Rooms were extremely extremely small. Not enough room for a weeks stay . But clean and fresh with really great staff. Pool area is small but fun with the mini golf and other games.

Somehow my reservation booked as a pre-paid which I didn't realise at first. I admit that this may be my fault, however, I contacted the company to explain the issue four months in advance of the reservation and they refused to offer any kind of refund, only an alternate date or the option to give my reservation to someone else. I will never again go to a Holiday Inn Express as they have demonstrated their inability to use a little bit of common sense and look out for potential customers. Be wary booking with their website, especially if you are comparing prices - the poor design makes it very easy to book at the wrong price point / rate.

Rooms are extremely small and tight. They are not in compliance with American Disability Act. The bathroom has a barndoor that doesn't fully open and I am small. Everything is claustrophobic. There were hairs on the beds and the width of the bathroom door is less than 18 inches wide. Not good for business as they have a hospital type table that slides under the bed.

We stayed here for 11 nights. Was our first time in Hawaii. The Holiday Inn Express is a recently renovated hotel. Rooms were very clean and tidy. Bathrooms were a bit small, not the best shower pressure. Comfortable California King Bed. Air conditioning unit is one of those ones built into window, very loud can not use while sleeping so room does get warm. Having the breakfast option was fantastic typical american food, the automatic pancake machine was awesome, very cool. Cinnamon Buns were also a fave. Wide range of yummy yoghurts definitely try the mango. Took some extra up to the room for later when you get hungry. Swimming pool felt like they added Ice to it was very refreshing also nice big jacuzzi if you get abit cold. Overall was impressed with the stay and also wasn’t to expensive!

As a Spire Elite, I was able to use points and a free night to stay at this amazing hotel for 5 nights. I paid an extra $10 per night for an ocean view room and was given one on the top floor (44th)!!! What a view! Thank you Virginia! :)Yes the room is small, but perfect for one person, with all amenities and renovated, big HD TV, safe, and quite good hawaiian coffee and tea. The air conditioner is loud, but figured a way to keep it quieter, cool to max during the day and keep a bit warmer at night. Not so bad in the end.The free breakfast room is modern and has the best variety I've ever experienced in Holiday Inn Expresses.Parking is for a fee, but well worth it to have a car. In my 5 and a half days of stay I explored so much on this beautiful island, that I am so happy I chose to spend Thanksgiving weekend there. Perfect for solo travelers, even made an other lady solo traveler who joined me on my adventures for two days. Oahu is amazing and so very beautiful. Aloha and Mahalo!!!

The staff was very friendly and professional. Great location for walking to the Waikiki Beach shopping and beach. The room was clean but very small. Valet parking is $40 per day. Plenty of fine dining, casual dining and fast food restaurants in the immediate area. Continual buses are available for the entire island travel.

Stayed here for 2 nights with my husband and I couldn’t be happier. Check-in was quick and very efficient and she gave us a room in the higher floor per request. Spire Ambassador status was acknowledged and services and expectations were explained very well. It’s lovely to be able to just cross the road and walk a few minutes to Waikiki Beach. There’s tons of food options around and spending the night shopping or just walking around after a whole day at the beach was a perfect night cap for us. Noise didn’t become an issue this time because we were on the highway floor. I stayed here 4 years ago and had to change rooms because the noise on the streets can be heard up on the lower levels. The room is a good size with a small fridge and coffee maker. The toilet bath has an old fashioned door but it didn’t bother us much. All in all, it’s a pretty good place to stay in you want to be closer to everything in Waikiki.

Check in with Melonie was quick, efficient and very professional. She was very pleasant and thorough. We were given our room right away with a good view of Diamond Head and partial ocean views. The staff we met were all very helpful and courteous, including the local travel representative. Unfortunately, we had to cut our 4 night stay into 2. The room, though small has everything we need and the bed was comfortable for our taste. However, the air conditioner made it impossible for us to get a good night’s rest. It is one of those very old models and since the room is small, it made its presence VERY, VERY LOUD. I’m a light sleeper so we turned it off the first night and cracked the window open to let natural air come in. It was a cool night by Hawaii standard but very uncomfortable for us. I brought it to the attention of the front desk the following morning and they sent someone to “fix” it along with the broken safe. The safe was fixed but the air conditioning system remained unchanged. We again had to turn it off just so we could sleep on the 2nd night. To make the matters worst, there must have been some sort of an incident because all we can hear are police sirens throughout the night. We had to shut the window again and be miserable with no air conditioner on. I think we managed to dose off around 2 AM from pure exhaustion. We missed our early morning tour the following day because we couldn’t get up on time. We brought all of this concerns to JT, the manager on duty. He was very understanding and very generous with how he resolved our issue. We left and went to another hotel, exhausted from lack of sleep but still felt that we were treated fairly and kindly. If you are a light sleeper, this hotel won’t work for you. If noise is not a problem and you are used to sleeping with a white noise background, this hotel is a good place to stay. The free continental breakfast is simple but ample. Despite the huge traffic they get in the mornings, there always seem to be tables available and the food promptly replenished when empty.

Check in was easy, staff was nice and recognized as a Spire elite, lobby was open, parking was just behind the lobby. The rooms were incredibly small, 2 beds are are doubles but it sure felt like a twin but at least it was comfortable. I came into my room and the air conditioning wasn't working, plus it had this horrible smell - either too much air freshener or maybe the room was too old. Repairman did come quickly to fix it - the smell stayed though. ALSO, the door was ridiculous...I couldn't open it. Front desk said it gets stuck, finally figured I had to turn the knob upwards then push the door up before I tried to open. Seriously annoying! Walls are paper thin and the AC is such an eye sore. Nice thing is the pool is decent and it has a game room for the kids, wish the hours were open longer. Breakfast is the same in every HIE, but it was a large area. Location is good too but I wouldn't come back. Probably one of the poorest Holiday Inn Express I've been to.

The pros: we felt very safe and were within walking distance to the beach, waikiki trolley hub and stops, and malls and restaurants. The rooms are modern and clean. Customer service was outstanding.The middle of the road: breakfast is conventional HIE fare (my favorite!!!) and there is ample seating but the food is available in a room with limited access. There are 3 service lines but they dont work in a linear fashion and are difficult to get through and cramped. Food tasted great each day and was free.Wifi was mostly good. A few periods of very slow service but generally reliable.Noise from outside was medium. We could hear peoples doors slam but then nothing after they went into their rooms.The cons. The rooms were so much tinier than we expected. We had a hard time finding places to store a total of 5 bags and be able to access them. There is no real work station just a small table that doesnt fit above the bed due to the metal skirt. I had to use it standing in a corner and we could barely squeeze past it when it was not in use.The 2 big issues were 1. Air conditioner. Ridiculously loud with strong cold air flow. Wall unit did not consistently change the setting and we were never really able to get temp or air flow we were after.2. Bathroom door is frosted glass. If someone uses the restroom in the middle of the night they might as well turn on all the lights in the room. This was a huge problem for my stay.We did not use the recreation amenities.Overall if i came again i would likely at least look somewhere else but this hotel was clean safe and featured free breakfast and free wifi so i would not rule it out either.

Overview-small rooms, small bathroom, little storage areas, noisy room aair conditioners, recently renovated, no balconies, on site parking garage at $28 a day, 43 stories, good ocean views on the south facing rooms, safe at ground level, quick elevators with some dedicated to upper and lower floors, large breakfast room with plenty of staff, friendly staff, nice firm beds, clean rooms, 42-inch LCD TV, fridge, microwave, coffee, bus stops nearby (either 2.50 or 1.00 for over 65, a few usb ports in clock radio, yoga classes, pool, hot tub, good work out room.

Nice inexpensive hotel! Beautiful pool and spa (cold Jacuzzi?) Large gym, great huge free breakfast area. It always is super packed at breakfast, but u can still get whatever you need with a little patience. And there is a beautiful outdoor eating area that's so cute. The deposit is $100.00 and the resort fee is $22 per day. So for a 5 day stay they authorize $210.00! Not at all bad! The workers are super nice as well. The only down side is the many people in the elevators, and the workers using the elevators... plus there are 6 of them but they take forever with all the stops. Overall it's a super good deal. It's a 7 to 8 minute walk to to the beach. It's also the fort derussey park with volleyball courts, and tennis courts, outdoor beach rentals of everything (boogie board, surf, lay out in water mats, big wheeled bikes ect.) And an outdoor bar/snacks restaurant with pina colada and Mai Tais...Also 1 block away from a long stretch of expensive store row which has tiffany, Louis Vitton, coach, feragamo, Chanel, Cartier, and every other super high class store you can imagine! The washer and dryer room for laundry is $4 each! Whoaaaaa

Room is like typical Japan hotel rooms.. compact and low ceiling.. front desk staff are very courteous, walking distance to a park, beach shore, near ABC stores for souvenirs and snacks, no free shuttle to airport and will take about 30 mins or more by Speedy Shuttle depends on passenger pick-up in several hotels... free buffet breakfast is repeating menu everyday!.. no bottled water & front desk said tap water is potable though didn't took the chance... seems bedsheets are not replaced daily, only pillow cases..

Yes, the room was small compared to most brand name Hotels and Yes Air Conditioner made the noise or was too cold at times since its at bed level like many have mentioned already, however there are a lot more positives than negatives here... Excellent location, walking distance within 10 minutes or less to the beach, food (fast-food and proper restaurants/bars) and ABC Store (right across the street). Breakfast (free breakfast) was a added bonus with a lot of Hot and Cold choices. Free Yoga classes every morning outdoors on the roof-top. So, if anyone is travelling on a budget or not and enjoys breakfast with a good location and parking (with in/out privileges) cheaper than most if not all in the area... then this should be your choice of stay. i would definitely recommend this location and property.

Good location: Short walk to beach and dining/shopping.ABC store across the street.Open air lobby, always busy. Arrived around noon, room wasn't ready, went out for lunch. Called in a couple of hours to ask if room was ready, came back, check in was smooth. There is a daily 'resort fee'.Ocean view room on high floor:Clean, comfortable but small, with mini fridge, microwave and keurig coffee maker; noisy air conditioner. Good wi fi.Housekeeping was good most of the time, missed our room on Sunday, we called, they came and did a quick job, forgot to replenish the tea/coffee and bathroom toiletries; called again and they were sent promptly.Concierge helped make a reservation for car rental for next day with enterprize, Thank you!!! (Dollar car rental nearby was sold out and more expensive).Did not talk to the activities desk staff, didn't need the map. In your face getting on/off elevators. Two sets of elevators, if room not on pool side, will have to interchange to get to pool. Hallways and elevators have no air conditioning.Small pool, hot tub, game room. ‘Beach’ towels available from housekeeping are nothing more than bath towels.Breakfast included, must present voucher at entrance.Spacious area, very busy, hard to find seats some mornings. Staff do a great job replenishing items and clearing tables. Two stations for coffee/tea. Eggs, cereal, bananas/apples, pancake machine, toaster, yogurts etc.,no potatoes. Same items entire week stay.All in all a good stay.

We liked this hotel in downtown Honolulu with the lobby so open to the elements. Concierge very helpful. Location pretty goid, waljing distance to main shopping district and Waikiki. The rooms are freshly renovated. From our 40+ floor we had a great view,!

Stayed at this hotel for a week. Pros: Clean and tidy rooms, excellent included breakfast, courteous staff and well located. Cons: noisy A/C units in rooms and, more disappointingly, an opportunity to attend a 2 hour tour of a “time share” at the Wyndham Outrigger hotel in return for a $250 discount on another activity arranged by the Holiday Inn concierge. The Holiday Inn staff were delightful and I don’t aim any anger towards them. My venom is aimed at the Wyndham time share “closer”named Alberto. Rude, condescending, unprofessional and truly disappointing. We were assured by the Holiday Inn staff that this would be a “no pressure” tour as we have done one other time share tour and were treated badly wanting nothing to do with another.Believe me, the discount coupon we received for doing the tour was NOT worth the degradation at the hands of this closer at Wyndham Outrigger hotel at the finish of the tour. I chastised the rep at Holiday Inn who recommended and promised a great experience and asked her to never recommend this tour to another Holiday Inn guest again. If you’re a guest here at Holiday Inn Express do not take the time share tour at the Wyndham Outrigger.

I was so happy here. Blocks from really good food (like Waikiki Brewing and Cinnamon's) and the beach, this hotel left me feeling rested and at-home. I had a king room with a city view, and it was small but well laid-out. The breakfast was tasty, and there's a pretty little patio to sit out and eat on. Parking was about $20/day. Overall, absolutely perfect for a quick little business trip!

We stayed at the Holiday Inn Express for two nights before going for our Hawaiian cruiseThis hotel served our purpose. It was near enough to the main shopping area and beach - probably less than 15 min walkThe free breakfast was also not badParking was a but expensive at about $28 but it comes with in and out privileges We parked at the nearby (3 min walk) King Kalakaua Plaza which was slightly cheaper but does not have in and out privileges. The rates are in the photo attachedThere are 2 hour parking at the street sides at the next street (Olahana Strret). Some reviewers wrote about a parking lot opposite the hotel - this is no longer available; it's private parking only

First of all....this hotel is a high rise with no balconies and has 44 floors. We initially were on the 35th floor so we had an awesome view of mountains, city views and partial ocean views. We did move down to 7th floor though after our terrifying 6am false fire alarm where we had to walk down all those flights of stairs.The pool and hot tub area on the 5th floor are very small but does the trick because if you want more water then go walk to the ocean which is a 10 minute walk away. The front desk staff were always so nice and accommodating especially the manager Gladys. The breakfast was the best breakfast I've ever had at a hotel with lots to choose from. The wait staff who cleared the tables and restocked all the food were always so friendly and efficient. The room was very small compared to any other hotel I've ever been to so a grown family of four would have a really hard time making their way around this room or even stowing their suitcases. You aren't in Hawaii to just hang out in a hotel room so if you don't mind smaller quarters you'll be fine. The room is clean and very modern and had good wifi. The one bed by the window is one foot away from the a/c unit so whom ever sleeps right there has the a/c blowing right into their face. I had to hang a towel over the bottom wood slats that covers the a/c unit so as to try to have the cold air blow upwards instead. Compared to other HNL hotels this is a better deal than most since it has the best breakfast ever which can save your family lots of money. I would stay here again but with no more than 2 people per room.

This Holiday Inn Express is a high-rise with 24 floors and over 300 rooms. The building is modern, clean and in a great state of repair. The location is near the beach and in walking distance of everything in Waikiki.Room was very quiet, the air conditioner kept us nice and cool and the bed was very comfortable. Our room was smaller than most Holiday Inn Express Hotels, but the layout is exceptional minimizing the inconvenience of a small room. The Bathroom is brightly lit and well thought out. Excellent roomy shower.The beach is a 5 minute walk from the front door.As with many Hawaiian hotels, the lobby related spaces are open air. Because of this, the included breakfast requires a voucher, in order to prevent non-guest participation. The food quality is about normal Holiday Inn Express fare, but because of the size of the hotel, this is a much bigger space with duplicated food serving facilities to accommodate a large number people. Pancake machines, biscuits and gravy, bread and toasters, cereal, yogurt, durable egg and egg-white products are there in quantity. Surprisingly for Hawaii, the fruit was limited to tired Red Delicious apples and unripe bananas. The fruit juice was definitely not fresh. It was stored in self-serve fountain machines.Be aware that this hotel, like most in Hawaii, imposes a resort charge that may, or may not be disclosed where you book the room.Good place. We like it

I will start out by stating that the rooms are smaller than the usual Holiday Inn Express experience, but I will balance that out with this: Did you really travel all the way to Waikiki to just stay in your room? I didn't think so. The hotel is clean, well appointed and has impeccable service. The rooms - although small - are equipped with everything you need, including refrigerator, microwave and coffee maker. We had a king bed room on the 40th floor and had a nice view of the city with mountains behind. I'm sure if I had been on the ocean side, that would have also been a great view from that high. The staff was always friendly and helpful - especially the people at the front desk. The breakfast was what you would expect if you have stayed at a Holiday Inn Express, but a few more options were offered along with the standard cinnamon rolls. On the 5th floor, they have a pool, hot tub, 9 hole miniature golf course and a few other outdoor games on the deck. If you're looking for a nice place at a good value, this is an excellent choice. Thank you HI Express staff for making our stay so enjoyable!

Room was very comfortable but too cramped for three adults. Washroom was very cramped. Concierge was absolutely fantastic. Terry Farrar was his name. First morning after we arrived, I went to see if he could get me one ticket for Pearl Harbor. He came through with flying colors, then managed to get my wife and sister-in-law on a helicopter trip around the island for the same afternoon!! Way to go, terry./

First off let me start with the staff was great and friendly. That's the only reason it didn't get a one. The rooms are small, that's fine, but the air conditioner is blowing on you constantly at bed height, no adjustment at all. The maid service would turn it off when they cleaned so you would came back to a HOT room. The floors/hallways and elevators were not air conditioned, just made being in the building was uncomfortable. Second the $20 resort fee is ridiculous. This is not a resort in any stretch of your imagination.

I recently had an overnight stay at this gem of a hotel in Waikiki. Although the lobby was buzzing, the front desk staff (notably Melonie, Virginia & Gladys) were very welcoming and thorough in explaining my bill, parking, tour credits etc. With the valet help of Sebastian we were in our room and unpacking immediately. The rooms are very European in size (small), but clean and the beds comfortable. The addition of a mini fridge, microwave and Keurig coffee machine are a nice touch. The complimentary breakfast on offer is ample and varied in choice. There is something there to appease all palates: 2 choices readymade omelets, turkey or pork sausage patties, pancakes, milk- whole, skim, chocolate or soy etc etc. I was impressed by the cleanliness, the swiftness in restocking, and the friendly staff - especially Andy. I stayed at this location many yrs ago when it was then known as the Maile Sky Court. The rebranding and total overhaul are commendable. The staff are the realstars! I would be happy to return if the occasion calls for it.

Stayed at this hotel for both of my recent business trips to Waikiki. Hotel has a convenient location within walking distance of the shopping and restaurants on Kalakaua. Rooms were recently renovated and look very modern. The rooms also have great uninstructed views. Hotel includes a free complimentary breakfast with a lot of offerings (you can make your own pancakes too!). I highly recommend this hotel whether you are traveling for business or pleasure.

I stay at the IHG chain a lot and Holiday Inn Express in particular as well. This one has made me rethink staying here only vacation travels. I had a very noisy air conditioner in my room that I complained about and all I got was "we will get someone to look into it". No offer to change the room or anything and the issue was not resolved. Kept me awake most of the night.

Great points: *Our standard room was (very cozy), but nicely done. *Front desk people very friendly. *The breakfast was very thorough and for a good amount of time. (Missed bacon though.)*1800 steps to the lovely, lovely beach. Fewer than 1800 steps to restaurants and shopping.*Pool is nice. Hot tub good too. *Coffee / tea maker in room is nice.*Newspaper available*Concierge / staff very helpfulAreas for improvement: *The sales part coming straight out of the elevator might have been a bit much...*Could use more hooks in the room to hang towels and swimsuits on would be great, especially when trying to reusing towels. *Would appreciate having a small milk in the fridge for the coffee / tea, but can get from the breakfast area.

I stayed at the hotel from 09th until 15th September. Every day my bed was made the room cleaned. the staff was very friendly. the breakfast was amazing with many choices and everything was freshly made. I requested to stay on a higher floor and my request was actioned. I would recommend this hotel and would definitely stay there again.

I had a Tuesday meeting in Honolulu but flew in 3 days early to me some Aloha! I had found this property online...pictures seemed to tell a good story. I upgraded myself (yes they charged me) to an upper floor and wow, the views were amazing! I stayed on the 39th floor - view was out towards both Diamondhead and the ocean. Stayed in a king bedded room - had an oversized TV in it, Bathroom was snug, but had everything I needed, including a stand up shower (not a big fan of tubs.) I worked out in the gym only once. Gym was nice. LIke the rest of the hotel, everything seemed brand new. I didn't use the sun deck facilities but walked around it...looked like it would be a lot of fun if I was traveling with colleagues or family. Other than the view from my room, I would say the free breakfast and the friendly staff is what makes this place so great. I highly recommend it.

Great location for the price. Five minutes walk to the beach. Very safe area. Cut through Fort DeRussy park to stay out of the sun. Cheap eats and activity site. Much better than hanging out by the expensive resorts. Huge hot tub and sunning area with mini golf. Small pool. Excellent breakfast! Eggs and either bacon or sausage daily as well as the usual pancakes rolls cereal etc. ask the hostess for a to go cup of coffee. All employees were friendly and helpful

The hotel looks amazing and is just one street from the beach! Rooms look brand new and are spacious the lobby . Breakfast was awesome. Great Service. Will come back again to the hotel if again in Hawaii.

We recently stayed 4 nights at this hotel. We were given a room on the 39th floor which provided a great SW view. Our room, somewhat tight, was nicely furnished with a microwave, coffee machine and good size frig. The bed was comfortable as well. Wifi worked great throughout the hotel. The main and jacuzzi pool were clean with ample lounges and umbrellas around. They were all new and of high quality too. However, being on the higher floor, it required you to take the very slow elevator down to lobby first then take another slow elevator back up to the pool level on the 5th floor.When we checked in, our A/C did not work well. It barely cooled our room and kept cutting out throughout the night. I reported this to reception the next morning and it was rectified. But as commented by another reviewer, where the A/C unit is mounted, it blew cool air directly on our heads no matter how the louvers were set. After two nights, we resorted to hanging some clothes in front of it to divert the air. In addition, the A/C unit was very noisy and would turn on and off throughout the night. The included breakfast was ample although limited in selection as we started to get tired of it by the 4th day. Otherwise, location of the hotel couldn't be better within 2 blocks to shops and restaurants. There's also a ABC store directly across the street whereby you can purchase drinks and food to bring back. All the staff we came across were friendly and helpful.

I was surprised to see how big this hotel was...44 floors. There are two sets of elevators, ask for a room on the pool side if you want to go swimming. If not you will have to go to lobby and then get on other set of elevators to go to pool. The only issue I had was there was air conditioning blow at the head board side of the bed. Not a good design. They need louvers or something to direct the air away from the head of the bed...very irritating. Staff was great at check in, and breakfast was fine. Good location in the Waikiki area.

So I have cousins that live in Honolulu and I live in LA and I decided to jump over to Honolulu for the weekend of Labor Day I needed a quick hotel something easy and something fast the holiday in express Waikiki has recently been refurbished and has a nine hole mini golf course and a pool on the floor deck. It also has a work out room on that deck which is awesome which you is very clean.  The room was not ready when I arrived but then again I arrive four hours early But they accommodate me and check my bags and off I went to explore horrible. The service was fantastic and the check in went smooth with help from to customer service reps at the front desk or nothing but extremely polite and fabulous the room was a little small but other than that very clean very nice but again small and with that recently refurbished hotel they install doors that are super thick and slam shut very hard but my room had an excellent view so I really didn't care.  Very centrally located we're cool he'll meet scholar, in the beginning ABC store on the corner and a seven minute walk to the international marketplace maybe 10 at the most it is perfect to get to the beach is right by Fort de Russo and the park and the Honolulu central Post Office.So what were the shortcomings? Well even though it had a nine hole golf course which is really fun and cool and the deck was nice the pool leaves a little bit to be desired small and very crowded did you Cousy is huge but again also very crowded. Half the deck is unused and it would've been better for the engineers to put in a bigger pool and less chair so I empty instead of a small pool and tons of chairs but again for the price tag it was a great stay for a long vacation maybe not again the holiday in express Honolulu has been renovated and is in great shape and the highlight was definitely the breakfast is included and it is huge it has everything you could ever want from full on pancake making machines to a light European breakfast fresh fruit for different types of juices yogurts everything under the sun eggs sausage you name it they got it definite highlight. Plus you can even take it to go if you want or you can take a couple of bananas and some bottled drinks before you go on your excursion with you after you ate breakfast it's all good

2 night stay at the Holiday Inn Express Waikiki, the suite was located on the 25th floor with views out to the ocean. The hotel reception was busy on arrival but staff were efficient. The hotel is located at the top end of Waikiki and in walking distance to most attractions and shops. The room was clean and a reasonable size although the bathroom was tiny. Great gym, again not large like the pool. The resort tax of $20 a night was over the top. Breakfast was the standard Holiday Inn fare.

This location is very walkable to really everything you want to do. We were close to Starbucks ,ABC's, Great shopping, good restaurants, no need for a car just call ... a driver.though Parking rates are reasonable.A very nice staff and big breakfast area.Open air concept for checkin .Pool,jacuzzi, golf, ping pong, small kids game room.

The Good: I love the open air lobby. Not sure I would during a windy storm though, but otherwise a nice concept. TJ checked me in and was wonderful during my entire stay. He helped me with bus routes and when I left my CC at the Hard Rock. And he was fun to talk to. He's an asset to the hotel. Since the hotel is re-modeled everything is clean and comfortable. The mattress was amazing. The TV in the room is unnecessarily huge but I loved it with all the available channels.I liked having a refrigerator to hold cold items. I never had long waits for the elevators like some complain about. The breakfast is typical HI Express. 3 Days is fine. Anymore and it's boring. The location is good. Near the end of the strip and just off many bus lines.The bad: The rooms are small. I mean REALLY small. Been to Tokyo or Hong Kong? Those are large in comparison. There is no work desk and chair. There is a table that fits over the bed like in a hospital. The window air-conditioner is not going to make people happy as it blows on the beds. Maybe cover with a pillow sheet? Also, I could not find a suitable outlet to charge my computer. After 10 minutes I pulled out a panel under the air-conditioner and found a socket. The pool is a joke. Way too small and half is 3 feet and half is 6 feet. So watch out. Why build a 9 hole putting green when you could have had a massive pool for such a huge hotel I'll never figure out. Not everyone spends the days at the beach, Tip- I had no problem with the air-conditioner because I had a room with 2 double beds. So I slept on the bed that had no air blowing on it. It's very possible my rating for this hotel would be lower if I had air blowing on me the whole time. So keep that in mind. The Ugly: There is a sign that says "Concierge" but that man at the desk is not there to make reservations or give directions. He's there to sell tours. And there's nothing wrong with that. Just change the sign to "Tour Desk". The deceptive sign is just wrong. Next to him is a desk that says "Maps and information". I have no idea what they are there for. Yes they gave me a map but seemed to have zero interest in giving me information and help. That's where TJ saved the day for me!

Holiday Inn Express Waikiki is an overall very solid hotel that is definitely better than the 2.5 star rating that it received. Our room was cleaned very early every morning and housekeeping did a solid job. However, some days the bed sheets had tiny stains that were hardly noticeable but nevertheless still there. In the room, the air conditioner tended to be very loud at night and sometimes made it hard to get a good night's rest. The location of the hotel near Fort DeRussy park made it easy to access perfect swimming parts of Waikiki beach. It was also very close and walking distance to downtown Waikiki and several bus stops. The breakfast in the morning was very good with plenty of selection, however, staying multiple nights the breakfasts do tend to become too repetitive. The pool was very nice with lots of chairs and several cabanas and the outdoor hot tub was very relaxing. There were lots of kids options including a small mini-golf course with a game room that contains several Wii-U consoles. The hotel seemed very new after the recent renovation and the staff were very friendly to help. Great stay and would definitely recommend.

nice rooms, good breakfast, overall nice stay. Just can't get over the wyndham staff trying to harrass you every single time you enter and exit the hotel, they will try to get you promising free activities and free lunches but all they do is waste 2 hours of your life trying to sell you TIMESHARE.

Comfortable beds, and only 5-10 minutes from beach, restaurants and shops.Aircon was a bit noisy, but we turned this off when going to sleep!Free breakfast was ok, only thing was there were too many products with way too much sugar, I would of liked to see a few healthier options. Staff was really friendly.

We have never waited in a line so long just to be told our room was not ready, checked our bags for us and sent us to lunch, came back a second time and still not ready, went and spent time with the Expedia booth, ended up purchasing a luau at the Hilton and a Helicopter ride! Got back in a much longer line the third time, after waiting nearly an hour for check in the agent told us we could have came to the priority checking line that had a tiny sign and no one the other two times we were there said anything about it! The front desk clerks were very nice, but the check in process needs a serious look at the process and a re-do! Elevators were slow but once we got to our room everything was perfect! Perfectly clean and all the amenities we needed, even though the actual size of the room is very small. The location was convenient to everything, bus lines, restaurants, shopping and parks! The "breakfast area" was more like a restaurant with tons of tables and outdoor seating, we went down early and a line had formed but it was very organized and all the lines got through quickly with a lot of choices to pick from! Whoever set up the breakfast area really knew how to plan! Also the staff was very helpful and kind! The fifth floor had the pool and spa, which we did not use, but wanted to see the mini golf and large chess pieces! We will definitely stay here again and recommend to others coming to this exciting area!

The pros: nice breakfast, fast wifi, good location and nice front desk staff (Gladys and Rose are very sweet and thanked me for being Gold with IHG). The cons: absolutely terrible housekeeping! Take a look at my pics. Crazy stains on my sheets and who knows what on my hairdryer. SO GROSS! This hotel is brand new looking...if they don't make serious changes to their housekeeping, this place will be a dump before you know it. The bad housekeeping moved what would have been a 4 star review to a 2 star. What a shame.

The hotel has been renovated and rebranded from what used to be the Maile Sky Court, where I've stayed numerous times before.The renovation is welcome, as are the new breakfast room and gym. But the rooms are still cramped; conversations with other guests about their rooms had them rolling their eyes too.The hotel's laughable solution is to put in a mobile table over the bed to save space, but that is negated by a an executive-style chair that is too big for the room and has no wheels. It blocked access to one side of the room and could be pushed aside only with a mighty effort, risking injury to one's back. What were they thinking?On the plus side, the rooms were kept clean and the buffet breakfasts were generous if monotonous over a two-week stay, and the hotel is located relatively close to Ala Moana shopping center and beach park. On the negative side, in addition to the cramped rooms (about 12 x 12 ft), the parking garage ($27/day!) was dark and finding an scarce empty space in it at night was a roll of the dice, and some spaces had water dripping on them from leaking pipes on the ceiling. Because of the lack of spaces, some cars were allowed to park in areas that were hazardous for other drivers to pass. Other drawbacks include the slow elevators; besides long waits for elevators to arrive, guests have to change elevators to reach certain floors, including the floors with the pool and gym; very inconvenient. Also, as far as I could tell, there were ice machines on only three floors of the 44-floor hotel.Finally, in a breach of security, a staff member alarmingly walked in on me one day without knocking or any announcement, and only mumbled an apology when I followed him out and questioned him; I reported the intrusion to management but never received an explanation of what he was doing there.

We stayed here for 5 nights and it was a lovely hotel! Breakfast was nice lots of choice both hot and cold to choose from! Pool area was nice (no bar up there was a little disappointing for us as to get a drink or a snack we had to walk to the shop). Other that that the rooms were nice with comfy beds and fridge! Overall we had a nice stay!

The overall running of that hotel seemed a little hectic at times. The line for check-in was very long, though it was reasonable for the elite line (I am platinum). The cleanliness of the room was sub par: when we arrived in the room, half the pillows were stained, and the armchair was covered in sand.The room was otherwise nice, with a great view. Breakfast was simple but all right, I was afraid considering how crowded the hotel was that it would be too hectic but it was fine as the breakfast room is big. It's a shame that the breakfast only runs until 9am, which is quite early if you want to have a relaxing time in Hawaii. The side effect of this was that it was next to impossible to get onto an elevator to go down just before 9, that could easily take 20 minutes until you got one. The swimming pool was probably big enough for 2 or 3 people to swim at the same time, or maybe up to a dozen to stand, which is ridiculous for a 44-story hotel.Anyway, all of this is barely relevant in regards to the incident we had: a security officer came banging at our door 5 minutes before midnight shouting "security! Open your door!". When I asked him to slip his ID through the crack of the door he refused, saying I should be able to see it through the peephole (I barely could see there was an ID on him). When I asked him why I should trust he is who he claims and open the door, his reply was that I would otherwise be charged with trespassing (yes, he really said that!). He also refused to tell me the reason of his visit. After a while when he seemed calmer I agreed to open the door, and only after I let him in did he tell me the reason of his late and threatening visit: the neighbors downstairs saw a little bit of water trickling down from their ceiling. He wanted to come in to check if we had any flooding, saw that there was none, and said a bunch of bad things about the owners and how they don't have a good upkeep of their plumbing.The silver lining is that the next day when I came to complain at the front desk, Gladys received my complaint and acknowledged how unacceptable that is and handled the situation very kindly and professionally. She agreed to discount one night from our trip, though as we booked on points it will have to come in the form of point reimbursement through IHG, for which I am still waiting almost a month later.

This hotel is on the north side of Waikiki where it's quieter and not as crowded without being isolated. It's pretty much within a 10 minute distance to almost everywhere in Waikiki, including the Royal Hawaiian Center and the beach with plenty of things to see on the way. There is no restaurant on site, but there are plenty of places to eat within a 3 minute walk. There is plenty of public transportation. There is a small convenience store in the lobby and if they don't have what you need, there's a convenience store right across the street.The hotel is clean and well-kept. Front desk personnel are very friendly. The room was small but adequate, there's enough room to move about freely, but not much just for hanging out--but you're not going to do that anyway, right? I had a single king room on the 11th floor. When I first arrived, the air conditioner was way too noisy for me--but, I either got used to it or it somehow worked itself out during my stay. I know they were working on the air conditioners in the hotel in general during that week. The room had plenty of outlets, but no room for computer desk. There is an adjustable height, moveable table that can be used for the laptop or breakfast in bed. Bathroom has a lighted mirror which doesn't give you the best lighting to put on makeup or brush your hair, especially with the bathroom door and window curtain open. Each room has a fridge, microwave and pod brewer, as well as an iron and ironing board, and a safe. Internet is included and is quite fast and trouble free. The beds are brand new and quite comfy with soft, fluffy pillows.The included breakfast buffet has an adequate variety of items and plenty of space to dine. They will even box up your breakfast to take back to your room. You can pick up a daily newspaper in the breakfast room.There is a very small pool, not really suitable for swimming but suitable for soaking with it's chilled water, and a spa that's about half the size of that. The pool deck is very nice for laying out on, with many comfortably padded lounges and a number of sheltered cabanas. For the kids, old and young alike, there's a 9 Hole mini golf course, a giant chess board, ping pong, and shuffleboard. Just off the pool deck there is a game room with Wii's for electronic gaming. The hotel has a small but adequately equipped exercise room but, really, you're in Hawaii--get your exercise walking or hiking.I encountered no problems during my stay, but I did have a slight issue adjusting the table in the room. I didn't have to wait more than a minute for someone to come help me with it.

I was very happy with this hotel. Though the room was very small, we spent little time there anyway and the view was great! The pool area was excellent with a nice big hot tub. The front desk staff and bellmen were exceptionally friendly and helpful, and the lobby attendants were very "attentive". It was a very short walk to the beautiful Waikiki beach through a nice park area with amazing trees and birds. And right around the corner were all the cool shops and plenty of dining. If I came back I would be happy to stay here again!

Was here on business and decided to stay here because I've never been disappointed staying at a Holiday Inn Express so far. Plus the free breakfast and the multiple activities for my family to do while I was work was a bonus. First, the good: breakfast area is huge and the food is on point. The staff was nice for the most part and tried to assist in every way possible. It's centrally located so you can walk everywhere. Now, the bad: rooms are REALLY small! I had a king size bed and there was maybe 3-4 ft of walking space on all sides. The bathroom is even smaller and awkward. You can't really get to the sink because the wall is in the way. For what they charge you in resort fees, the pool is extremely small and the "spa" is even smaller. The mini golf was neat but eh, still not that impressive. Lastly, the AC was really loud but they changed out the thermostat in the middle of our stay and we couldn't adjust the temperature any longer...not good for really hot days after work. Overall, I'm disappointed and will more than likely not stay here again.

Rooms are very clean and staff is great but the AC kept me up all night. It is so loud; approximately 2 feet away from your bed. I would not stay here again because of this. I hope they make a change to this for the hotel is great otherwise.

Truly an excellent stay. Eighteen days for business. Excellent staff. New furnishings. Better than average location. Reasonable pricing. What more needs to be said. Free breakfast. Yes the rooms are not the largest and the elevators take some getting used to, but, the room is for sleeping and if you are on vacations, you are not going anywhere in a hurry.
