Plan accordingly for the wait. In all, for a two and a half week stay, have to say they more than outdid themselves. Would I stay with them again - a resounding yes.

Its quite easy to find. Located in Waikiki on Namahana street. The check-in process was easy and quick. I was able to check in early which was a blessing. The parking rate was a bit steep, $27 a night, and if you get in late at night, you may have to creep into the garage as you wind around cars parked or crammed into every spot that they can fit their vehicle into. The rooms are small, but if you dont plan on spending too much time in your room, then it wont matter. The rooms are clean, and it includes a microwave and refrigerator. The front desk clerk named "Lave" knows how to deliver friendly customer service. He was patient and listened to my request and he took the time to see if he could accommodate my family. The laundry facilities on the third floor was convenient. The game room, pool, hot tub and exercise room on the fifth floor was a BIG hit with my kids! The icing on the cake for our stay at the Holiday Inn Express Waikiki is their awesome Breakfast Buffet. The unlimited Pancakes, juice, cinnamon roles, yogurt, omelettes, etc, made this place our "go to" hotel whenever we island hop to O'ahu. The prices vary as we paid about $100 more when we stayed for the first time last week, but it was such a good experience, that I decided to rebook here on our next visit to Honolulu.

This hotel is adequate, but nothing to brag about. Average to good location - the beach is about 0.5 miles straight through the park past Fort DeRussey. It's an easy, shaded walk. The hotel is about that same distance from the heart of Waikiki dining and shopping on Kalakaua Ave and the International Market Place. If you're ok with a bit of walking then you're fine. There's not a lot to do right by the hotel like others in Waikiki like the Hilton and Marriott brands. Then again, that's likely why you get such a good price. We didn't mind the walk to the beach, shopping or dining.Good breakfast - probably the best feature is the free breakfast with pre-made omeletes, sausage, gravy, biscuits, pancakes, bagels, cinnamon rolls, cereals, yogurts. It seems to stay busy. Prepare for a line at the door when it opens at 6:30AM. Great activity options on the 5th floor - putt putt, large chess board, foosball, ping pong, shuffle board, pool and hot tub. This was probably the second best thing about this hotel. Not that clean - I'm not sure they vacuumed our room in 10 days. The bathroom floor looked pretty dirty from day one. Parking is tight - don't plan on parking in the garage if you return to the hotel in the evening; it'll likely be full. They will reimburse your day in the hotel garage if you have to park offsite, but it's more a matter of convenience for us and we didn't want to,have to park somewhere else and have to go move the car the next morning. Also, people park along the walls making it impossible for two cars going in opposite directions to get through. It's tight enough already without the added pain of parking along the walls. Elevators can take a while - there are six elevators for 44 floors. Three elevators service the top floors while the other three elevators service the bottom half . All six elevators service the lobby through the third floor. They were many, many instances where an elevator would finally come to our floor, but it would be full so you had to wait another few minutes for the next one. It took us nearly ten minutes to get from the 33rd floor to the lobby on occasion. Oh, the elevators get HOT and when crowded it's not super enjoyable mSmall room - our room was small enough, but felt extra crowded with two queen beds, the chair and the small table. Probably the tightest space we've dealt with in a hotel room since Venice or London. Room with a view - higher floors mean longer elevator rides, but if you get a corner room on a high floor with a view of the beach and mountains you will appreciate it. Bottom line - if on a budget, stay here and save even more by taking advantage of the free breakfast. If you can spend another $50-$100 a day, then opt for a hotel in a slightly better location and one with more resort-like amenities. We already planned our next trip to Honolulu and picked a different hotel. We decided to go with a hotel closer to the center of Waikiki and closer to the beach.

Property is very clean and updated. They served the same thing everyday for breakfast (came with the room)--but has to have a breakfast ticket for every person over 12 yo. Right on Waikiki strip. 10 min walk to the beach. Rooms are very small especially the corner rooms facing the beach.

The rooms are small but clean. Breakfast was pretty good, The workers are very friendly and helpful. laundromat was overpriced . Great location, about a mile from Waikiki beach, there is also a McDonald's and House of pancakes about a block away.

Spent 4 nights here and had a good tine. It is a nice hotel, in a good central location,good value for money and good amenities. We (2 adults and 1 child) had a room with 2 double beds. The room wasn't too big but had everything we needed. The hotel has a pool & spa, games room as well as putt putt golf and outdoor chess. The free breakfast was good as well. Highly recommended !!!

Hotel was nice-tiny rooms; but if you organize your stuff, it was good. Staff was always friendly - especially the lady cleaning our room. Was close to walk to shops and restaurants, but this was first visit not staying on beach and it was too far. Most bus stops were close, you just gotta figure it out early.Thumbs down...calling the "play area" by the pool an ammenity. Mandatory $20 a day for something you don't use-riddiculous!!!! It was cute, but alot of extra money for something that didn't get used. Ping pong on a roof top where it was consistently windy-again, riddiculous. The money you spent on this activity area should have been used for an adult pool or a kids pool. Sitting in a hot tub with kids constantly jumping in and splashing you, not so relaxing.While the staff was friendly, they weren't so helpful. Helping with bus/trolley schedule-not so knowledgeable. Most frustrating, finding a wheelchair for my mother. She didn't need one full time, but would have enjoyed her time there more having one a couple of days. Disappointed hotel didn't have one; but if they could have at least gotten me in touch with a company-would have be helpful. Company they gave me sucked - once I finally got ahold of someone, their customer service was bad. My mom ended up not getting one...disappointed!!

We stayed 3 nights at this hotel. We arrived early due to an overnight flight and the very helpful desk staff rearranged rooms so we could check in early. The room was small but clean and well appointed with coffee, wifi etc. The only problem we experienced was the air conditioning was very noisy regardless of settings.The included breakfast was disappointing as it offered little low fat options and differed little day to day.The hotel is well located if you wish to avoid the busy downtown area of Waikiki. It is a short walk to a good beach, bus stops, a large park and also Waikiki.

This hotel is a fantastic place to stay.I spent 5 days staying here with my family, the rooms are bright and welcoming. They offer a free buffet breakfast which has excellent fresh food every morning. Its only 5-10 min walk down to Waikiki beach and localised to some excellent restaurants. I cannot praise the staff enough they were always so friendly and greeted us every morning when we would leave for the day and welcomed us back every afternoon excited to hear what we had gotten up to for the day. There is a pool, mini golf course and a games room available to guests and they have a coin laundry for you.I highly recommened this hotel to anyone staying in Waikiki.

Helpful and friendly staff. Great breakfast bar. Very clean. Room very small but did not plan to spend time in room except for sleeping. Parking garage was often full, but was able to find parking. Breakfast staff excellent!!

Hotel renovations are very nice but room size should have been enlarged. Overall stay was good and property itself was well maintained as far as cleanliness, however, having experienced 2 fire alerts during the wee hours of the morning and climbing down 20 flight of stairs at 3am only to be told that they were false alarms wasnt too pleasing. Then to add fuel to the fire on day 3 after having been notified by hotel staff that the laundry facility would be out of service for 48 hours with no alternative solution or suggestions doesn't sit well when you're away from home for a week..

For budget travelers, HIE was a great choice compared to other hotels in the area close to Hawaiian Convention Center. Our room # 4410 (partial view of Ocean, topmost floor) was just as promised - with a partial view of the canal to the left, Diamond Head volcano in front view and partial view of the ocean to the right. The room was clean, the bedspreads and pillows all crisp white and the bed was very comfortable. Some reviews have found HIE rooms small but since we had only backpacks and one carry-on, the room size didn't bother us. Those of you with multiple luggage might find it small. The air condition was loud as many reviewers have said, but it is effective and at the time we were there (June 4-June 11), it was pretty humid so we welcomed its full blast.The hotel's complimentary breakfast was great - Apart from sugary cinnamon buns, muffins, sliced bread and bagels, there were machines churning out pancakes. There were also eggs, sausages, hot and cold cereals, milk, yogurt, juices, fruits (bananas and apples), tea and coffee. What more you want?The hotel pool is small, but then who wants to be in the pool when you have the ocean to swim. There is also a Jacuzzi. I didn't use the pool until the last day when I had some time to kill before check-out. There is an outdoor play area next to the pool and a gym somewhere in the building which I didn't bother to look. The hotel also has laundry facility which I didn't use. There is a small convenience store in the lobby that came in handy when I wanted some chilled bottled water.Overall a great experience. The newly renovated hotel felt fresh and contemporary, the staff very friendly (as we found all Hawaiians to be that way in general) and budget-friendly in expensive Hawaii. One complaint though - the hotel driveway is very small. When a driver in front of you parks and disappears or someone is offloading luggage, the car behind it gets stuck. Hope the hotel management sees to it that there is someone assigned to better manage the drop-off, pick-up situation there. Hawaii is such a beautiful place and the hotel only helped in making our first time experience there a memorable one. We will certainly be back. Thank you, HIE! Mahalo!

review_body: The only fault that we experienced was a very very noisy air conditioner. We had to turn it up to level 36 to hear anything. At night we turned it off and opened the windows.The lifts are very very slow .

First time in a while staying at a three star hotel, but we were pleasantly surprisedIt's main selling points are the location (walking distance to everything), good views, kids stay and eat free, as well as the free hotel breakfast. There also great amenities on the fifth floor, with a life size chess board, small but adequate pool, tons of deck chairs, cabanas, spa, Pitt putt, games room and gym. The recent refurbishment also meant it was easier in the eye than any other similarly priced hotels we could find They also have a coin operated laundryFull length mirror in the rooms and a great tv. Coffee machine and microwave The rooms are a little tight, the lifts a bit slow (and stuffy). The plastic cups in the room were a little amusing, no wine opener (had to go to house keeping to use the only one they have in the whole hotel). Parking is $27 a night. But all of these things were bearable and not an inconvenience, considering all the positives On one last note, breakfast finished at 9:30, and they literally slide the door closed that surround the buffet. It's quite efficient, but a little weird! I also noticed many of the guests unashamedly 'taking away' food (read lunch) from breakfast; one woman even brought her own plastic bags! Perhaps the hotel should keep an eye on this stuff :)

Pros: Very good place to stay. Walking distance to everything! Great breakfast. Wonderful staff!! ABC store across the street. Cons : pool closes very early. All hotels have this : Parking fees and resort fee.

the rooms are holiday inn standards, the location is just so so. There's IHOP in front of the hotel, nearby Mcdonalds, must try japanese restaurant in front of Mcdonalds, ABC store in the corner. We chose this hotel to avoid beach front noise and daily beach fee (with or without using) Walking distance to duty free. We we're told to keep away from the back road at night as it is dangerous. Parking fee is same as other hotels, super expensive. Everywhere else is the same...

The renovations that were done have made the place look like brand new (my older daughter enjoyed seeing the fish in the lobby). Even though the room was small, it didn't matter because we were on the go most of the time (as I would imagine anyone would be when visiting Hawaii). Hotel had the best free breakfast I'd ever seen, lots of choices; the cinnamon rolls were my favorite, but the instant pancake machine was a close second. Pool deck area is nice (even though it was little windy during our stay, we were still able to enjoy it). Lastly, I want to give a huge shout out to Sebastian, he greeted us when we arrived and assisted with getting our luggage up to our room while I parked the car. He also interacted well with my two daughters (my older one always remembered seeing him and commented on how nice he was), always asked us how are day was, and wished us well when we were stepping out. I would definitely recommend this hotel to others.

Short one night stay using the Chase credit card annual certificate, which should cover the entire night for rooms and taxes. Upon checkout, informed of the $20 "facilities fee" which pretty much included using every damn amenity that the hotel has to offer. So basically, when I'm paying for the room, I'm ONLY paying for the room. If I was informed of the $20 facilities fee either through the confirmation email (which I was told at checkout and still can't seem to locate it on the email) or upon checkin, I probably would not be so irritated that I'm writing a TripAdvisor review. Why would you give me a sheet of the facilities included in the fee at checkout? If you're expecting a guest to pay that fee, it should be informed at checking so they are fully aware of what is offered and can take advantage of the faculties fee. Btw, there was a 10% off at gift shop offer which was on the Ihg Website and app that the front desk was not aware of. Funny that they are not aware of content that is actually on the website.

Admittedly I booked this hotel through a discount site, but even if I had paid full price it still would have been reasonable value for money. Breakfast is buffet style, but lots of it (all you can eat!) and choice from porridge, omelettes, sausages, bacon etc to toast, crumpets, bananas and lovely sticky cinnamon crumpets means that you eat your fill before starting out for the day. In addition, free wifi and $50 off any trip booked at the hotel via the local Expedia agent mean that you feel the hotel price is value. The rooms were clean and perfectly functional but were definitely on the small/ budget side and the windows would not open. The only real downside was the noise - the walls were obviously very thin, could hear the next door room and people walking the corridor and opening doors throughout the night/ early morning. However, perhaps I was just unlucky with my neighbour! Would still recommend this hotel, the staff were excellent, friendly and efficient and hotel is very short walk from town centre and Waikiki beach.

A friend of mine recommended this hotel for its convenient location and reasonable price, so I stayed here. The hotel was clean and very nice. The view from my room, although it was not an ocean view, was stunning. The staff members are friendly and accomodating. During my last night here, I had some issues with loud noises from room next door late at night. When I informed the front desk of this problem, they took care of it right away. I had a very pleasant stay here, and will be absolutely returning here in the near future.

My wife and I spent 9 days on Oahu in May at the Holiday Inn Express and the people and staff were just wonderful . They always had a smile and were quick to help in anyway possible and the free morning meal way great . You couldn't ask for a better location and the pool and area around the lounge area was spotless . They remodeled the hotel and completed it in April and its really nice . Like I said earlier the staff and all included were great and we can"t wait for another trip . Go to there web-site and check it out or better yet go and see for yourself . Thanks for listening

Its a nice hotel with really comfortable and cozy rooms, which I didn't feel were so small after having stayed in smaller in Mumbai! The room had a super comfy bed, the towels were changed daily, the in-room coffee / tea maker was fabulous, and there was a small fridge to keep perishables in.The housekeeping were sweet in providing a shaving cream foam spray, a razor and a toothbrush with toothpaste after I realized I'd forgotten to pack them. Overall, all the staff were fabulously polite and welcoming. The mustachioed gent in the lobby (Mr. Max?) helped us book the airport shuttle back and Mr. Sebastian who helped with the luggage were especially sweet.The view from my room was not so great, mainly showing the balconies of the Ambassador hotel across the street (I got a decent price on Booking.com, so didn't worry about the view). At night with the lights on, I did worry if the guests at the Ambassador could see into my window and felt comfortable only after I'd drawn the curtains. But these were minor quibbles, since I was out at my conference or sightseeing and only returned to sleep! By the way, the Hawaii Convention Centre where the conference (ISLH2017) was is just 900 meters away, i.e. a 10-12 minute walk at most...The breakfast was good (so few in Honolulu had free breakfast on offer). The cinnamon rolls esp. were really tasty! The best part was that it began 6:30 am onwards so I had time to eat before my 7 am pick-up for a tour on day 1!

I was told that this hotel had just gone under a major renovation and it shows. The rooms are a little small but the way they furnished them made them perfectly acceptable. We had a refrigerator and a microwave as well as Keurig coffee maker. We were on one of the higher floors and the views of Waikiki beach and Diamond Head were incredible. Well worth the few extra dollars to have those views. The have a pool located on the 5th floor of the building which was very well done and on the same area they have a miniature golf course, shuffle board, a great big chess set, fuse ball and ping pong! Not sure about the ping pong, a little too windy to play outdoors. They also had a game room on the same floor with WI games and TV’s!The best part was the breakfast that comes with the room for free! They have these pancake machines that you just press a button and you can watch them being made, takes about 30 seconds! In addition to that they have a full breakfast buffet with fruit, eggs, cereal, everything!The staff was very friendly, smiling and helpful. It was about a 5 minute walk to the beach which was great and the shopping, 1 block away is world class!

very good hotel, location , staff , breakfast ,view ,room ,, in the heart of Waikiki and shopping street ,beside many restaurant , 8 minuets walk to beach , price with respect other hotel is amazing .. all very good

The hotel has been upgraded beautifully. It's so nice they priced me out of it for this years stay. From the picture I have seen of the new lobby it appears many of the former Aqua staff have stayed on. And hears lies the problem. Since Aqua took over several years ago they constantly try to down grade the type of room one pays for. I have had to argue with them every year. Last year I was delayed by my flight and then the airport shuttle was over booked and I had about a two hour wait at the Honolulu Airport. It was one in the morning when I checked in. They tried to give me one of their cheapest rooms although I booked what was called a Deluxe Ocean View. Those are the corner rooms facing Diamond Head and the ocean. After demanding the phone number of the corporate office to call at 8AM they found their mistake and assigned me the nicest room in the hotel on the 44th floor. It wasn't as if they didn't know me, they greeted me when I arrived by name. IIf one can get passed the questionable check-in you will be very pleased with the hotel. Everything is modern and well maintained. I can not speak about the pool and hot tub area as it was closed for remodeling but the hot tub was one of the amenities I always enjoyed on previous vistits

Formerly known as the Nailers Sky Court, now Holiday Inn Express, outstanding hotel to stay at. Gladys outstanding, exceptional customer service. She has very much the Aloha spirit. I wrecommend this hotel to everyone I know. Thanks Ms. Gladys.

Our first time staying at this hotel (May 5-7) we were pretty excited! Surprised our 13 year old for his birthday; from Molokai, so anything off island is great! Well upon check in, we didn't get any kind of special welcoming except "hi! Next pls?" Went straight to the point on hotel fees ($20 each day+tax), parking fees ($27 each day+tax) on top of a $100 hold after paying in full of just under $500 for only (2) nights; and info on breakfast. We paid for a ocean view and receptionist originally was going to place us in a partial ocean view on 24th floor. I asked about our ocean view room and she said "let me see, there is one available on 35th floor, so I'll upgrade you!" How is it a upgrade to ocean view when I payed for it in the first place? Carrying on, confused on our "free upgrade" and disappointed on fees after fees, we got to the room and was really happy with our corner room with ocean view! I must say it was beautiful despite a really squishy room but that didn't bother us because it was nicely laid out to good use. Bed and pillows was okay, but A/C was very loud and obnoxious at night. It was hard to sleep and stay asleep. Breakfast in the dining area was really nice and food options were good too! However, the older Caucasian lady collecting tickets was something else... I left to use the bathroom, I came back in she says very loudly "Ma'am, Ma'am?" I turned around and told her "I just went to use the bathroom, I was already in here eating." She says, "well you need to let me know..." Last time I needed to ASK PERMISSION" to use the bathroom was in elementary school. After, My 13 year old and husband went to use the bathroom and was not told anything by that lady... um okay... not sure what that was about. Other than that, our stay was okay. Store across the street was pretty good with lots of options for your personal needs. Hotel was nicely decorated with pretty color accents and furniture! Made good use of water machine in lobby. My husband forgot his shaving cream and shaver at home but hotel provided these items for free! We plan on coming back this coming up week on May 17-19 to surprise our other son for his birthday, so we're hoping to have a "great experience" all around! We'll see how this visit goes... Fyi, I payed through third party for this upcoming visit because I feel the price I payed last time was not adequate based on this past experience. The discounted rate will make me feel not so cheated like last. I'll be posting a review after next visit, stay tuned... Aloha

We stayed here for 3 nights post cruise. We loved it. We have stayed at other Holiday Inn Express and just found what they offer to be great. The rooms did not seem all that small to me as I have stayed in smaller and had spent 18 nights on a cruise ship prior. There was plenty of space to move around with plenty of space for baggage as well. Bathroom was small but the shower was huge which I did love. Only down side about the room is the air conditioner, it is very noisy and old but not to much of an issue. We had a room on the 39th floor looking over the Canal and the beach was stunning! beds are also super comfy. Breakfast was great, the cinnamon rolls are AMAZING! can i get some sent to Australia please haha. Heaps on offer sausage, eggs, breads, pastries, cinnamon scrolls, cereals, fruits really great offering and not crazy busy. Staff are lovely, we arrived at 9am on a Friday and expected to be told to come back for check in (which would have been fine) but our room was ready to go which was fantastic! The outside area is super fun with mini golf, giant chess, pool, spa, gym and plenty of sun lounges to lounge around. Only about a 5 minute walk to Waikiki its self plenty of food options around the hotel as well if you don't feel like walking. Only issue we encountered at one point the front desk must have cut our room key for someone else as they did walk into our room, was a little awkward, but not an issue. All in all a great hotel if you are travelling on a budget and looking for something to include breakfast which also saves money.

Our flight was cancelled and Delta airlines put us up for the night in the Holiday Inn Express hotel. We were very pleased. This hotel was recently renovated and reopened in Jan 2017. -The hotel is located in the heart of Waikiki within walking distance to the beach, shopping centers, restaurants and bars.-The rooms were well appointed with a modern contemporary design. The rooms had a huge flat screen TV, Kuerig coffee maker, microwave and mini-fridge.-The rooms had several windows with amazing views.-There was a pool, hot tub, miniature golf, giant chess set, shuffleboard and a game room.-The staff was friendly and very helpful with restaurant reservations and even called the cab company for our early morning departure.-Free breakfast is served in the morning.-The only con was the super loud air conditioning unit, when it kicked on it would wake you up.I highly recommend this hotel.

Formerly the 2.5-star Maile Sky Court, Holiday Inn Express recently opened, fresh with top to bottom renovations, looks fresh and clean. It is located at the beginning (west end) of Waikiki with easy access to Ala Moana and the rest of Waikiki. Rooms are tiny, with the beds taking up much of the roughly 250 sq ft room, no lanai, and low ceilings. Windows do not open and the the room is cooled via individual a/c units, which are quite noisy. Being 40+ stories, the higher levels offer commanding views of the ocean and mountain, around level 25 will clear most of the surrounding buildings.Breakfast was a cattle call. While the restaurant was large with indoor and outdoor seating, so were the patrons. With 40+ stories and 16 units per level, you can imagine the breakfast crowd. Despite this, the food choices were very respectable and well stocked, with decent pre-made omelets, bacon or sausage (rotated on odd/even days), a pancake making machine (slow, so-so pancakes, but cool to watch), pastries/breads/cereals, limited uncut fruit, juices, and coffee.Lobby was spacious and bright. Front desk was overwhelmed with the volume. Despite being a higher tiered IHG member and making my reservations on their website, they couldn't find my reservation, i needed to dig out my confirmation number, and could not offer a late checkout. Garage was a bit filthy and an automated gate with license plate reader which worked on occasion. $27 self parking. $20 convenience fee, not sure what this is for, maybe to cover breakfast? I guess they couldn't call it a resort fee, being several blocks from the beach.Good for short stays on a budget, any longer, the room is a bit too claustrophobic. Would i stay here again for a short stay, possibly if the nett rate remains in the mid $100s.

Reasonably priced hotel in popular destination - Waikiki, typical Holiday Inn atmosphere with a touch of Hawaiian charm. Staff courteous, but frequently overwhelmed with so many guests. Long check-in lines. Breakfast (6:30-9:30) is adequate , but make sure get up early. 30 min before closing very little food options left. Rooms are modern with 55 inch TV screens, beds comfortable. My biggest problem was air conditioning - no central air. Every room has a large window air conditioning unit installed next to each bed. Now imagine getting good night sleep with such noisy air conditioning unit running on and off and blowing cold air directly at you all night. To be honest, after 3 nights, I slept better. Our brains can filter out noisy sources, but I won't be returning to this hotel.

The location of the hotel is very central. You can walk around and get to many stores and restaurants very easily. The hotel is newly renovated and it looks brand new. The rooms are small but the beds are big. So my family and I slept very well. Four of us stayed in the room. Two adults and two young children. The building is very tall so we had a great view of the ocean. This hotel is not beach front. The price of the rooms are good value for what you are getting.

We escaped another horrid hotel for the Holiday Inn Express and in all honesty, this place was a breath of fresh air. Let me break down the Pros and Cons of this place:Pros- walking distance to restaurants and beach- 5th floor pool & jacuzzi is nice- Renovated rooms are small but very clean and well appointed- Staff is friendly and willing to go the extra mile when you need itCons- Activities desk staff is annoying as they hassle you waiting for the elevator- Check in can take a whileSimply put, if you need a hotel in Honolulu that's not going to break the bank, this place is it.

The hotel is conveniently located near the beach and shopping centers. The rooms are a bit small however the beds are very comfortable and the staff are very friendly and willing to help out. It is a very busy hotel however. The breakfast is wonderful, the best continental breakfast that I have had so far. There's a nice swimming pool, hot tub and miniature golf course as located within the hotel.

Our stay, from check in to check out was filled with the kind aloha spirit of the staff, from front desk, to restaurant staff, to housekeeping. We were constantly greeted and asked if they could do anything for us. The room was perfect with an ocean view on the 42nd floor and the most amazing, comfortable beds. Free breakfast was a plus and was a delicious balance to get our days started. The fitness facility, pool, and deck were a wonderful place for us to hang out while we were in between adventures! The hotel was centrally located to everything, from Ala Moana, to Kapiolani Park. I would highly recommend this hotel!

Really nice renovation of the old Maile Sky Court.Beautiful open air lobby but potentially long wait at the desk to check in.Not your usual HIE with its 50+ stories and 500+ rooms.Got off to a bad start with a $20 something a day "amenity charge" and a $100 "security deposit". Both ridiculous as far as I'm concerned.We were not paying in cash.Rooms are notoriously small but we had a corner king room with sofa that was really nice. We could see the ocean, lots of green space at Ft Durussy, mountains and the Ala Wai complete with canoe rowing sometimes. Many high rise buildings as well.Downside was we had to go up to the 26th floor and walk down several stairs to get to our room on the 25th floor. Can't say I've ever seen an arrangement quite like that before; a bit of a hassle with large suitcases.Nearest ice machine was on floor 30.Tiny bathroom with a door about 22" wide. It was functional with good lighting.I hope the renovation stands the test of time. Seams were already coming apart on the sofa cushions and walls are showing marks from the chair. Furniture is modern but cheap looking.Work horse air conditioners(2 of them) kick on and off constantly and the breeze is likely to blow right on one. It was cool though.There was good lighting except in the area of the sofa where there was none at all.We were there 4 nights and the bed linens were never changed. I don't expect everyday but come on.Breakfast was the usual HIE fare minus potatoes and bacon runs out quickly on the few days they have it at all. They do a pretty good job keeping it up considering the masses of people. Lovely breakfast room with lots of seating.Location was ok for us.Good neighborhood across from the Ritz Carlton.

Although we started off on a bad foot due to the fact it took us a half an hour to find the hotel because of lack of signage we ended ok. The front lobby was a total demo and we were sold on the pool which wasn't open. The elevator wasn't working as it should and parking was limited. The price was right though. It was way under Value compared to other local hotels. The rooms had been tastefully renovated and were clean which is very important. We had a great view of the ocean and it was within walking distance to downtown Waikiki. We were a short less than 3km from the cruise port. The hotel staff took care of our parking and gave us a discount due to the inconveniences. The staff was very friendly and no doubt dealing with lots of unhappy inconvenienced travellers. They turned our experience around and for that I give 4 stars.

We had a very pleasant stay at this hotel, Kids loved the pool as well as the spa. I was sooo happy to sit in the spa and watch the kids swim. The games room was not yet open as they were waiting for staff to be appointed. It was nice to get coffee early in morning downstairs that was fresh every morning. Breakfast was wonderfull with lots of choices. Loved the hawaiian yogurt. Staff was friendly everywhere in hotel and helpful. Gladys that works in reception is so special and she always asked about our day and gave us good advice as to where to go to explore. Abc stores is just a 3 min walk out of hotel to grab some goodies or snacks and drinks. The room had a great view over mountain and of the ocean as well as diamond head volcano. We will return for sure. only thing that was a down side was the a/c noise.

We were in despair trying to find a good deal during February and were resigned to the fact that we would probably be less than impressed for the budget we had. The newly re-furbisheded Holiday Inn was a very pleasant surprise. We arrived on an early flight several hours early for check-in and were thrilled to be told they had our room ready and we could check-in early (we were happy to leave bags but were so happy to actually get a shower and sleep instead, winning ! The gorgeous lady even gave us a ticket for brekkie as it was about to close. We were so very grateful to her for being so thoughtful. The breakfast daily was a-mazing with plenty of variety, healthy options and a pancake machine (we are easily amused) even had our fave yoghurt and soy milk (tick tick) . Our room while small had two massive comfy beds and a newly fitted modern bathroom (with bath ), nice flat screen tv and excellent air conditioning which was so welcome as we had some very very hot weather during our stay. I really couldn't fault this hotel, the location is brilliant, easy walk to the beach and buses at your door (we used the free shuttle many times also which was slowish but if you had get the app you can plan better) very handy to get to Ala Moana or the bus exchange stops.
